instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a robotic system that is tasked with navigating to three different goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, and Goal_c) based on visual input. The robot continuously repeats the process of identifying objects using OpenVINOEvent, and then moving towards the corresponding goal. If it detects a "cat", it will move to Goal_c; if it detects a "dog", it will navigate to Goal_a; and if it detects a "cow", it will proceed to Goal_b. This cycle continues indefinitely as indicated by the num_cycles="-1" attribute in the Repeat node.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates a continuous loop where the robot responds to visual input by navigating to specific locations based on the detected object, ensuring seamless and autonomous navigation in response to its environment.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-0.579;-1.341;0.0;1.0" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="5.214;-1.533;0.0;1.0" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-1.588;1.253;0.0;1.0" />
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <ForceSuccess>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Sequence>
                            <OpenVINOEvent object="cat"/>
                            <Sequence>
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
                            </Sequence>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence>
                            <OpenVINOEvent object="dog"/>
                            <Sequence>
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                            </Sequence>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence>
                            <OpenVINOEvent object="cow"/>
                            <Sequence>
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                            </Sequence>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Fallback>
                </ForceSuccess>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <Nav2Client goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's path planning and execution. It first computes a path using the global planner (ComputePathToPose) and then runs two sub-branches in parallel. The first sub-branch involves executing the local planner to follow the computed path, while the second sub-branch controls the rate at which the global planner computes new paths.

The goal for the global planner and the resulting path are passed through the blackboard. The rate at which the global planner is invoked can be controlled with the hz parameter.

The behavior tree ensures that the robot continuously follows the path while also updating the path based on the global planner's computations. If the FollowPath operation returns SUCCESS or FAILURE, the behavior tree will return this result. Additionally, it includes mechanisms to handle goal reaching and path computation failures.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree first computes a path using the global planner (ComputePathToPose).
  Then, it runs two sub-branches in parallel. The first sub-branch is a FollowPath
  operation (the local planner). In parallel, there is a rate controlled execution of
  FollowPath (the global planner). Each time a new path is computed, the path update
  is sent to the local planner. The right branch, which is the rate controlled
  ComputePathToPose, always returns RUNNING. Because the Parallel node uses a
  threshold of 1, whenever the FollowPath returns SUCCESS or FAILURE, the parallel
  node will return this result.

  The goal (input to the global planner) and the resulting path (output of the global
  planner and input to the local planner) are passed on the blackboard.

  The rate at which the ComputePathToPose operation is invoked can be controlled with
  the hz parameter to the RateController node.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence name="root">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Fallback>
          <GoalReached/>
          <ComputePathToPose goal="${goal}"/>
        </Fallback>
      </RateController>
      <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle is programmed to follow a sequence of actions based on various conditions and events encountered during its mission.

The main behavior tree "BehaviorTree" consists of a fallback node "Core_seq" that contains sequences of actions and conditions. These include initializing, generating global and local paths, checking for obstacles, making lane changes, and following specific driving rules like keeping lanes and stopping at stop lines.

Additionally, there is a sub-tree "treeGenGlobalFollowPath" which handles the generation of a global path for the vehicle to follow.

The entire behavior tree is driven by a set of conditions and actions defined in the "TreeNodesModel".

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the decision-making process for the autonomous vehicle, guiding it through different stages of its mission such as path planning, obstacle avoidance, and adherence to traffic rules.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback name="Core_seq">
            <Sequence>
                <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
                <Action ID="stop"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="init"/>
                <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
                <Fallback name="mission_start">
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
                                <Fallback name="loc_check">
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                </Fallback>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Fallback name="lane_check">
                                <Sequence>
                                    <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
                                    <Fallback name="lane_check">
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Condition ID="checkLeftchageAble"/>
                                            <Fallback>
                                                <Sequence>
                                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                    <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                                <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Fallback>
                                            <Sequence>
                                                <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                            <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                                        </Fallback>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="Local_path">
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
                                        <Sequence name="Gen_Local">
                                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                                            <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
                                            <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Fallback name="local_check">
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
                                            <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Condition ID="checkPassAble"/>
                                <Sequence>
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                        <Action ID="stop"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="setPath"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath">
        <Fallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
                <Fallback>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="checkLetfChange"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                            <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="acc"/>
        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
        <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLeftchageAble"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLetfChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
        <Condition ID="checkPassAble"/>
        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
        <Action ID="drive"/>
        <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
        <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
        <Action ID="init"/>
        <Action ID="keepLane"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="localPathFollow"/>
        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
        <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
        <Action ID="setPath"/>
        <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
        <Action ID="stop"/>
        <SubTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree controls a robot's movement towards three different goals, Goal_a, Goal_b, and Goal_c. The robot is programmed to move sequentially towards each goal, with a waiting period between movements. If the "gohome" event is triggered, the robot will interrupt its current sequence and proceed directly to Goal_c. The waiting time between movements is set by the value of "Waiting_time". This sequence of moving towards Goal_a, waiting, moving towards Goal_b, and waiting is repeated indefinitely (-1 cycles). Once the robot completes or interrupts this repeating sequence, it proceeds to Goal_c.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's navigation behavior, ensuring it moves towards specific goals in a predefined sequence, with interruptions possible based on external events, and incorporates waiting periods between movements.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="1.17;-1.65;0.0;1.0" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="1.1;1.51;0.0;1.0" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-1.25;0.324;0.0;1.0" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Waiting_time" value="2"/>
            <Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <InterruptEvent event="gohome"/>
                    <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                        <Sequence>
                            <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                            <WaitingEvent name="waiting_event" waiting_time="{Waiting_time}"/>
                            <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                            <WaitingEvent name="waiting_event" waiting_time="{Waiting_time}"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Repeat>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Sequence>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <MoveBase goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a recovery mechanism for a robot's navigation system. If the robot encounters difficulties in navigating to a goal, it will attempt recovery actions up to 6 times. The recovery sequence involves recalculating the path to the goal and following the path, with each step having its own recovery fallback plan.

If the path calculation or following fails, the robot will clear the costmaps and then execute additional recovery actions such as spinning, waiting, and backing up. These actions are designed to help the robot overcome obstacles or issues that may have caused the initial navigation problem.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can recover from navigation failures by attempting alternative paths, clearing costmaps, and executing specific recovery actions, ultimately enabling it to reach its intended destination.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
            <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
                <RateController hz="1.0">
                    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
                        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased" />
                        <ReactiveFallback name="ComputePathToPoseRecoveryFallback">
                            <GoalUpdated />
                            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap" />
                        </ReactiveFallback>
                    </RecoveryNode>
                </RateController>
                <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
                    <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath" />
                    <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathRecoveryFallback">
                        <GoalUpdated />
                        <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap" />
                    </ReactiveFallback>
                </RecoveryNode>
            </PipelineSequence>
            <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
                <GoalUpdated />
                <RoundRobin name="RecoveryActions">
                    <Sequence name="ClearingActions">
                        <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap" />
                        <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap" />
                    </Sequence>
                    <Spin spin_dist="1.57" />
                    <Wait wait_duration="5" />
                    <BackUp backup_dist="0.15" backup_speed="0.025" />
                </RoundRobin>
            </ReactiveFallback>
        </RecoveryNode>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robotic task of handling a tray. The robot is programmed to perform a series of actions in a sequence, which includes looking at the tray, detecting handles (with retries), picking up the tray, looking up, moving back, going to a table, and placing the tray. This entire sequence is repeated once.

The "LookAtTheTray" action is followed by the "DetectHandles" action, which has a retry mechanism with a timeout of 300 milliseconds. After this, the robot picks up the tray, looks up, moves back, goes to the table, and finally places the tray. All these actions are part of a single cycle, which is repeated once.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines the steps for the robot to handle a tray, ensuring that each action is performed in a specific order and allowing for retries in case of failure during handle detection.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="1">            
                <Sequence>
                    <Action ID="LookAtTheTray"/>
                    <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
                        <Timeout msec="300">
                            <Action ID="DetectHandles"/>
                        </Timeout>
                    </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                    <Action ID="PickTray"/>
                    <Action ID="LookUp"/>
                    <Action ID="MoveBack"/>
                    <Action ID="GoToTable"/>
                    <Action ID="PlaceTray"/>                     
                </Sequence>            
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="lookAtTheTray"/>
        <Action ID="DetectHandles"/>
        <Action ID="PickTray"/>
        <Action ID="LookUp"/>
        <Action ID="MoveBack"/>
        <Action ID="GoToTable"/> 
        <Action ID="PlaceTray"/>                
        
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to control a robot's actions in a complex environment. The main task involves a sequence of actions, including waiting for a specific duration, making a plan to reach a goal, and repeating these steps multiple times. Additionally, the tree includes various utility actions such as logging messages, performing mathematical operations, subscribing to topics, and controlling the robot's movement and interactions with its surroundings.

The tree also supports decision-making through conditions and loops, enabling the robot to react based on certain criteria or iterate through sequences of actions. It can monitor and respond to external events, such as detecting fire or windows, and take appropriate actions like extinguishing fires or navigating to specific locations.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's behavior by coordinating its movements, decision-making processes, and interactions with the environment, allowing it to perform tasks effectively and autonomously.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of an entity, possibly a creature or character. The entity follows a sequence of behaviors: first, it attempts to acquire a target by guarding and then getting the target. If unsuccessful, it moves. Following this, it checks if the target is adjacent and attacks if so.

The available actions for the entity include attacking a target, eating prey, entering a shed, finding prey, finding a random pasture field, finding a retreat, finding a shed, giving birth, getting a target, and guarding while getting a target. Additionally, there are conditions such as being an adult, carnivorous, day/night time, gender-specific conditions, hunger status, location-based conditions, pregnancy, readiness to give birth, wood vermin status, and age-related conditions. 

Overall, the behavior tree models the decision-making process and actions of the entity in a dynamic environment, encompassing hunting, reproduction, shelter-seeking, and movement.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for an animal, likely a predator or prey. The tree encompasses various scenarios and actions based on conditions. 

It begins with a priority selector that includes multiple sequences. The first sequence involves acquiring a target, moving towards it, and attacking if adjacent. The second sequence, named "Hunt," occurs during specific conditions (nighttime and hunger) and involves finding prey, moving, killing, and eating. The third sequence, "Retreat," happens during daylight and includes finding a retreat, moving, and sleeping. If none of these sequences are viable, the animal will resort to a random movement.

The tree also contains numerous conditions and actions related to the animal's characteristics and behaviors, such as age, gender, hunger, reproduction, and sleep.

Overall, the behavior tree simulates the decision-making process of an animal, considering its needs, environment, and available actions.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <FallbackStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
                    <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
                </Sequence>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar name="Hunt">
                <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
                <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
                <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="KillPrey"/>
                <Action ID="EatPrey"/>

                <Action ID="FindRetreat"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                    <Action ID="Sleep"/>
                </Sequence>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
        <Condition ID="CanHaveSex"/>
        <Action ID="EatPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindRetreat"/>
        <Action ID="GetTarget"/>

        <Condition ID="IsNight"/>

        <Condition ID="IsProducer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsReadyToGiveBirth"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWoodVermin"/>
        <Condition ID="IsYoung"/>
        <Action ID="KillPrey"/>
        <Action ID="LayEgg"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <Action ID="Produce"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a repetitive interaction between a speech-to-text system and a text-to-speech system. The process involves the following steps: 
1. The speech-to-text system converts spoken words into text.
2. The text is then passed to the text-to-speech system, which vocalizes the message.
3. The vocalized message is again converted back to text using the speech-to-text system.
4. Finally, the reconverted text is once more vocalized by the text-to-speech system.

This entire sequence is repeated three times. This behavior tree essentially simulates a conversation loop where a message is spoken, converted to text, vocalized, re-converted to text, and vocalized again, all of which is repeated for a total of three cycles.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="3">
              <Sequence>
                 <SpeechToTextActionClient text="{said}" />
                 <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="{said}"/>
                 <SpeechToTextActionClient text="{said}" />
                 <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="{said}"/>
              </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's movement to three different goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c) in a repeated sequence for 3 cycles. The robot is directed to move to each goal sequentially and upon reaching each goal, it vocalizes its achievement through a text-to-speech action. This process is then repeated for the specified number of cycles.

In summary, the behavior tree controls the robot's navigation by setting goals, moving the robot to these goals using a navigation client, and providing verbal feedback at each location. This enables the robot to autonomously navigate to multiple destinations and communicate its progress.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="3">
            <Sequence>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-5.40;-5.37;0.707;-0.707" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="-3.94;-4.47;0.707;-0.707" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-4.79;-6.87;0.707;-0.707" />
                <Sequence>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                    <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="I'm at goal A" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                    <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="I'm at goal B" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
                    <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="I'm at goal C" />
                </Sequence>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <Nav2Client goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree specifies a continuous loop where a robot is programmed to detect a person using object detection. If a person is detected with a confidence level of at least 85%, the robot will perform a "Detected" speech action. If no person is detected or the confidence level is below 85%, the robot will perform a "Not Detected" speech action. This loop will repeat for 9999 cycles, indicating that the robot will continuously attempt to detect a person and provide corresponding feedback through speech actions.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<Repeat num_cycles="9999">
			<Sequence>
				<Fallback>
					<Sequence>
						<ObjectDetectionAction class="person" pose="detected_Pose" min_confidence="0.85" />
						<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Detected" />
					</Sequence>
					<Sequence>
						<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Not Detected" />
					</Sequence>

				</Fallback>
			</Sequence>
		</Repeat>
	</BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a conversational system. It continuously listens to the user, repeating a sequence of actions if the user speaks and responding with "I'm sorry, but I didn't hear you" if no speech is detected. The robot will keep listening and responding in a loop for 999 cycles. After completing the cycles, it will say "Goodbye" as a closing message.

This behavior tree essentially creates a conversational loop where the robot listens for the user's input, responds accordingly, and then repeats the process or ends the conversation after a set number of cycles.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<Sequence>
			<Repeat num_cycles="999">
			<Fallback>
				<Sequence>
					<Delay delay_msec="3000">
	          <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Say something" />
					</Delay>
					<SpeechToTextActionClient text="{said}" />
					<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="You said" />
					<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="{said}" />
				</Sequence>

				<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="I'm sorry, but I didn't here you" />
			</Fallback>
			</Repeat>
			<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Goodbye" />
		</Sequence>
	</BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree orchestrates a sequence of actions for a robot. It begins by disabling pose detection control, then initiates tracking in scan mode at a rate of 3. Following this, it triggers a text-to-speech action to say "Start", waits for the scanning process to complete with the ScanWaitAction, and then speaks "End" using text-to-speech. Finally, it switches the tracking mode to "Track" at a rate of 3. This sequence of actions likely corresponds to a specific task or behavior that the robot is expected to perform, such as scanning an environment, providing audio cues, and adjusting its tracking behavior.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<Sequence>
		  <PoseDetectionControlAction enable="false" />

      <TrackAction mode="Scan" rate="3" />
      <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Start" />
      <ScanWaitAction />
      <TextToSpeechActionClient msg="End" />
      <TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" />

		</Sequence>

	</BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is a simple navigation system for a robot. It starts by computing a path to a specified goal using the global planner and then follows this path using the local planner. The goal location and the computed path are stored in the blackboard for reference. This behavior tree essentially orchestrates the process of navigating the robot from its current position to a specified goal, ensuring that it follows a valid path generated by the global planner and executes the necessary actions to reach the goal using the local planner.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree does the bare minimum - it invokes ComputePathToPose to
  compute a path using the global planner. It then invokes the local planner
  (FollowPath) with this path. The path endpoints (input to the global planner)
  and the resulting path (output of the global planner and input to the local
  planner) are passed on the blackboard.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <SequenceStar name="root">
      <ComputePathToPose goal="${goal}" path="${path}"/>
      <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
    </SequenceStar>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for a robot. The robot is programmed to perform various tasks based on the status of its components and its current state.

Initially, it checks the status of its components (battery, laser, camera) and takes appropriate actions such as reconfiguring modes or navigating to a recharge station if necessary. If the battery needs recharging, it navigates to a designated recharge station and initiates the recharging process.

If the components are functioning normally, the robot enters a patrolling mode where it navigates through a series of waypoints (wp_1 to wp_7), effectively patrolling the area.

The behavior tree includes actions such as checking components, navigation to specific waypoints, recharging, and reconfiguring operational modes based on component statuses. This behavior tree allows the robot to autonomously manage its energy levels and component functionality while performing its designated tasks.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Fallback>
                <Action ID="CheckComponent" component="battery"/>
                <Sequence name="recharging">
                    <Fallback>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Action ID="CheckComponent" component="laser"/>
                            <Action ID="Reconfigure" mode="f_energy_saving_mode"/>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Action ID="CheckComponent" component="camera"/>
                            <Action ID="Reconfigure" mode="f_degraded_mode"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="recharge_station" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="Recharge"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Action ID="CheckComponent" component="laser"/>
                        <Action ID="Reconfigure" mode="f_normal_mode"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Action ID="CheckComponent" component="camera"/>
                        <Action ID="Reconfigure" mode="f_degraded_mode"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
                <SequenceStar name="patrolling">
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_1" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_2" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_3" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_4" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_5" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_6" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                    <Action ID="NavigateToWp" goal="wp_7" name="navigate_to_wp"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </Sequence>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="CheckComponent">
            <input_port name="component"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="NavigateToWp">
            <input_port name="goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Recharge"/>
        <Action ID="Reconfigure">
            <input_port name="mode"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.

These actions include various functionalities such as moving robotic arms, checking battery levels, detecting faces, controlling gaze, obtaining sensor data, giving feedback, navigation, speaking, and waiting for specified durations.

Overall, the behavior tree seems to be designed for orchestrating a wide range of robot behaviors and interactions, including perception, decision-making, and action execution. The provided actions cover a diverse set of capabilities, indicating that the behavior tree is intended for a versatile and complex robotic system capable of performing various tasks in different scenarios.

<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot. Initially, it processes data from a camera feed to identify faces and selects the closest one for interaction. Subsequently, the robot gazes at the identified face, performs an arm gesture, speaks a phrase, waits for a few seconds, and then lowers its arms. If interrupted during this sequence, it transitions to patrolling behavior, where it moves through a series of predefined locations.

The "Patrol" subtree contains logic for moving the robot to different waypoints based on its current state. The robot cycles through four waypoints, updating its state after each movement. This behavior allows the robot to navigate a predetermined path while maintaining awareness of its location.

Additionally, the behavior tree includes various reusable actions and conditions that can be utilized in different parts of the robot's decision-making process, such as checking battery levels, comparing values, or performing specific arm movements.

Overall, the behavior tree enables the robot to engage with humans by reacting to their presence, speaking,
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="GetPoseArray" name="Faces" pose_array="faceList" topic="/faces"/>
                <Action ID="SelectPose" name="Closest face" pose_array="{faceList}" pose_stamped="closest_face" position_in_list="0"/>
                <Action ID="TimerAction" s_between_success="10"/>
                <Action ID="GazeAtTarget" action_name="gaze" fixation_pose="{closest_face}" frame_id="base_footprint"/>
                <Action ID="ArmRoutines" gesture="HAPPY_EMOTIVE" topic="/vizzyArmRoutines/right/command"/>
                <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="Ora viva" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
                <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="3"/>
                <Action ID="ArmRoutines" gesture="ARMS_DOWN" topic="/vizzyArmRoutines/right/command"/>
            </Sequence>
            <SubTree ID="Patrol"/>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Patrol">
        <Switch3 case_1="0" case_2="1" case_3="2" variable="{state}">
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="MoveBase" action_name="move_base" frame_id="map" goal_pose="0.568;0.5395;0;0;0;0.0347;0.99939"/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="state" value="1"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="MoveBase" action_name="move_base" frame_id="map" goal_pose="-16.48;-0.2331;0;0;0;0.6178;0.78627"/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="state" value="2"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="MoveBase" action_name="move_base" frame_id="map" goal_pose="-16.129;16.7376;0;0;0;0.05602;0.9984"/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="state" value="3"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="MoveBase" action_name="move_base" frame_id="map" goal_pose="1.13;5.56;0;0;0;-0.1487;0.9888"/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="state" value="0"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Switch3>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ArmCartesian">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="pose"/>
            <input_port name="type"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ArmRoutines">
            <input_port name="gesture"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Charge">
            <input_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="CheckBattery">
            <output_port name="battery_state" type="int"/>
            <output_port name="percentage" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CheckBool">
            <input_port name="variable"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="CheckCharging">
            <output_port name="charging_state" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CompareDouble">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <Condition ID="CompareInt">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="DebugAction">
            <input_port name="string" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Destroy"/>
        <Action ID="DetectFaces">
            <output_port name="faceListOut"/>
            <input_port name="face_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FaceCounter">
            <input_port name="faceListIn"/>
            <input_port name="number_faces"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GazeAtTarget">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="fixation_pose"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetFloat64">
            <output_port name="number" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetInt16">
            <output_port name="number"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetPoseArray">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GiveFeedback">
            <input_port default="850" name="almost_thr"/>
            <input_port name="correct_blocks"/>
            <input_port name="incorrect_blocks"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="personality"/>
            <input_port name="score"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveBase">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="goal_pose"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveTorso">
            <input_port name="angle"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="Patrol"/>
        <Action ID="ResetVars"/>
        <Action ID="SelectBlock">
            <input_port name="block_list" type="social_cues::BlockList_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <output_port name="block_pose" type="geometry_msgs::PoseStamped_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectFieldFromPoseStamped">
            <input_port name="field"/>
            <output_port name="output_val"/>
            <input_port name="pose_stamped"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectPose">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="pose_stamped"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SenseScore">
            <output_port name="score"/>
            <input_port name="score_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Speak">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="language"/>
            <input_port name="utterance"/>
            <input_port name="voice"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="TimerAction">
            <input_port name="s_between_success">Time (s) before this node returns SUCCESS. It will return FAILURE in the meanwhile</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds">
            <input_port default="SUCCESS" name="result">Result after specified time: SUCCESS or FAILURE</input_port>
            <input_port default="5" name="seconds">Time in seconds</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree defines a sequence of actions for a robotic system. It involves repeating a series of actions for a specified number of cycles. The robot first checks its state against a desired sequence, and if it fails, it triggers a replanning action. Following this, it enters a reactive sequence where it checks the locomotion status and performs recovery actions if necessary. Then, it attempts to execute a move action based on a given navigation goal, triggering replanning if unsuccessful. After each cycle, it updates its state and the desired sequence based on the performed action.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's decision-making process, ensuring it follows a predefined sequence of actions while handling failures and updating its internal state. This allows the robot to adapt to changing conditions and continue executing its tasks effectively.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="Replanning2"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck"/>
                        <Timeout msec="">
                            <Sequence>
                                <Action ID="RecoveryStand"/>
                                <Action ID="LocomotionStart"/>
                            </Sequence>
                        </Timeout>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="MoveAction" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart"/>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck"/>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand"/>
        <Action ID="Replanning2"/>
        <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <output_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to control a robotic system's actions. It consists of a sequence that repeats a specified number of times. Within each repetition, it attempts a series of actions and handles potential failures.

The first step involves performing a pre-check on the system's state and executed sequence against the desired sequence. If this check fails, a replanning request at level 2 is issued. Next, based on a switch condition, the system either moves, stays in place, or performs a synchronized transition. Each action has associated checks and failure handling.

After these steps, the system updates its desired sequence and executed sequence based on the performed action. This process repeats for the specified number of cycles.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's actions, including movement, status checks, recovery, and replanning, while ensuring robustness through error handling and sequence updates.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback>
                    <Switch3 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="synchronized_transition" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                        <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                        <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                        <AlwaysFailure/>
                    </Switch3>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree outlines a simple task for a robot to follow a path to a specified goal. It first computes a path to the given goal using a planner with the ID "GridBased", and then follows the computed path using a controller with the ID "FollowPath". This behavior tree is designed to enable the robot to autonomously navigate to a specific location by generating a path plan and executing it through path following.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence>
      <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for a robot. The robot is programmed to perform various tasks based on certain conditions and actions. 

Initially, it will attempt to follow a sequence of actions, such as going to a known room or following a human. If these actions are not feasible, it will move to alternative sequences, like finding a bottle, grasping it, and locating its position. These sequences involve checking conditions (e.g., whether the bottle is found or located) and executing corresponding actions (e.g., computing inverse pose, grasping the bottle).

If none of the primary or alternative sequences can be executed, the robot will resort to asking for help. Throughout this decision-making process, the robot also performs checks on its environment, such as determining if it is in a known room or if the inverse pose is valid.

Overall, the behavior tree guides the robot through a series of tasks, prioritizing different actions based on the prevailing conditions.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Root>
            <Fallback name="FB1">
                <Sequence name="S1">
                    <Fallback name="FB2">
                        <Sequence name="S7">
                            <Condition ID="Room_known"/>
                            <Fallback name="FB10">
                                <Condition ID="Robot_in_room"/>
                                <Action ID="Go_to_room"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Action ID="FollowHuman"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Sequence name="S2">
                        <Fallback name="FB3">
                            <Condition ID="Bottle_found"/>
                            <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="FB4">
                            <Condition ID="Bottle_grasped"/>
                            <Fallback name="FB5">
                                <Sequence name="S3">
                                    <Fallback name="FB7">
                                        <Sequence name="S6">
                                            <Condition ID="Inv_pose_computed"/>
                                            <Condition ID="Inv_pose_valid"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="Compute_inv_pose"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Sequence name="S4">
                                        <Fallback name="FB8">
                                            <Condition ID="Robot_at_inv_pose"/>
                                            <Sequence name="S8">
                                                <Action ID="Keep_arms_for_grasp"/>
                                                <Action ID="Go_to_inv_pose"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                        </Fallback>
                                        <Sequence name="S5">
                                            <Fallback name="FB9">
                                                <Condition ID="Bottle_located"/>
                                                <Action ID="Locate_bottle"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Action ID="Grasp_bottle"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Sequence>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Action ID="Set_inv_pose_not_valid"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
            </Fallback>
        </Root>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_found"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_grasped"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_located"/>
        <Action ID="Compute_inv_pose"/>
        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="FollowHuman"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_inv_pose"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_room"/>
        <Action ID="Grasp_bottle"/>
        <Condition ID="Inv_pose_computed"/>
        <Condition ID="Inv_pose_valid"/>
        <Action ID="Keep_arms_for_grasp"/>
        <Action ID="Keep_running"/>
        <Action ID="Locate_bottle"/>
        <Condition ID="Robot_at_inv_pose"/>
        <Condition ID="Robot_in_room"/>
        <Condition ID="Room_known"/>
        <Action ID="Set_inv_pose_not_valid"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--------------------------------------->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a sequence of tasks for a drone. Initially, the drone is instructed to take off, then follow a specific path, and finally land. Each task is represented as an "Action" with a unique task description. The first action instructs the drone to take off, followed by following a predefined path, and lastly landing.

The "BehaviorTask" action node takes in a task description as input, which specifies the action to be performed along with any additional parameters required for that action. In this case, the task descriptions include "TAKE_OFF", "FOLLOW_PATH", and "LAND", each accompanied by relevant parameters such as the path coordinates for the "FOLLOW_PATH" task.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the drone's sequential execution of these tasks, ensuring it follows a specific set of actions in order to achieve its objectives.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <Action ID="BehaviorTask" task_description="TAKE_OFF;;1"/>
            <Action ID="BehaviorTask" task_description="FOLLOW_PATH;path: [ [1, 1, 3] ];1"/>
            <Action ID="BehaviorTask" task_description="LAND;;1"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="BehaviorTask">
            <input_port name="task_description"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle is programmed to perform various driving maneuvers based on the surrounding conditions and external inputs.

The main behavior tree consists of a fallback sequence, where the vehicle will attempt different reactive sequences based on specific conditions. These include pulling over, pulling out, side shifting, lane change, and avoidance maneuvers. If none of these reactive sequences are applicable, the vehicle defaults to lane following.

Additionally, there are two separate behavior trees labeled "a" and "b", each containing a reactive fallback sequence for specific maneuvers - lane change and avoidance respectively. These sequences involve checking for approval and executing the corresponding action.

The TreeNodesModel section provides details about the various conditions, actions, and sub-trees involved in the decision-making process, including readiness checks, requests, and output descriptions for each action.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the vehicle's decision-making process for safe and efficient navigation on the road.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="PullOver_Request"/>
                <Condition ID="PullOver_Ready"/>
                <Action ID="PullOver_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="PullOut_Request"/>
                <Condition ID="PullOut_Ready"/>
                <Action ID="PullOut_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="SideShift_Request"/>
                <Condition ID="SideShift_Ready"/>
                <Action ID="SideShift_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="LaneChange_Request"/>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LaneChange_Ready"/>
                    <Condition ID="ForceLaneChange_ForceApproval"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="LaneChange_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="Avoidance_Request"/>
                <Condition ID="Avoidance_Ready"/>
                <Action ID="Avoidance_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <Action ID="LaneFollowing_Plan" output="{output}"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="a">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Condition ID="LaneChange_CheckApproval"/>
            <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
                <Action ID="LaneChange_PlanCandidate" output="{output}"/>
            </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="b">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Condition ID="Avoidance_CheckApproval"/>
            <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
                <Action ID="Avoidance_PlanCandidate" output="{output}"/>
            </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="Avoidance_CheckApproval"/>
        <Action ID="Avoidance_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Avoidance_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="Avoidance_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="Avoidance_Request"/>
        <Condition ID="ExternalApproval"/>
        <Condition ID="ForceApproval"/>
        <Condition ID="ForceLaneChange_ForceApproval"/>
        <Condition ID="LaneChange_CheckApproval"/>
        <Action ID="LaneChange_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LaneChange_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LaneChange_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="LaneChange_Request"/>
        <Action ID="LaneFollowing_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="boost::optional<tier4_planning_msgs::PathWithLaneId_<std::allocator<void> > >">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LaneFollowing_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output_candidate" type="boost::optional<tier4_planning_msgs::PathWithLaneId_<std::allocator<void> > >">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LaneFollowing_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="LaneFollowing_Request"/>
        <Action ID="PullOut_Plan">
            <output_port name="output"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="PullOut_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="PullOut_Request"/>
        <Action ID="PullOver_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="PullOver_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="PullOver_Request"/>
        <Condition ID="SideShift_CheckApproval"/>
        <Action ID="SideShift_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SideShift_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="SideShift_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="SideShift_Request"/>
        <SubTree ID="SubTree"/>
        <SubTree ID="a"/>
        <SubTree ID="b"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's movement and communication. Initially, the robot is instructed to move to a specific location defined by "move_goal" coordinates (1;2;3) and then communicate the result. The "MoveRobot" subtree handles the actual movement, attempting to reach the specified goal. If successful, it updates the output with "mission accomplished". In case of failure, it updates the output with "mission failed".

In summary, the main sequence sets the move goal, triggers the robot's movement using the "MoveRobot" subtree, and then communicates the outcome. The "MoveRobot" subtree employs a fallback mechanism, attempting to move to the specified location and updating the output accordingly based on success or failure.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="main_sequence">
            <SetBlackboard output_key="move_goal" value="1;2;3" />
            <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="move_goal" output="move_result" />
            <SaySomething message="{move_result}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Fallback name="move_robot_main">
            <SequenceStar>
                <MoveBase       goal="{target}"/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="output" value="mission accomplished" />
            </SequenceStar>
            <ForceFailure>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="output" value="mission failed" />
            </ForceFailure>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the automatic cleaning and preparation of a coffee machine. It ensures that the machine is clean, has enough water, and handles various tasks such as filling the water tank, emptying the waste container, selecting the desired type of coffee, adding milk or sugar if desired, and placing the cup for dispensing coffee.

The "AutoClean" behavior includes sub-behaviors to manage the water tank and waste container. The "CoffeType" behavior handles the selection and preparation of the desired type of coffee, including adding milk or sugar if needed. The "OpenCoffeMachine" behavior deals with ensuring the machine is open and ready for use, while "PutCoffeCup" manages placing the cup in position for dispensing.

Overall, the behavior tree coordinates a series of actions and checks to automate the process of preparing and cleaning the coffee machine, ensuring it is ready for use and can dispense the desired type of coffee.
output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="AutoClean">
        <Fallback>
            <Condition ID="IsCleanProcessFinished"/>
            <Fallback>
                <Condition ID="IsThereEnoughWater"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Timeout msec="5000">
                        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankRemoved"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Timeout msec="5000">
                            <Condition ID="IsWaterTankFull"/>
                        </Timeout>
                        <Action ID="FillWaterTank"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="100">
                        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankPlacedInCoffeMachine"/>
                    </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
            <Fallback>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsMarroTankFull"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Sequence>
                    <Timeout msec="5000">
                        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankRemoved"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Timeout msec="5000">
                            <Condition ID="IsMarroTankEmpty"/>
                        </Timeout>
                        <Action ID="EmptyMarroTank"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="100">
                        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankPlacedInCoffeMachine"/>
                    </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SubTree ID="OpenCoffeMachine" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
            <SubTree ID="AutoClean" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
            <SubTree ID="PutCoffeCup" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
            <SubTree ID="CoffeType" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="CoffeType">
        <Sequence>
            <Fallback>
                <Timeout msec="5000">
                    <Condition ID="IsDesiredCoffeSelected"/>
                </Timeout>
                <Action ID="PressDesiredCoffe"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Timeout msec="5000">
                <Condition ID="IsCoffeFinished"/>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="5000">
                <Condition ID="HasCupOffCoffeBeenRemoved"/>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="5000">
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedCleaningCup"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Action ID="PlaceCleanCup"/>
                        <Action ID="SwitchOffCoffeMachine"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="5000">
                <Fallback name="arallel">
                    <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedMilk"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Inverter>
                                <Condition ID="IsMilkDesired"/>
                            </Inverter>
                            <Action ID="AddMilktoCoffe"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Inverter>
                                <Condition ID="IsSugarDesired"/>
                            </Inverter>
                            <Action ID="AddSugarToCoffe"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
            </Timeout>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="OpenCoffeMachine">
        <Fallback>
            <Condition ID="IsMachineOpen"/>
            <Sequence>
                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="10">
                    <Condition ID="IsCleanCupReady"/>
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                <Fallback>
                    <Timeout msec="5000">
                        <Condition ID="IsMachineOpen"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Action ID="SwitchOnCoffeMachine"/>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="PutCoffeCup">
        <Fallback>
            <Timeout msec="5000">
                <Condition ID="IsCoffeCupReady"/>
            </Timeout>
            <Action ID="PlaceCoffeCup"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AddMilktoCoffe"/>
        <Action ID="AddSugarToCoffe"/>
        <SubTree ID="AutoClean">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <SubTree ID="CoffeType">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="EmptyMarroTank"/>
        <Action ID="FillWaterTank"/>
        <Condition ID="HasCupOffCoffeBeenRemoved"/>
        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedCleaningCup"/>
        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedMilk"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCleanCupReady"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCleanProcessFinished"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCoffeCupReady"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCoffeFinished"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDesiredCoffeSelected"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMachineOpen"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankEmpty"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankPlacedInCoffeMachine"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankRemoved"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMilkDesired"/>
        <Condition ID="IsSugarDesired"/>
        <Condition ID="IsThereEnoughWater"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankPlacedInCoffeMachine"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankRemoved"/>
        <SubTree ID="OpenCoffeMachine">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="PlaceCleanCup"/>
        <Action ID="PlaceCoffeCup"/>
        <Action ID="PressDesiredCoffe"/>
        <SubTree ID="PutCoffeCup">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="SwitchOffCoffeMachine"/>
        <Action ID="SwitchOnCoffeMachine"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>
