instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree defines a sequence of actions to be executed. The actions involve input and output ports, where some actions have default values for their ports. These actions are named "inOnlyA," "inOnlyB," "outOnlyA," "outOnlyB," "outOnlyC," "outOnlyD," "outOnlyE," and "outOnlyF." 

In the sequence, "inOnlyA" and "inOnlyB" actions are performed with specific input values or defaults. Then, "outOnlyA," "outOnlyB," "outOnlyC," "outOnlyD," "outOnlyE," and "outOnlyF" actions are executed, each producing an output value.

The XML also includes a TreeNodesModel that further details the input and output ports for each action.

Overall, this behavior tree seems to represent a series of interconnected actions with input and output data flow, possibly as part of a larger system or process.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence name="Sequence1">
            <Action ID="inOnlyA" in0=""/>
            <Action ID="inOnlyB" in0="ice"/>
            <Action ID="inOnlyB" in0=""/>
            <Action ID="inOnlyA" in0="  ${foo.baz}"/>
            <Action ID="outOnlyA" out0=""/>
            <Action ID="outOnlyB" out0="baz"/>
            <Action ID="outOnlyC" out0="${baz}"/>
            <Action ID="outOnlyD" out0="${foo.goo}"/>
            <Action ID="outOnlyE" out0="${fan}"/>
            <Action ID="outOnlyF" out0="${long.untraveled.path}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="inOnlyA">
            <input_port name="in0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="inOnlyB">
            <input_port default="foo" name="in0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="outOnlyA">
            <output_port name="out0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="outOnlyB">
            <output_port default="${baz}" name="out0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="outOnlyC">
            <output_port name="out0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="outOnlyD">
            <output_port name="out0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="outOnlyE">
            <output_port name="out0"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="outOnlyF">
            <output_port name="out0"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate while continuously replanning its global path after every 1 meter of movement. It uses a PipelineSequence consisting of two steps: 
1. DistanceController: This step computes a new path to the goal pose using the "GridBased" planner whenever the robot has moved 1 meter.
2. FollowPath: The robot then follows the computed path using the specified controller.

This approach ensures that the robot dynamically adjusts its path to reach the goal, taking into account any changes in the environment or obstacles encountered during navigation.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path after every 1m.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <DistanceController distance="1.0">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </DistanceController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate with periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions. It uses a recovery node with a set number of retries, and within it, a pipeline sequence for navigation with replanning. The rate controller ensures the frequency of path computation. If there are failures in computing or following the path, recovery nodes handle retries and recovery actions such as clearing costmaps, spinning, and waiting. The reactive fallback handles goal updates and triggers recovery actions when necessary. This behavior tree aims to ensure robust navigation by periodically replanning the path, handling failures, and recovering from unexpected situations.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
          <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a sequence of actions for a robot. Initially, it adjusts the head and torso positions before moving to specific locations using the base. Subsequently, it manipulates the arm joints to assume different poses at each location. The head and torso adjustments are made in between movements. Finally, the robot returns to a resting pose.

In summary, the behavior tree commands the robot to perform a series of coordinated movements and pose adjustments, demonstrating a predefined set of actions that the robot should execute sequentially.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <HeadControl pitch="0.0" yaw="90.0" />
            <TorsoControl relative_height="0.4" />
            <MoveBase goal="0;-3;0"/>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="UPTRAY" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <HeadControl pitch="-45.0" yaw="90.0" />
            <MoveBase goal="1;-3;0"/>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="EXTENDED" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <HeadControl pitch="45.0" yaw="90.0" />
            <MoveBase goal="2;-3;0"/>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="GRIPPING" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <HeadControl pitch="0.0" yaw="90.0" />
            <MoveBase goal="3;-3;0"/>
            <HeadControl pitch="0.0" yaw="120.0" />
            <TorsoControl relative_height="1" />
            <TorsoControl relative_height="0" />
            <TorsoControl relative_height="0.4" />
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="REST" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a system to dynamically navigate towards a certain pose while continuously replanning its path. The system operates at a frequency of 1 Hz and follows a sequence that involves updating the goal, computing a path to the updated goal using a GridBased planner, truncating the computed path to a certain distance, and then continuously following the truncated path until failure. This approach allows the system to adapt to changes in the environment or the goal pose by updating the path and ensuring it can navigate to the desired location effectively.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree follows a dynamic pose to a certain distance
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Sequence>
          <GoalUpdater input_goal="{goal}" output_goal="{updated_goal}">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{updated_goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          </GoalUpdater>
         <TruncatePath distance="1.0" input_path="{path}" output_path="{truncated_path}"/>
        </Sequence>
      </RateController>
      <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        <FollowPath path="{truncated_path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree outlines a navigation system for a robot that involves periodic global path replanning at a frequency of 1 Hz. The robot's movement is controlled by a pipeline sequence consisting of a speed controller and a path following component. The speed controller regulates the robot's speed based on the planned path, with the ability to adjust the speed between a minimum and maximum rate. Additionally, it computes the path to a specified goal using the "GridBased" planner and filters the computed path over a duration of 0.3 seconds. Subsequently, the FollowPath component directs the robot to follow the computed path. This behavior tree ensures that the robot navigates while continuously updating its global path to adapt to changing environmental conditions.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <SpeedController min_rate="0.1" max_rate="1.0" min_speed="0.0" max_speed="0.26" filter_duration="0.3">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </SpeedController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a task for an agent to perform over 100 cycles. During each cycle, the agent is expected to execute three actions in parallel: engage in a dialog, perform a social navigation action (specifically escorting), and potentially respond to a stop condition. The success of the overall task is determined by the successful completion of at least one of these actions within each cycle. If all actions fail, the cycle is considered a failure.

This behavior tree seems to represent a scenario where an agent is repeatedly engaging in social interactions and navigation tasks, with the expectation that at least one of these actions will be successfully completed within each cycle. The use of repetition and parallel execution suggests a continuous and adaptive engagement with the environment, possibly in a social or interactive context.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <Repeat num_cycles="100">
                <Parallel success_threshold="1" failure_threshold="1">
                    <Dialog name="dialog"/>
                    <SocialNav2Action 
                            name="social_nav2_action" 
                            goal="escort" 
                            agent_id="agent_1"/>
                    <!--<StopCondition stop_topic="/social_nav2_bt_action/stop"/>-->
                </Parallel>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
     </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for an animal, likely a predator or prey. The tree includes various sequences and fallbacks to determine the animal's actions based on its current state and environmental conditions.

The main sequence consists of:
1. Attempting to get a target
2. Moving towards the target
3. If the target is adjacent, attacking it

If the above sequence fails, the tree falls back to other options such as hunting, retreating, or making a random move. These fallbacks are determined by conditions like time of day, hunger, and reproductive status.

Additionally, the tree contains a range of actions and conditions that govern the animal's behavior, including finding prey, eating, sleeping, and reproducing.

Overall, the behavior tree simulates the decision-making process of an animal in a dynamic environment, considering factors such as survival, reproduction, and sustenance.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <FallbackStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
                    <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
                </Sequence>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar name="Hunt">
                <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
                <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
                <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="KillPrey"/>
                <Action ID="EatPrey"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar name="Retreat">
                <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                <Action ID="FindRetreat"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                    <Action ID="Sleep"/>
                </Sequence>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
        <Condition ID="CanHaveSex"/>
        <Action ID="EatPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindRetreat"/>
        <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
        <Action ID="GiveBirth"/>
        <Condition ID="IsAdult"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCarnivore"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
        <Condition ID="IsEgg"/>
        <Condition ID="IsEggLayer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsFemale"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHerbivore"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMale"/>
        <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
        <Condition ID="IsPregnant"/>
        <Condition ID="IsProducer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsReadyToGiveBirth"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWoodVermin"/>
        <Condition ID="IsYoung"/>
        <Action ID="KillPrey"/>
        <Action ID="LayEgg"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <Action ID="Produce"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
        <Action ID="TryHaveSex"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a complex set of tasks for a robot. It includes various sub-trees and actions such as moving towards specific goals, interacting with objects using a robotic arm, reacting to events like "gohome" or "IsArretUrgence", and making decisions based on conditions like the presence of certain objects or the robot's movement status.

The main behavior tree ("BehaviorTree") orchestrates the robot's high-level behavior, including handling emergency stops, checking for the presence of a key, initializing the robot, and performing specific tasks at yellow and violet camps.

Additionally, there are sub-trees for specific tasks such as taking and placing pallets, testing different suction cups, and dealing with goldenium. These sub-trees involve intricate sequences of movements and interactions with the environment.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines a comprehensive set of behaviors for the robot, encompassing navigation, manipulation of objects, decision-making based on environmental conditions, and reacting to external events.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="rosbag_r1">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Inverter>
                <Condition ID="IsArretUrgence"/>
            </Inverter>
            <Condition ID="IsTirettePresente"/>
            <SequenceStar>
                <SubTree ID="initRobot"/>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Action ID="AfficherLeScore"/>
                    <ReactiveFallback>
                        <SubTree ID="campJaune"/>
                        <SubTree ID="campViolet"/>
                    </ReactiveFallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
            </SequenceStar>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="TesterToutesLesVentouses">
        <Fallback>
            <SubTree ID="VentouseD"/>
            <SubTree ID="VentouseCD"/>

        </ReactiveFallback>

    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="rosbag_r1">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsCampViolet"/>
                </Inverter>
                <ReactiveFallback>
                    <Sequence>

            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Condition ID="IsCampViolet"/>

                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="IsTirettePresente"/>
                        <Action ID="DefinirLeScore" score="1"/>
                        <Action ID="AfficherLeScore"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <ReactiveFallback>
                        <Condition ID="ScoreInferieurA" score="51"/>
                        <Sequence>

                                <Action nom="r1_homol.bag" ID="JouerUnRosbag" topics="/r1/mobile_base_controller/cmd_vel"/>

    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AfficheYeux">

        <SubTree ID="Initialisation"/>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle's actions are determined by various conditions and sequences within the tree. 

The tree starts with a fallback node, which contains multiple sequences and conditions. It checks for mission wait, existence of a global path, and potential lane changes based on certain conditions. If these conditions are met, it initializes actions such as generating paths, changing lanes, or following a global path.

Further, the tree evaluates if there are obstacles in front, and based on that, decides whether to change lanes, follow local paths, or stop. Additionally, it considers factors like proximity to stop lines and corners, collision risks, and profitability of keeping the current lane.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the vehicle's decision-making process, encompassing actions related to navigation, obstacle avoidance, lane changes, and path following based on a set of predefined conditions and sequences.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback name="Core_seq">
            <Sequence name="">
                <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
                <Action ID="stop"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="">
                <Sequence name="">
                    <Condition ID="checkExistPathGlobal"/>
                    <Action ID="init"/>
                    <Fallback name="">
                        <Sequence name="">
                            <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
                            <Fallback name="">
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkLeftChange"/>
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
                                        <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeLeft"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                            <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
                                        <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeRight"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                            <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </Sequence>
                <Fallback name="">
                    <Sequence name="">
                        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
                        <Fallback name="">
                            <Sequence name="">
                                <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
                                <Fallback name="loc_check">
                                    <Sequence name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Sequence name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Sequence name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                </Fallback>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Fallback name="lane_check">
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
                                    <Fallback name="lane_check">
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Condition ID="checkLeftchageAble"/>
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
                                                <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeLeft"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Sequence name="">
                                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                    <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                                <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
                                                <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeRight"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Sequence name="">
                                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                    <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                                <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="Local_path">
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
                                        <Sequence name="Gen_Local">
                                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                                            <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
                                            <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Fallback name="local_check">
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
                                            <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                                            <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence name="">
                        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                        <Fallback name="">
                            <Sequence name="">
                                <Condition ID="checkPassAble"/>
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Sequence name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                        <Action ID="stop"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="setPath"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="acc"/>
        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkExistPathGlobal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
        <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>

        <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLeftChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLeftchageAble"/>
        <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
        <Condition ID="checkPassAble"/>
        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
        <Action ID="drive"/>
        <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
        <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
        <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="init"/>
        <Action ID="keepLane"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="localPathFollow"/>
        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
        <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
        <Action ID="setPath"/>
        <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
        <Action ID="stop"/>
        <SubTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robotic system that reacts to different conditions while attempting to achieve a specific goal. The robot first checks the distance between its end effector and a target position, then proceeds with a sequence of actions based on the outcome of this check. If the end effector's y-coordinate is below a certain threshold, it performs a set of movements to reach a third goal. If the end effector's z-coordinate is above a specified threshold, it executes a series of movements to reach a second goal. Finally, regardless of the previous conditions, the robot sets a first goal for its motion planning. This behavior tree allows the robot to dynamically respond to its environment and adjust its actions based on real-time feedback.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "ObstacleTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="ObstacleTree">
        <ReactiveFallback name="root_sequence">
            <EEPositionDistance name="goal_check"
                    threshold="0.05"
                    target_x="-0.5"
                    target_y="0.0"
                    target_z="0.8"
                    ee_x="{ee_x}"
                    ee_y="{ee_y}"
                    ee_z="{ee_z}"/>
            <ReactiveSequence name="3-goal">
                <EEYThreshold   name="ee_y_threshold" threshold="{y_threshold}" ee_y="{ee_y}" above="false"/> 
                <SetMGGoal   name="mg_goal3"
                    mp_param_x="{mp_3_x}"
                    mp_param_y="{mp_3_y}"
                    mp_param_z="{mp_3_z}"
                    mg_trans_x="{mg_trans_x}"
                    mg_trans_y="{mg_trans_y}"
                    mg_trans_z="{mg_trans_z}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence name="2-traverse">
                <EEZThreshold   name="ee_z_threshold" threshold="{z_threshold}" ee_z="{ee_z}" above="true"/> 
                <SetMGGoal   name="mg_goal2"
                    mp_param_x="{mp_2_x}"
                    mp_param_y="{mp_2_y}"
                    mp_param_z="{mp_2_z}"
                    mg_trans_x="{mg_trans_x}"
                    mg_trans_y="{mg_trans_y}"
                    mg_trans_z="{mg_trans_z}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <SetMGGoal   name="mg_goal1"
                    mp_param_x="{mp_1_x}"
                    mp_param_y="{mp_1_y}"
                    mp_param_z="{mp_1_z}"
                    mg_trans_x="{mg_trans_x}"
                    mg_trans_y="{mg_trans_y}"
                    mg_trans_z="{mg_trans_z}"/>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robotic system with various actions and behaviors. The robot is programmed to perform multiple tasks simultaneously using the "Parallel" node, such as executing a variant action repeatedly and moving to different positions based on a switch case. It also includes sequences of actions for specific cases within the switch case.

Additionally, it contains a set of defined actions that the robot can perform, including activating localization, approaching a location or wall, getting base charging status, obtaining person pose, initializing navigation, loading maps, moving robot position and orientation, recognizing people, setting robot pose, and starting/stopping joystick and reactive navigation.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's activities by coordinating parallel and sequential execution of tasks, allowing it to perform complex behaviors involving movement, perception, and decision-making.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Parallel threshold="1">
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <Action ID="VariantAction" value="{variant}"/>
            </Repeat>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="1000" y="0"/>
                <Switch2 case_1="one" case_2="two" variable="{variant}">
                    <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="3000" y="-1000"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="-2000" y="-1000"/>
                        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="0" y="0"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="2000" y="-3000"/>
                        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="2000" y="-2000"/>
                        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="50" x="0" y="0"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Switch2>
            </Sequence>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="VariantAction">
            <output_port default="{variant}" name="value"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="activateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="approachLocation">
            <input_port default="1" name="locationId"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="approachWall"/>
        <Action ID="deactivateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="getBaseCharging">
            <output_port default="{charging}" name="charging"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="getPersonPose">
            <output_port default="{x_}" name="x"/>
            <output_port default="{y_}" name="y"/>
            <output_port default="{yaw_}" name="yaw"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="initNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="loadMap"/>
        <Action ID="loadNavigationMap">
            <input_port default="navigation-map" name="mapname"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsLocation"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsRelative"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotAbs"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotRel"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition">
            <input_port default="50" name="approachRadius"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
        <Action ID="setRobotPose">
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="yaw"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="startJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="startReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="triggerGlobalLocalization"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a sequence of actions for a robotic system. The robot is programmed to perform a series of tasks in a specific order, with each task having a defined duration. The tasks include waiting for a specified duration, moving towards predefined goals, and performing various operations such as logging information, subscribing to topics, and publishing messages.

Additionally, the behavior tree includes various utility nodes for handling conditions, looping, and data manipulation. These utility nodes enable the robot to interact with its environment, make decisions based on received data, and control its movements.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's behavior by defining a structured set of actions and decision-making processes, allowing it to navigate, interact with its surroundings, and execute tasks autonomously.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="2" name="WaitSeconds1"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                    <Action state="gpf1" ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" action="/Make_Plan" goal_name="stage_2_pos_final_1" name="GoToGoal1"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="2" name="WaitSeconds2"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                    <Action state="gpf2" ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" action="/Make_Plan" goal_name="stage_2_pos_final_2" name="GoToGoal2"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="2" name="WaitSeconds3"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                    <Action state="gpf3" ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" action="/Make_Plan" goal_name="stage_2_pos_final_3" name="GoToGoal3"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="2" name="WaitSeconds4"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                    <Action state="gpf4" ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" action="/Make_Plan" goal_name="stage_2_pos_final_4" name="GoToGoa4"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="2" name="WaitSeconds5"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                    <Action state="gpf5" ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" action="/Make_Plan" goal_name="stage_2_pos_final_5" name="GoToGoal5"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="2" name="WaitSeconds6"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                    <Action state="gpf6" ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" action="/Make_Plan" goal_name="stage_2_pos_final_6" name="GoToGoal6"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" duration="1" name="WaitSecondsEnd"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="CallEmptyService">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="service">ROS service name</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CheckBool">
            <input_port type="bool" name="input">Input boolean value</input_port>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="CheckKey">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="no_key">Key to determine if key to say 'no' has benn pressed</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="yes_key">Key to determine if key to say 'yes' has been pressed</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CompareNumbers">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="comparison_op">Comparison operator. Valid operators are <, >, <=, >=, == and !=</input_port>
            <input_port type="double" name="first">First operand</input_port>
            <input_port type="double" name="second">Second operand</input_port>
        </Condition>
        <Condition ID="CompareStrings">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="comparison_op">Comparison operator. Valid operators are <, >, <=, >=, == and !=</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="first">First operand</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="second">Second operand</input_port>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="ConcatenateStrings">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="first">First string</input_port>
            <output_port type="std::string" name="output">Concatenated result string</output_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="second">Second string</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ConvertJsonToDouble">
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="double" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ConvertJsonToInt64">
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="long" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ConvertJsonToString">
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="std::string" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ConvertJsonToUint64">
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="unsigned long" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ConvertMessageField">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="field">Field to fetch</input_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="void" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ConvertRandomMessageField">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="field">Field to fetch</input_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="void" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Decorator ID="CooldownMilliseconds">
            <input_port type="unsigned int" name="cooldown" default="0">Cooldown time</input_port>
        </Decorator>
        <Decorator ID="CooldownSeconds">
            <input_port type="unsigned int" name="cooldown" default="0">Cooldown time</input_port>
        </Decorator>
        <Action ID="CopyJson">
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Input variable</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="output">Output variable to copy to</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DebugLog">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="message">Message to log</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ErrorLog">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="message">Message to log</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FatalLog">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="message">Message to log</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FindByFieldValue">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="field">Field to fetch</input_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="void" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="value">Value to search for</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FindSubstrings">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="input">String to look into</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::vector<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, std::allocator<std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > > >" name="substrings">Substrings to look for</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Decorator ID="ForEachLoop">
            <input_port type="bool" name="break_on_child_failure">Break loop on child failure?</input_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Input sequence</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="output_element">Output element variable</output_port>
            <output_port type="unsigned long" name="output_index">Output index variable</output_port>
        </Decorator>
        <Action ID="GetJsonSize">
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Input sequence</input_port>
            <output_port type="unsigned long" name="output">Sequence size output</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetKeyboard">
            <output_port type="std::string" name="output">String received from keyboard</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetMessageField">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="field">Field to fetch</input_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetRandomMessageField">
            <input_port type="std::string" name="field">Field to fetch</input_port>
            <input_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="input">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="output">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetTransformDistance">
            <input_port type="tf::StampedTransform" name="input">TF transform</input_port>
            <output_port type="double" name="output">Distance form transform origin</output_port>
        </Action>

            <input_port type="tf::StampedTransform" name="input">TF transform</input_port>
            <output_port type="double" name="output">2D distance from TF transform origin</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetTransformOrigin">

            <output_port type="double" name="y">Origin y coordinate</output_port>

        </Action>
        <Action ID="InitializeJson">
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="output">Output variable to initialize</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="InterpolateFloat">
            <input_port type="std::vector<double, std::allocator<double> >" name="input_range">Input value range.</input_port>
            <input_port type="double" name="input_value">Value to interpolate.</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::vector<double, std::allocator<double> >" name="output_range">Output value range.</input_port>
            <output_port type="double" name="output_value">Interpolated value.</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Control ID="Interruptible"/>
        <Action ID="LookupTransform">
            <output_port type="tf::StampedTransform" name="output">Result transform</output_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="source_frame">Origin TF frame</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="target_frame">Target TF frame</input_port>
            <input_port type="bool" name="use_last_available" default="0">Use last available transform?</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Decorator ID="Loop"/>
        <Action ID="MathOperationFloat">
            <input_port type="double" name="first">First operand</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="operator">Math operation. Valid operatores are: +, -, / and *</input_port>
            <output_port type="double" name="output">Operation result</output_port>
            <input_port type="double" name="second">Second operand</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MathOperationInt">
            <input_port type="int" name="first">First operand</input_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="operator">Math operation. Valid operatores are: +, -, / and *</input_port>
            <output_port type="int" name="output">Operation result</output_port>
            <input_port type="int" name="second">Second operand</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MonitorStdBool">
            <input_port type="bool" name="consume_msgs" default="0">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <input_port type="unsigned int" name="queue_size" default="1">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="serialized_output">Serialized ROS message [std_msgs::Bool_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="topic">Topic to subscribe</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MonitorStdFloat64">
            <input_port type="bool" name="consume_msgs" default="0">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <input_port type="unsigned int" name="queue_size" default="1">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="serialized_output">Serialized ROS message [std_msgs::Float64_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="topic">Topic to subscribe</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MonitorStdInt32">
            <input_port type="bool" name="consume_msgs" default="0">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <input_port type="unsigned int" name="queue_size" default="1">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <output_port type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>" name="serialized_output">Serialized ROS message [std_msgs::Int32_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port type="std::string" name="topic">Topic to subscribe</input_port>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree defines a sequence of actions for a robot or autonomous system. The main sequence involves waiting for a specified duration, then repeating a series of navigation actions to different goal locations multiple times. Each set of navigation actions is enclosed within a "ForceSuccess" decorator, ensuring successful completion before moving on to the next set. Additionally, there are wait actions interspersed between the navigation sequences.

The tree also includes various nodes for handling ROS messages, performing mathematical operations, logging information, subscribing and publishing to topics, and interacting with actionlib servers for tasks such as fire detection, extinguishing, window detection, takeoff, landing, and more. These nodes enable the robot to communicate with its environment, make decisions based on received data, and execute complex tasks autonomously.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's behavior by coordinating navigation to specific locations, handling sensor data, and executing high-level tasks through ROS communication and actionlib interactions.
output:

    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">

            <ForceSuccess name="ForceSuccess1">
                <Repeat num_cycles="10">
                    <Action ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" name="GoToGoal1" state="gpf1" goal_name="stage_5_pos_final_1" action="/Make_Plan"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" name="WaitSeconds2" duration="2"/>
            <ForceSuccess name="ForceSuccess2">
                <Repeat num_cycles="10">
                    <Action ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" name="GoToGoal2" state="gpf2" goal_name="stage_5_pos_final_2" action="/Make_Plan"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" name="WaitSeconds3" duration="2"/>
            <ForceSuccess name="ForceSuccess3">
                <Repeat num_cycles="10">
                    <Action ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" name="GoToGoal3" state="gpf3" goal_name="stage_5_pos_final_3" action="/Make_Plan"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" name="WaitSeconds4" duration="2"/>
            <ForceSuccess name="ForceSuccess4">
                <Repeat num_cycles="10">
                    <Action ID="UPOGoToGoalByName" name="GoToGoal4" state="gpf4" goal_name="stage_5_pos_final_4" action="/Make_Plan"/>
                </Repeat>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="WaitSeconds" name="WaitSecondsEnd" duration="1"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
