                                                        </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
                                                    </ForceSuccess>
                                                </BlackboardCheckInt>
                                                <BlackboardCheckString return_on_mismatch="" value_A="" value_B="">
                                                    <Inverter>
                                                        <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="">
                                                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                                                        </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                                                    </Inverter>
                                                </BlackboardCheckString>
                                            </Sequence>
                                        </WhileDoElse>
                                    </Switch6>
                                </Switch5>
                            </Switch4>
                        </Fallback>
                    </ManualSelector>
                </IfThenElse>
            </ReactiveSequence>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel/>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robot's task. It begins by checking the laser sensor, and if it detects an obstacle, it will execute a sequence of moving backward for 3 seconds and then turning for 4 seconds. If no obstacle is detected, it will simply move forward. This behavior tree essentially guides the robot to navigate its environment by avoiding obstacles using the laser sensor and executing specific movements based on the sensor readings.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence>
      <Fallback ID="Fallback">
        <CheckLaser name="check_laser"/>
        <Sequence>
          <Backward name="backward" duration="3"/>
          <Turn name="turn" duration="4"/>
        </Sequence>
      </Fallback>
      <Forward name="forward"/>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the automated cleaning and preparation of a coffee machine. It first checks if the cleaning process is finished and there is enough water. If not, it initiates the cleaning process, ensuring the water tank is filled and placed correctly. Following this, it verifies the status of the Marro tank, empties it if necessary, and ensures it is placed in the coffee machine. Once the cleaning process is completed, it proceeds to open the coffee machine, initiate the cleaning cycle, place a coffee cup, select the desired coffee type, and add milk and sugar if required. The tree includes timeouts for various actions and retries until successful attempts for certain conditions.

Overall, the behavior tree automates the sequence of steps required for cleaning and preparing the coffee machine, ensuring that all necessary components are in place and the machine is ready for use.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="AutoClean">
        <Fallback>
            <Condition ID="IsCleanProcessFinished"/>
            <Fallback>
                <Condition ID="IsThereEnoughWater"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Timeout msec="120000">
                        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankRemoved"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Timeout msec="120000">
                            <Condition ID="IsWaterTankFull"/>
                        </Timeout>
                        <Action ID="FillWaterTank"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Timeout msec="120000">
                        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankPlacedInCoffeeMachine"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Timeout msec="120000">
                        <Condition ID="IsCleanProcessFinished"/>
                    </Timeout>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
            <Fallback>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsMarroTankFull"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Sequence>
                    <Timeout msec="120000">
                        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankRemoved"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Timeout msec="120000">
                            <Condition ID="IsMarroTankEmpty"/>
                        </Timeout>
                        <Action ID="EmptyMarroTank"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="15">
                        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankPlacedInCoffeeMachine"/>
                    </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                    <Timeout msec="120000">
                        <Condition ID="IsCleanProcessFinished"/>
                    </Timeout>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SubTree ID="OpenCoffeeMachine" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
            <SubTree ID="AutoClean" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
            <SubTree ID="PutCoffeeCup" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
            <SubTree ID="CoffeeType" __shared_blackboard="false"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="CoffeeType">
        <Sequence>
            <Fallback>
                <Timeout msec="120000">
                    <Condition ID="IsDesiredCoffeeSelected"/>
                </Timeout>
                <Action ID="PressDesiredCoffee"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Timeout msec="120000">
                <Condition ID="IsCoffeeFinished"/>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="120000">
                <Condition ID="HasCupOfCoffeeBeenRemoved"/>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="120000">
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedCleaningCup"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Action ID="PlaceCleanCup"/>
                        <Action ID="SwitchOffCoffeeMachine"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="120000">
                <Fallback name="arallel">
                    <Timeout msec="600000">
                        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedMilk"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Inverter>
                            <Condition ID="IsMilkDesired"/>
                        </Inverter>
                        <Action ID="AddMilkToCoffee"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </Fallback>
            </Timeout>
            <Timeout msec="120000">
                <Fallback>
                    <Timeout msec="600000">
                        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedSugar"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Inverter>
                            <Condition ID="IsSugarDesired"/>
                        </Inverter>
                        <Action ID="AddSugarToCoffee"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </Fallback>
            </Timeout>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="OpenCoffeeMachine">
        <Fallback>
            <Condition ID="IsMachineOpen"/>
            <Sequence>
                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="10">
                    <Condition ID="IsCleanCupReady"/>
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                <Fallback>
                    <Timeout msec="60000">
                        <Condition ID="IsMachineOpen"/>
                    </Timeout>
                    <Action ID="SwitchOnCoffeeMachine"/>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="PutCoffeeCup">
        <Fallback>
            <Timeout msec="120000">
                <Condition ID="IsCoffeeCupReady"/>
            </Timeout>
            <Action ID="PlaceCoffeeCup"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AddMilkToCoffee"/>
        <Action ID="AddSugarToCoffee"/>
        <SubTree ID="AutoClean">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <SubTree ID="CoffeeType">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="EmptyMarroTank"/>
        <Action ID="FillWaterTank"/>
        <Condition ID="HasCupOfCoffeeBeenRemoved"/>
        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedCleaningCup"/>
        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedMilk"/>
        <Condition ID="HasHumanAddedSugar"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCleanCupReady"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCleanProcessFinished"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCoffeeCupReady"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCoffeeFinished"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDesiredCoffeeSelected"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMachineOpen"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankEmpty"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankPlacedInCoffeeMachine"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMarroTankRemoved"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMilkDesired"/>
        <Condition ID="IsSugarDesired"/>
        <Condition ID="IsThereEnoughWater"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankPlacedInCoffeeMachine"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWaterTankRemoved"/>
        <SubTree ID="OpenCoffeeMachine">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="PlaceCleanCup"/>
        <Action ID="PlaceCoffeeCup"/>
        <Action ID="PressDesiredCoffee"/>
        <SubTree ID="PutCoffeeCup">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="SwitchOffCoffeeMachine"/>
        <Action ID="SwitchOnCoffeeMachine"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's path planning and execution. It begins by computing a path using the global planner, then runs two sub-branches in parallel. The first sub-branch involves executing the local planner to follow the computed path, while the second sub-branch controls the rate at which the global planner computes new paths. The goal for the global planner and the resulting path are stored in the blackboard.

The rate at which the global planner is invoked can be adjusted using the hz parameter. If the FollowPath operation returns SUCCESS or FAILURE, the parallel node will return this result. Additionally, the ComputePathToPose operation always returns RUNNING, ensuring continuous path computation.

Overall, the behavior tree manages the coordination of path planning and execution, allowing the robot to continuously update its path based on the environment and progress towards its goal.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree first computes a path using the global planner (ComputePathToPose).
  Then, it runs two sub-branches in parallel. The first sub-branch is a FollowPath
  operation (the local planner). In parallel, there is a rate controlled execution of
  FollowPath (the global planner). Each time a new path is computed, the path update
  is sent to the local planner. The right branch, which is the rate controlled
  ComputePathToPose, always returns RUNNING. Because the Parallel node uses a
  threshold of 1, whenever the FollowPath returns SUCCESS or FAILURE, the parallel
  node will return this result.

  The goal (input to the global planner) and the resulting path (output of the global
  planner and input to the local planner) are passed on the blackboard.

  The rate at which the ComputePathToPose operation is invoked can be controlled with
  the hz parameter to the RateController node.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence name="root">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Fallback>
          <GoalReached/>
          <ComputePathToPose goal="${goal}"/>
        </Fallback>
      </RateController>
      <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robotic pick-and-place task. The robot is programmed to execute a sequence of actions to pick up a block from one location and place it at another. 

First, the robot moves its joints to a start position. Then, it performs the "Pick_Block" sequence, which involves setting the hover position and orientation for picking the block, moving to the pick block hover pose, opening the gripper, setting the grip position and orientation, closing the gripper, and finally moving to the gripped block hover pose.

After successfully picking the block, the robot executes the "Place_Block" sequence. This includes setting the hover position and orientation for placing the block, moving to the place block hover pose, setting the release position and orientation, opening the gripper to release the block, and moving to the released block hover pose.

The behavior tree defines specific actions such as moving joints, moving to a pose, and setting the gripper, with associated input parameters for each action.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence name="Pick_and_Place">
            <Action ID="MoveJoints" commands="0.1 -1.49998 -1.18997 1.94002 0.67 1.03001 -0.5" name="Move_To_Start_Position"/>
            <Sequence name="Pick_Block">
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Pick_Block_Hover_Position" output_key="pick_hove_position" value="0.7 0.158 0.021"/>
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Pick_Block_Hover_Orientation" output_key="pick_hove_orientation" value="-0.02496 0.99965 0.00738 0.00486"/>
                <Action ID="MoveToPose" name="Move_To_Pick_Block_Hovre_Pose" position="{pick_hove_position}" orientation="{pick_hove_orientation}"/>
                <Action ID="SetGripper" name="Open_Gripper" command="open"/>
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Pick_Block_Grip_Position" output_key="pick_gripper_position" value="0.7 0.158 -0.129"/>
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Pick_Block_Grip_Orientation" output_key="pick_gripper_orientation" value="-0.02496 0.99965 0.00738 0.00486"/>
                <Action ID="MoveToPose" name="Move_To_Pick_Block_Grip_Pose" position="{pick_gripper_position}" orientation="{pick_gripper_orientation}"/>
                <Action ID="SetGripper" name="Close_Gripper" position="70"/>
                <Action ID="MoveToPose" name="Move_To_Gripped_Block_Hover_Pose" position="0.7 0.158 -0.021" orientation="-0.02496 0.99965 0.00738 0.00486"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="Place_Block">
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Place_Block_Hover_Position" output_key="place_hover_position" value="0.75 -0.05 -0.021"/>
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Place_Block_Hover_Orientation" output_key="place_hover_orientation" value="-0.02496 0.99965 0.00738 0.00486"/>
                <Action ID="MoveToPose" name="Move_To_Place_Block_Hove_Pose" position="{place_hover_position}" orientation="{place_hover_orientation}"/>
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Place_Block_Release_Pose" output_key="place_release_position" value="0.75 -0.05 -0.129"/>
                <SetBlackboard name="IK_Place_Block_Release_Pose" output_key="place_release_orientation" value="-0.02496 0.99965 0.00738 0.00486"/>
                <Action ID="MoveToPose" name="Move_To_Place_Block_Grip_Pose" position="{place_release_position}" orientation="{place_release_orientation}"/>
                <Action ID="SetGripper" name="Open_Gripper" command="open"/>
                <Action ID="MoveToPose" name="Move_To_Relased_Block_Hove_Pose" position="0.75 -0.05 -0.021" orientation="-0.02496 0.99965 0.00738 0.00486"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="MoveJoints">
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 0" name="commands">position of each joint</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveToPose">
            <input_port default="0 0 0" name="position">IK position</input_port>/>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 1" name="orientation">IK orientation</input_port>/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SetGripper">
            <input_port default="0.0" name="position">position of the gripper</input_port>
            <input_port default="open" name="command">open or close gripper</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a complex series of actions for a robotic system, specifically for a depalletizing demo involving two robots (arm and Aubo). The sequence involves setting the speed for both robots, adding collision objects to their environments, initializing the robots, and then executing a repeated process of depalletizing.

During the depalletizing process, the robot senses the pose of an object, plans its pick and place poses, executes various motions including picking, placing, and suctioning, and finally adds a box back to the environment. This entire process is repeated 100 times.

The tree utilizes various predefined actions such as setting speeds, adding collision objects, planning motions, executing group poses, and sensing object poses. These actions are orchestrated in a specific sequence to achieve the overall task of depalletizing.

Overall, the behavior tree coordinates the intricate steps required for the depalletizing demo, ensuring that the robots perform the necessary actions accurately and efficiently.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence name="Robot-Aubo Depalletizing Demo">
            <Sequence name="set speed for robots">
                <Action ID="ExecuteGroupSpeed" group_name="arm" name="set robot speed" service_name="robot/execute_group_speed" value="1.0"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteGroupSpeed" group_name="aubo" name="set aubo speed" service_name="aubo/execute_group_speed" value="0.5"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="add collisions for Robot">
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddPlane" group_name="arm" name="Add groud to scene" plane_name="ground" plane_normal="0 0 1" plane_pose="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" service_name="robot/execute_add_plane"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="left_wall" box_pose="2.76 1.2 1.35 0 0 0 1" box_size="5.5 0.001 2.7" group_name="arm" is_absolute="1" name="Add left wall" service_name="robot/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="right_wall" box_pose="2.76 -1.2 1.35 0 0 0 1" box_size="5.5 0.001 2.7" group_name="arm" is_absolute="1" name="Add right wall" service_name="robot/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="top_wall" box_pose="2.5 0 2.7 0 0 0 1" box_size="5 2.4 0.001" group_name="arm" is_absolute="1" name="Add top wall" service_name="robot/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="conveyor" box_pose="-1.341 0 0.4 0 0 0 1" box_size="2.56 1.26 0.8" group_name="arm" is_absolute="1" name="Add conveyor" service_name="robot/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="0" box_name="boxsur" box_pose="0.881 0 1.35 0 0 0 1" box_size="0.001 2.4 2.7" group_name="arm" is_absolute="1" name="box_surface" service_name="robot/execute_add_box"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="add collisions for Aubo">
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="conveyor" box_pose="-0.49 0 -0.4 0 0 0 1" box_size="2.56 1.26 0.8" group_name="aubo" is_absolute="1" name="Add conveyor" service_name="aubo/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="top_wall" box_pose="0 0 1.9 0 0 0 1" box_size="2 2.4 0.001" group_name="aubo" is_absolute="1" name="Add top wall" service_name="aubo/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="left_wall" box_pose="0 -1.2 0.55 0 0 0 1" box_size="2 0.001 2.7" group_name="aubo" is_absolute="1" name="Add left wall" service_name="aubo/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="right_wall" box_pose="0 1.2 0.55 0 0 0 1" box_size="2 0.001 2.7" group_name="aubo" is_absolute="1" name="Add right wall" service_name="aubo/execute_add_box"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="1" box_name="Robot_back" box_pose="0.85 0 0.55 0 0 0 1" box_size="0.001 0.15 2.7" group_name="aubo" is_absolute="1" name="Add Robot back" service_name="aubo/execute_add_box"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="initialize robots">
                <Action ID="ExecuteGroupNamedStates" group_name="aubo" name="aubo initial state" service_name="aubo/execute_group_named_states" state_name="A"/>
                <Action ID="ExecuteGroupNamedStates" group_name="arm" name="robot initial state" service_name="robot/execute_group_named_states" state_name="left_pre"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Repeat num_cycles="100">
                <Sequence name="Depalletizing Proccess">
                    <Action ID="SenseObjectPose" category="" pose="{box_surface_pose}" service_name="sense_object_pose"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecutePlanning" category="" pick_pose="{pick_pose}" place_pose="{place_pose}" pose="{box_surface_pose}" post_middle_pose="{post_middle_pose}" post_pick_pose="{post_pick_pose}" post_pick_pose_edge="{post_pick_pose_edge}" pre_middle_pose="{pre_middle_pose}" pre_pick_pose="{pre_pick_pose}" service_name="execute_planning"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates" goal="{pre_middle_pose}" group_name="arm" name="pre middle" service_name="robot/execute_group_joint_states" tolerance="0.01"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteRemoveObject" is_exact="1" name="remove boxes_surface" obj_name="boxsur" service_name="robot/execute_remove_object"/>
                    <Action ID="ConnectWaypoints" connected_waypoints="{pick_motion}" name="pick motion" service_name="connect_waypoints" waypoint1="{pre_pick_pose}" waypoint2="{pick_pose}" waypoint3="" waypoint4="" waypoint5=""/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupManyPoses" constraint="" eef_step="0.1" goal_type="0" goals="{pick_motion}" group_name="arm" name="pre pick and pick" service_name="robot/execute_group_many_poses" tolerance="0.01"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteSuction" enable="1" service_name="execute_suction"/>
                    <Action ID="ConnectWaypoints" connected_waypoints="{pull_out}" name="pull out" service_name="connect_waypoints" waypoint1="{post_pick_pose}" waypoint2="{post_pick_pose_edge}" waypoint3="" waypoint4="" waypoint5=""/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupManyPoses" constraint="" eef_step="0.1" goal_type="0" goals="{pull_out}" group_name="arm" name="post pick" service_name="robot/execute_group_many_poses" tolerance="0.01"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates" goal="{post_middle_pose}" group_name="arm" name="post middle" service_name="robot/execute_group_joint_states" tolerance="0.01"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates" goal="{place_pose}" group_name="arm" name="place" service_name="robot/execute_group_joint_states" tolerance="0.01"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteSuction" enable="0" service_name="execute_suction"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox" auto_subfix="0" box_name="boxsur" box_pose="0.881 0 1.35 0 0 0 1" box_size="0.001 2.4 2.7" group_name="arm" is_absolute="1" name="box_surface" service_name="robot/execute_add_box"/>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates" goal="{pre_middle_pose}" group_name="arm" name="back to pre middle" service_name="robot/execute_group_joint_states" tolerance="0.01"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ConnectWaypoints">
            <output_port name="connected_waypoints">PoseArray</output_port>
            <input_port default="connect_waypoints" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port name="waypoint1">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint2">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint3">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint4">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint5">Pose</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox">
            <input_port default="1" name="auto_subfix"/>
            <input_port default="box" name="box_name"/>
            <input_port default="{place_pose}" name="box_pose"/>
            <input_port default="0.2 0.2 0.2" name="box_size"/>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="1" name="is_absolute"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_add_box" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteAddPlane">
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="ground" name="plane_name"/>
            <input_port default="0 0 1" name="plane_normal"/>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="plane_pose">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_add_plane" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteAttachBox">
            <input_port name="box_name"/>
            <input_port name="box_pose"/>
            <input_port name="box_size"/>
            <input_port default="gripper" name="eef_group_name"/>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_attach_box" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteDetachObject">
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port name="obj_name"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_detach_object" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupAngularJointStates">
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 0" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="panda_arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_group_joint_states" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates">
            <input_port default="0.04 0.04" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="hand" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_group_joint_states" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupManyPoses">
            <input_port name="constraint">If 'r', 'p', or 'y' is given, the eef_frame should not rotate about itself along x-, y-, or z-axis. You can combine them like 'rp', 'ry', 'py', and 'rpy'. Default ''</input_port>
            <input_port default="0.1" name="eef_step"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="goal_type">0: Pose wrt the global base frame (robot base); 1: Pose wrt the base frame transferred to current eef base position; 2: pose wrt the eef frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="goals">Goals for each waypoint to reach, seperate with ; </input_port>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name">The group providing the reference frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_group_many_poses" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupNamedStates">
            <input_port default="aubo" name="group_name">The group providing the reference frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="aubo/execute_group_named_states" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="A" name="state_name">A: Camera to up left; B: Camera to up right; C: Camera to bottom left; D: Camera to bottom right</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupPose">
            <input_port name="constraint">If 'r', 'p', or 'y' is given, the eef_frame should not rotate about itself along x-, y-, or z-axis. You can combine them like 'rp', 'ry', 'py', and 'rpy'. Default ''</input_port>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="goal_type">0: Pose wrt the global base frame (robot base); 1: Pose wrt the base frame transferred to current eef base position; 2: pose wrt the eef frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name">The group providing the reference frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_group_pose" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupShift">
            <input_port default="z" name="axis">Could be x y z roll pitch yaw</input_port>
            <input_port default="0" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="is_absolute"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_group_shift" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupSpeed">
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name">The group providing the reference frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_group_speed" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.5" name="value">The velocity scaling factor, Allowed values are in (0,1]</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecutePlanning">
            <input_port name="category">0 for large box, 1 for small box</input_port>
            <output_port default="{pick_pose}" name="pick_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <output_port default="{place_pose}" name="place_pose">Double Array</output_port>
            <input_port default="{box_surface_pose}" name="pose">Pose</input_port>
            <output_port default="{post_middle_pose}" name="post_middle_pose">Double Array</output_port>
            <output_port default="{post_pick_pose}" name="post_pick_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <output_port default="{post_pick_pose_edge}" name="post_pick_pose_edge">Pose</output_port>
            <output_port default="{pre_middle_pose}" name="pre_middle_pose">Double Array</output_port>
            <output_port default="{pre_pick_pose}" name="pre_pick_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port default="execute_planning" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteRemoveObject">
            <input_port default="1" name="is_exact"/>
            <input_port name="obj_name"/>
            <input_port default="robot/execute_remove_object" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteSuction">
            <input_port default="0" name="enable"/>
            <input_port default="execute_suction" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FetchDetectedInfo">
            <output_port name="category">String, 0 for large box, 1 for small box</output_port>
            <output_port name="pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port default="fetch_detected_info" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SenseObjectPose">
            <output_port name="category">String, 0 for large box, 1 for small box</output_port>
            <output_port name="pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port default="sense_object_pose" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StoreDetectedInfo">
            <input_port name="category">String, 0 for large box, 1 for small box</input_port>
            <input_port name="pose">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port default="store_detected_info" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="TypeInPose">
            <output_port name="pose_on_blackboard">Pose on blackboard</output_port>
            <input_port default="type_in_pose" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="type_in_pose">Pose to be typed in</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot's navigation system. It periodically replans the global path at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions in case of failures. The sequence of operations includes adjusting various parameters related to the robot's navigation, such as setting the footprint size, adjusting speed and goal tolerances, modifying path weights, and configuring the inflation radius.

The main loop involves computing a path to a specific goal, navigating with replanning, and executing recovery actions if needed. The recovery actions include clearing the global and local costmaps and waiting for a specified duration.

Additionally, it checks people's status frequently and avoids individuals not in the queue while navigating. It also updates the path based on the current environment and follows the updated path using a controller. If any of these processes fail, recovery actions are initiated to ensure smooth navigation.

Overall, this behavior tree aims to maintain robust and adaptive navigation for the robot, ensuring safe and efficient movement in dynamic environments.
output:
<!--
 Copyright (c) 2020  Carnegie Mellon University

 Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
 of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
 in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
 to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
 copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
 furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

 The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
 copies or substantial portions of the Software.

 THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
 IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
 FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
 AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
 LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
 OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
 SOFTWARE.
-->

<!--
    This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
    recovery actions.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="QueueTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="QueueTree">
    <RestoreConfig node_name="/footprint_publisher">
      <RestoreConfig node_name="/controller_server">
	<RestoreConfig node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap">
	  <Sequence>
	    <!-- set the footprint as smallest -->
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/footprint_publisher"
			 param_name="footprint_mode"
			 param_value="1"  name="ChangeParamFootprintToSmall"/>
	    
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/controller_server"
			 param_name="FollowPath.max_vel_x"
			 param_value="0.5"  name="ChangeParamSpeedDown"/>
	    
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/controller_server"
			 param_name="cabot_goal_checker.xy_goal_tolerance"
			 param_value="0.20"  name="ChangeParamFollowPathXyGoalTolerance"/>
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/controller_server"
			 param_name="cabot_goal_checker.yaw_goal_tolerance"
			 param_value="0.20"  name="ChangeParamFollowPathYawGoalTolerance"/>
	    
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap"
			 param_name="navcog_path_layer.walk_weight"
			 param_value="[0.3, 0.0, 0.3] "  name="ChangeParamWalkWeightToCenter"/>
	    <!-- 1: use adjust mode to use actual center of the corridor based on costmap
		 0: use navcog path as the ceter of the corridor -->
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap"
			 param_name="navcog_path_layer.path_mode"
			 param_value="0"  name="ChangeParamToAdjust"/>
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap"
			 param_name="navcog_path_layer.path_adjusted_center"
			 param_value="0.0"  name="ChangeParamPathAdjustedCenter"/>

	    <ChangeParam node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap"
			 param_name="inflation_layer.inflation_radius"
			 param_value="0.2"  name="ChangeParamInflationRadius"/>
	    
	    <!-- compute a path -->
	    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="999999999" name="InitialComputePathRepeat">
	      <Sequence name="ComputePathSequence">
		<!-- clear costmap -->
		<!--
		<ClearCostmapAroundRobot name="ClearCostmapAroundRobot" server_timeout="5000"
					 service_name="global_costmap/clear_around_global_costmap"
					 window_size_x="20" window_size_y="20"/>
		-->
		<ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-context" server_timeout="5000"
				    service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
		
		<!-- wait long enough to include neighbor obstacles -->
		<WaitFloat wait_duration_float="0.5"/>
		<ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path_temp}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
		<CheckPath  path="{path_temp}" path_topic="/path" plan_topic="/plan" path_out="{path}" />
		<!-- front vibration -->
		<!--
		<PublishTopicInt8 topic="/cabot/notification" value="5" />
		-->
	      </Sequence>
	      <ForceSuccess>
		<WaitFloat wait_duration_float="0.5"/>
	      </ForceSuccess>
	    </RecoveryNode>
	    
	    <!-- main loop -->
	    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="999999999" name="NavigateRecovery">
	      <!-- navigation -->
	      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
		<!-- Check people status frequently -->
		<!-- find people needs to be avoided not in queue -->
		<!--
		<RateController hz="2" name="AvoidPeople">
		  <Fallback name="AvoidPersonFallback">
		    <Sequence name="AvoidPerson">
		      <PeopleExist people_topic="people" people_out="{people}"/>
		      <NeedToAvoid people="{people}" robot_frame="base_footprint" path="{path}" avoid="{people_avoid}"/>
		      <SomeoneNotInQueue queue_topic="queue_people_py/queue" people="{people_avoid}" people_out_not_queue="{people_avoid_not_queue}"/>
		      <IgnorePeople people="{people_avoid_not_queue}" ignore_topic="ignore" wait_duration="0.5"/>
		      <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path_temp}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
		      <CheckPath current="{path}" path="{path_temp}" path_topic="/path" plan_topic="/plan" path_out="{path}" />
		      <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
		    </Sequence>
		    <AlwaysSuccess/>
		  </Fallback>
		</RateController>
		-->
		<RateController hz="2.0" name="UpdatePath">
		  <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="UpdatePathRecovery">
		    <Sequence>
		      <ClearEntireCostmap name="UpdatePathClearGlobalCostmap-context" server_timeout="5000"
					  service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
		      <WaitFloat wait_duration_float="0.5"/>
		      <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path_temp}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
		      <CheckPath  path="{path_temp}" path_topic="/path" plan_topic="/plan" path_out="{path}" />
		    </Sequence>
		    <ForceSuccess>
		      <WaitFloat wait_duration_float="0.5"/>
		    </ForceSuccess>
		  </RecoveryNode>
		</RateController>
		
		<!-- follow path -->
		<RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPathRecovery">
		  <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath" />
		  <AlwaysSuccess/>
		</RecoveryNode>
	      </PipelineSequence>
	      
	      <!-- recovery -->
	      <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
		<ClearEntireCostmap name="Recovery-ClearGlobalCostmap-context" server_timeout="5000"
                                    service_name="/global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
		<ClearEntireCostmap name="Recovery-ClearLocalCostmap-Context" server_timeout="5000"
				    service_name="/local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
		<Wait wait_duration="1.0"/>
	      </SequenceStar>
	    </RecoveryNode>
	  </Sequence>
	</RestoreConfig>
      </RestoreConfig>
    </RestoreConfig>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for a robot. The robot is programmed to perform a series of actions based on certain conditions and events. 

Initially, it attempts to execute a sequence of tasks in a specific order. If it encounters an obstacle or failure during any task, it will move to the next available action. The robot first checks if the room is known, then proceeds to go to the room if known, otherwise follows a human. Subsequently, it tries to find a bottle and fetch it. If all these actions fail, the robot resorts to asking for help.

In summary, the behavior tree outlines the robot's hierarchical decision-making process, where it attempts various actions in a structured manner, with fallback options in case of failure or unmet conditions.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Root>
            <Fallback name="FB1">
                <Sequence name="S1">
                    <Fallback name="FB2">
                        <Sequence name="S3">
                            <Condition ID="Room_known"/>
                            <Action ID="Go_to_room"/>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Action ID="Follow_human"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
                    <Action ID="Fetch_bottle"/>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
            </Fallback>
        </Root>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
        <Action ID="Fetch_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Follow_human"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_room"/>
        <Condition ID="Room_known"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--------------------------------------->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for a robot tasked with interacting with a ball and a bin. The robot follows a sequence of actions, attempting to find and interact with the ball and the bin in a specific order. It first attempts to find the ball, then approaches it if it's close enough, grasps it once it's found, finds the bin, approaches the bin, and finally places the ball in the bin. If at any point the robot is unable to complete an action, it will ask for help.

This behavior tree reflects a hierarchical decision-making process where the robot prioritizes finding and interacting with the ball before moving on to the bin. If any step fails, it resorts to asking for assistance.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!--  -----------------------------------  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback name="Fallback1">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback name="Fallback2">
                    <Condition ID="BallFound"/>
                    <Action ID="FindBall"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fallback3">
                    <Condition ID="BallClose" thd="10"/>
                    <Action ID="ApproachBall"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fallback4">
                    <Condition ID="BallGrasped"/>
                    <Action ID="GraspBall"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fallback5">
                    <Condition ID="BinFound"/>
                    <Action ID="FindBin"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fallback6">
                    <Condition ID="BinClose"/>
                    <Action ID="ApproachBin"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fallback7">
                    <Condition ID="BallPlaced"/>
                    <Action ID="PlaceBall"/>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="AskForHelp"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  -----------------------------------  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ApproachBall"/>
        <Action ID="ApproachBin"/>
        <Action ID="AskForHelp"/>
        <Condition ID="BallClose"/>
        <Condition ID="BallFound"/>
        <Condition ID="BallGrasped"/>
        <Condition ID="BallPlaced"/>
        <Condition ID="BinClose"/>
        <Condition ID="BinFound"/>
        <Action ID="FindBall"/>
        <Action ID="FindBin"/>
        <Action ID="GraspBall"/>
        <Action ID="PlaceBall"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  -----------------------------------  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate while periodically replanning its global path at a frequency of 1 Hz. The robot's movement is controlled by a pipeline sequence that includes a speed controller and a path following component. The speed controller regulates the robot's speed within specified limits and filters the speed changes over a duration. The ComputePathToPose node calculates the path to a given goal using a planner identified as "GridBased". This path is then followed by the robot using the FollowPath component. Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot navigates towards its goal while continuously updating its global path to adapt to changing environments or obstacles.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <SpeedController min_rate="0.1" max_rate="1.0" min_speed="0.0" max_speed="0.26" filter_duration="0.3">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </SpeedController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:

output:

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to execute a sequence of actions with specific conditions and behaviors. It starts with a fallback node that contains a reactive fallback, which in turn has an always-failure node inside it. Following this, there is a sequence star containing a retry until successful node with a blackboard check string condition. Then, there is an inverter node that encompasses a force failure node, within which there is a force success node setting a value on the blackboard. Finally, there is a reactive sequence with an action "Pippo" as its child node.

Overall, the behavior tree seems to be focused on handling various types of conditions and executing a specific action based on those conditions, such as setting values on the blackboard and performing the "Pippo" action within the defined sequence.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Fallback>
                <ReactiveFallback>
                    <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                        <AlwaysFailure/>
                    </Repeat>
                </ReactiveFallback>
            </Fallback>
            <SequenceStar name="DoSequenceStar">
                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="1">
                    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="" return_on_mismatch="" value_B="">
                        <AlwaysSuccess/>
                    </BlackboardCheckString>
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Inverter>
                <ForceFailure>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SetBlackboard value="value" output_key=""/>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                </ForceFailure>
            </Inverter>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="Pippo"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Pippo"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the task for an autonomous agent. The agent is programmed to continuously explore its environment by moving to different waypoints until it encounters a failure. 

The sequence begins with the agent checking if the current location has been explored. If not, it selects a potential waypoint and moves towards it. After reaching the waypoint, it again checks if the new location has been explored before proceeding.

This behavior tree operates in a loop, ensuring that the agent keeps exploring new areas until it encounters a failure. The "Explored" action indicates the agent's exploration status, while "SelectPF" and "Move" actions handle the selection and movement to the next waypoint respectively.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="Explored"/>
                <Action ID="SelectPF" waypoint="{wp}"/>
                <Action ID="Move" goal="{wp}"/>
                <Action ID="Explored"/>
            </Sequence>
        </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Explored"/>
        <Action ID="SelectPF">
            <output_port name="waypoint"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Move">
            <input_port name="goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's activities. The robot is programmed to repeat a sequence of actions 100 times. Within each repetition, it follows a fallback pattern: first, it patrols by navigating through waypoints (wp_1 to wp_7) in sequence. If the patrolling sequence fails or the robot needs recharging, it falls back to the recharging sequence, which involves navigating to a recharge station and then recharging.

In summary, the robot will repeatedly patrol through waypoints and, if needed, recharge at a designated station. This behavior allows the robot to efficiently cover its designated area while ensuring it can maintain operational readiness through periodic recharging.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <Repeat num_cycles="100">
                <Fallback>
                    <Sequence name="patrolling">
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_1"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_2"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_3"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_4"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_5"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_6"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_7"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence name="recharging">
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="recharge_station"/>
                        <Recharge/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
     </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate through an environment with periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions. The robot's navigation involves several steps: 
First, it computes a path to a specific goal using the "GridBased" planner and clears the entire global costmap context. Then, it follows the computed path while clearing the entire local costmap context. If there are any failures during these processes, the recovery node allows for up to 10 retries. Additionally, if the goal is updated, the robot performs recovery actions such as clearing both the local and global costmaps and waiting for a specified duration.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can continuously navigate towards its goal, periodically updating its path and performing recovery actions in case of failures or changes in the goal.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="10" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          <!-- <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/> -->
          <Wait wait_duration="1"/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle's actions are determined by various conditions and sequences within the tree. It starts with checking if there is a mission wait, and if not, it stops. If there is no global path available, it initializes and then selects a state (such as lane-keeping or lane-changing) based on certain conditions. It also handles scenarios like avoiding obstacles, changing lanes, following traffic rules, and recovering from failures.

The tree consists of multiple sequences and fallbacks to handle different driving states and contingencies. Actions such as generating paths, setting paths, changing lanes, stopping at traffic lights, and publishing data are performed based on the conditions and states encountered during the vehicle's operation.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the decision-making process for the autonomous vehicle, ensuring safe and efficient navigation while adhering to traffic rules and handling unexpected situations.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's actions. It begins by setting the velocity to 3 and saying "Hello". Then, it executes two sub-trees, Variant1 and Variant2, in sequence, followed by an always successful action. Afterward, it opens the gripper, approaches an object with the previously set velocity, closes the gripper, and finally says "Bye". This sequence of actions likely represents a robotic task such as approaching an object, manipulating it, and then concluding the task. The behavior tree is designed to ensure the robot follows this specific sequence of actions.
output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
	<!-- The include paths need to be adapted to the ones required by the interpreter -->
	<include path = "variant1.xml"/>
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<Sequence name="root_sequence">
			<SetBlackboard output_key = "vp_velocity" value = "3"/>
			<Action ID="SaySomething"   name="action_hello" message="Hello"/>
			<Sequence>
				<SubTree ID = "Variant1"/>
				<SubTree ID = "Variant2"/> 
				<AlwaysSuccess/> 
			</Sequence >			
			<Action ID="OpenGripper"    name="open_gripper"/>
			<Action ID="ApproachObject" name="approach_object" velocity="{vp_velocity}"/>
			<Action ID="CloseGripper"   name="close_gripper"/>
			<Action ID="SaySomething"   name="action_bye" message="Bye"/>
        </Sequence>
     </BehaviorTree>
</root >

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robot's task of searching for and following a person. The robot first performs the "SearchAction" to locate the person, and then executes the "FollowAction" to follow them once found. Both actions have an objective parameter set to "person". The sequence implies that the robot will search for the person before attempting to follow them. This behavior can be useful in scenarios where a robot needs to autonomously locate and track a specific individual.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action ID="SearchAction" objective="person"/>
            <Action ID="FollowAction" objective="person"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="FollowAction">
            <input_port default="person" name="objective">It follows a objective</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SearchAction">
            <input_port default="person" name="objective">It turns itself searching an objective</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a complex sequence of actions for a robotic system. The robot is programmed to perform a series of tasks in stages, with each stage involving multiple repetitions of specific actions. These actions include waiting for a set duration, navigating to different goal locations, and performing various monitoring and logging tasks.

The behavior tree starts with a sequence of actions that involve waiting for a specified time, followed by navigating to different goal positions. Each navigation action is repeated 10 times before moving on to the next stage. This process is then repeated for several stages, each with its own set of goals and actions.

Additionally, the behavior tree includes a variety of utility actions such as monitoring ROS messages, performing mathematical operations, generating random values, and interacting with ROS services. It also incorporates logging functionalities for debugging and information purposes.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates a complex multi-stage operation for the robot, encompassing navigation, monitoring, and decision-making tasks.
