            <input_port name="field" type="std::string">Field to fetch</input_port>
            <input_port name="input" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Serialized ROS message</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Output variable</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetTransformDistance">
            <input_port name="input" type="tf::StampedTransform">TF transform</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="double">Distance form transform origin</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetTransformHorizontalDistance">
            <input_port name="input" type="tf::StampedTransform">TF transform</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="double">2D distance from TF transform origin</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetTransformOrigin">
            <input_port name="input" type="tf::StampedTransform">TF transform</input_port>
            <output_port name="x" type="double">Origin x coordinate</output_port>
            <output_port name="y" type="double">Origin y coordinate</output_port>
            <output_port name="z" type="double">Origin z coordinate</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="InfoLog">
            <input_port name="message" type="std::string">Message to log</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="InitializeJson">
            <output_port name="output" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Output variable to initialize</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="InterpolateFloat">
            <input_port name="input_range" type="std::vector<double, std::allocator<double> >">Input value range.</input_port>
            <input_port name="input_value" type="double">Value to interpolate.</input_port>
            <input_port name="output_range" type="std::vector<double, std::allocator<double> >">Output value range.</input_port>
            <output_port name="output_value" type="double">Interpolated value.</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Control ID="Interruptible"/>
        <Action ID="LookupTransform">
            <output_port name="output" type="tf::StampedTransform">Result transform</output_port>
            <input_port name="source_frame" type="std::string">Origin TF frame</input_port>
            <input_port name="target_frame" type="std::string">Target TF frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="0" name="use_last_available" type="bool">Use last available transform?</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Decorator ID="Loop"/>
        <Action ID="MathOperationFloat">
            <input_port name="first" type="double">First operand</input_port>
            <input_port name="operator" type="std::string">Math operation. Valid operatores are: +, -, / and *</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="double">Operation result</output_port>
            <input_port name="second" type="double">Second operand</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MathOperationInt">
            <input_port name="first" type="int">First operand</input_port>
            <input_port name="operator" type="std::string">Math operation. Valid operatores are: +, -, / and *</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="int">Operation result</output_port>
            <input_port name="second" type="int">Second operand</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MonitorStdBool">
            <input_port default="0" name="consume_msgs" type="bool">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <input_port default="1" name="queue_size" type="unsigned int">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <output_port name="serialized_output" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Serialized ROS message [std_msgs::Bool_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string">Topic to subscribe</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MonitorStdFloat64">
            <input_port default="0" name="consume_msgs" type="bool">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <input_port default="1" name="queue_size" type="unsigned int">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <output_port name="serialized_output" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Serialized ROS message [std_msgs::Float64_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string">Topic to subscribe</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MonitorStdInt32">
            <input_port default="0" name="consume_msgs" type="bool">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <input_port default="1" name="queue_size" type="unsigned int">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <output_port name="serialized_output" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Serialized ROS message [std_msgs::Int32_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string">Topic to subscribe</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="OStreamNode">
            <input_port name="message" type="std::string">String to print</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Decorator ID="OnlyOnce"/>
        <Action ID="PublishBool">
            <input_port name="data" type="bool">Auto-generated field from std_msgs::Bool_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port default="0" name="latch" type="bool">Latch messages?</input_port>
            <input_port default="1" name="queue_size" type="unsigned int">Internal publisher queue size</input_port>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string">Topic to publish to</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="PublishStdString">
            <input_port name="data" type="std::string">Auto-generated field from std_msgs::String_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port default="0" name="latch" type="bool">Latch messages?</input_port>
            <input_port default="1" name="queue_size" type="unsigned int">Internal publisher queue size</input_port>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string">Topic to publish to</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RandomFloat">
            <input_port name="max" type="double">Max range value</input_port>
            <input_port name="min" type="double">Minimum range value</input_port>
            <output_port name="result" type="double">Random result value</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RandomInteger">
            <input_port name="max" type="int">Max range value</input_port>
            <input_port name="min" type="int">Minimum range value</input_port>
            <output_port name="result" type="int">Random result value</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RandomSequenceValue">
            <input_port default=";" name="delimiter" type="std::string">Sequence entries delimiter</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="std::string">Result random sequence entry</output_port>
            <input_port name="sequence" type="std::string">Sequence to randomize</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SubscribeUPOGoal">
            <input_port default="0" name="consume_msgs" type="bool">Should messages be consumed?</input_port>
            <output_port name="output" type="upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> >">Received ROS message [upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <input_port default="1" name="queue_size" type="unsigned int">Subscriber callback queue size</input_port>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string">Topic to subscribe</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOFireDetection3D">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <input_port name="duration" type="int">Duration</input_port>
            <output_port name="fire_found" type="bool">Fire Found</output_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
            <output_port name="x" type="double">Fire x</output_port>
            <output_port name="y" type="double">Fire x</output_port>
            <output_port name="z" type="double">Fire x</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOFireExtinguish">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <input_port name="detect_fire" type="bool">Detect Fire</input_port>
            <output_port name="serialized_feedback" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Serialized ROS message [upo_actions::FireExtinguishFeedback_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <output_port name="serialized_result" type="nlohmann::basic_json<std::map, std::vector, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, bool, long, unsigned long, double, std::allocator, nlohmann::adl_serializer>">Serialized ROS message [upo_actions::FireExtinguishResult_<std::allocator<void> >]</output_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOGoToGoal">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.header.frame_id" type="std::string">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.header.seq" type="unsigned int">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.orientation.w" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.orientation.x" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.orientation.y" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.orientation.z" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.position.x" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.position.y" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <input_port name="global_goal.pose.position.z" type="double">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::MakePlanGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOGoToGoalByName">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <input_port name="goal_name" type="std::string">Name of goal</input_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOLanding">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <input_port name="land" type="bool">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::LandingGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOTakeOff">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
            <input_port name="takeoff_height.data" type="float">Auto-generated field from upo_actions::TakeOffGoal_<std::allocator<void> ></input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UPOWindowDetection">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string">Actionlib action server name</input_port>
            <input_port name="duration" type="int">Duration</input_port>
            <output_port name="state" type="actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState">Actionlib reported state</output_port>
            <output_port name="window_present" type="bool">Window Present</output_port>
            <output_port name="x" type="double">Window x</output_port>
            <output_port name="y" type="double">Window y</output_port>
            <output_port name="z" type="double">Window z</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitMilliseconds">
            <input_port default="0" name="duration" type="unsigned int">Time to wait</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitSeconds">
            <input_port default="0" name="duration" type="unsigned int">Time to wait</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WarnLog">
            <input_port name="message" type="std::string">Message to log</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Decorator ID="WhileSuccess"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robotic system that executes a sequence of tasks. Initially, it clears the local and global cost maps for navigation. Then, it sets a goal location (Goal_a) and computes a path to reach that goal using navigation algorithms. This entire sequence is repeated once. In summary, the robot's task involves preparing the environment for navigation by clearing cost maps, setting a specific goal location, and computing a path to navigate towards that goal.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="1">
            <Sequence>
                <Nav2ClearLocalCostMap/>
                <Nav2ClearGlobalCostMap/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-0.7,-3.8" />
                <Nav2ComputePathClient goal="{Goal_a}" />
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robotic system's task flow. It begins by loading a pallet, then moving to a specified location, and finally dropping the pallet at the destination. This sequence is encapsulated within the "root_sequence". The "Move" action takes a goal as an argument, allowing flexibility in specifying the destination for the robot. Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the steps required for the robot to load, transport, and unload a pallet at a designated location.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
       <Sequence name="root_sequence">
           <LoadPallet   name="load_pallet"/>
           <Move    name="move" goal="${arg2}"/>
           <DropPallet    name="drop_pallet"/>
       </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a sequence of actions for building a gearbox kit using a robot. The main task involves picking up a large gear, inserting it into a machine, and then performing various steps to pick and place screws. 

The "go insert large gear" subtree includes the robot's attempts to move to the designated location, detect the chuck, and then insert the large gear while handling potential failures.

The "go pick screw" subtree details the robot's efforts to move to the screw station, detect the screw, pick it up, and handle any potential failures in the process.

The "go place screw" subtree describes the robot's movements to the caddy station, detecting the screw compartment, placing the screw into the compartment, and managing potential failures during the process.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's actions in building the gearbox kit by coordinating its movements, object detection, and manipulation tasks to complete the assembly process.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="build a gearbox kit">
            <!--            <SubTree ID="prepare navigation and arm" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go pick large gear" />-->
            <SubTree ID="go insert large gear" name="" />
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go place machined large gear" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go pick small gear" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go place small gear" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go pick gearbox top" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go place gearbox top" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go pick gearbox bottom" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go place gearbox bottom" />-->

            <!--            <SubTree ID="ask" what="Press Enter to pick 1st screw..."/>-->
            <!--            <SubTree name="go pick first screw" ID="go pick screw" />-->
            <SubTree ID="go pick screw" name="go pick first screw"/>
            <!--            <SubTree ID="ask" what="Press Enter to place 1st screw..."/>-->
            <!--            <SubTree name="go place first screw" ID="go place screw" />-->
            <SubTree ID="go place screw" name="go place first screw"/>
            <!--            <SubTree ID="ask" what="Press Enter to pick 2nd screw..."/>-->
            <!--            <SubTree name="go pick second screw" ID="go pick screw" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="ask" what="Press Enter to place 2nd screw..."/>-->
            <!--            <SubTree name="go place second screw" ID="go place screw" />-->

            <!--            <SubTree ID="go pick caddy" />-->
            <!--            <SubTree ID="go drop off caddy" />-->
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="go insert large gear">
        <Fallback name="go insert large gear">
            <Sequence name="go insert large gear">
                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3" name="">
                    <Action ID="move to" place="chuck place" name="move to see chuck" />
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>

                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3" name="">
                    <Sequence name="">
                        <Sequence name="detect chuck">
                            <Action ID="lift torso" name="" />
                            <Action ID="look at chuck roughly" name="" />
                            <Action ID="detect chuck" output="{object pose}" name="" />
                        </Sequence>
                        <Fallback name="insert large gear">
                            <Sequence name="insert large gear">
                                <Action ID="convert to insertion pose" name="" from="{object pose}" output="{insertion pose}" />
                                <Action ID="scan scene" name="scan scene for collision avoidance" />
                                <Action ID="attach large gear to scene" name="" />
                                <Action ID="look at" name="look at chuck" pose="{object pose}" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="approach door" pose="{insertion pose}" shift_x="-0.35" shift_y="-0.12" shift_z="0.2" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="prepare to insert" pose="{insertion pose}" shift_y="-0.17" />
                                <Action ID="trial and error insert" name="" pose="{insertion pose}" />
                                <Action ID="remove large gear from scene" name="" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="back to prepare to insert" pose="{insertion pose}" shift_y="-0.17" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="back to approach for door" pose="{insertion pose}" shift_x="-0.35" shift_y="0.12" shift_z="0.2" />
                                <Action ID="retreat arm" name="" />
                            </Sequence>

                            <ForceFailure name="reset arm">
                                <Action ID="retreat arm" name="" />
                            </ForceFailure>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            </Sequence>

            <Action ID="ask" name="" what="unable insert large gear" />
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="go pick screw">
        <!--        <Action name="go pick first screw" ID="go pick screw" />-->
        <Fallback name="go pick screw">

            <Sequence name="go pick screw">
                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3" name="">
                    <Action ID="move to" place="screw station" name="move to screw station" />
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>

                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3" name="">
                    <Sequence name="">
                        <Sequence name="detect screw">
                            <Action ID="lift torso" name="" />
                            <Action ID="look at table" name="" />
                            <Action ID="detect screw" output="{object pose}" name="" />
                        </Sequence>
                        <Fallback name="pick screw">
                            <Sequence name="pick screw">
                                <Action ID="convert to grasp pose" name="" from="{object pose}" output="{grasp pose}" />
                                <Action ID="scan scene" name="scan scene for collision avoidance" />
                                <!--                                <Action ID="attach object" object_name="screw" name="" />-->
                                <Action ID="look at" name="look at screw" pose="{object pose}" />
                                <Action ID="open gripper" name="close griper slightly" position="0.035" />
                                <!--                                <Action ID="reach" name="approach for grasp pose" pose="{grasp pose}" shift_z="0.2" />-->
                                <Action ID="reach" name="approach for grasp pose" pose="{grasp pose}" shift_z="0.1" />
                                <Action ID="allow partial collision" where="{object pose}" width="0.06" padding="0.03" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="reach for grasp pose" pose="{grasp pose}" shift_z="-0.01" />
                                <Action ID="close gripper" name="grasp screw" />
                                <Condition ID="check grasped" name="check if grasped" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="back to approach pose" pose="{grasp pose}" shift_z="0.1" />
                                <!--                                <Action ID="reach" name="back to approach pose" pose="{grasp pose}" shift_z="0.2" />-->
                                <Action ID="retreat arm" name="" />
                            </Sequence>

                            <ForceFailure name="reset arm">
                                <Action ID="retreat arm" name="" />
                            </ForceFailure>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            </Sequence>

            <Action ID="ask" name="" what="unable pick screw" />
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>


    <BehaviorTree ID="go place screw">
        <!--        <Action name="go place first screw" ID="go place screw" />-->
        <Fallback name="go place screw" >

            <Sequence name="go place screw">
                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3" name="">
                    <Action ID="move to" place="caddy station" name="move to caddy station" />
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>

                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3" name="">
                    <Sequence name="">
                        <Sequence name="detect screw compartment">
                            <Action ID="lift torso" name="" />
                            <Action ID="look at table" name=""/>
                            <Action ID="detect caddy" name="detect screw compartment" part="screw compartment" output="{object pose}" />
                        </Sequence>

                        <Fallback name="place screw into caddy">
                            <Sequence name="place screw into caddy">
                                <Action ID="convert to grasp pose" name="convert to place pose" from="{object pose}" shift_z="0.06" output="{place pose}" />
                                <Action ID="scan scene" name="scan scene for collision avoidance" />
                                <!--                                <Action ID="attach object" object_name="screw" name="" />-->
                                <Action ID="look at" name="look at screw compartment" pose="{object pose}" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="approach for place pose" pose="{place pose}" shift_z="0.1" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="reach for place pose" pose="{place pose}" />
                                <Action ID="open gripper" name="release screw" />
                                <Action ID="reach" name="back to approach pose" pose="{place pose}" shift_z="0.1"/>
                                <Action ID="retreat arm" name="" />
                            </Sequence>
                            <ForceFailure name="reset arm">
                                <Action ID="retreat arm" name="" />
                            </ForceFailure>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            </Sequence>

            <Action ID="ask" what="unable to place screw" name="" />
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree sets three values in the blackboard and then executes a Fibonacci task with a specified server. The Fibonacci task has a timeout of 10 seconds, and if it takes longer than 5 seconds to cancel, an "AlwaysSuccess" node is executed. This behavior tree seems to be part of a system where a robot or an AI agent is performing a series of tasks, possibly as part of a larger decision-making process or action sequence.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <ReactiveSequence>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="the_answer1" value="hello"/>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="the_answer2" value="hello"/>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="the_answer3" value="hello"/>
            <Fibonacci server_name="/fibonacci" server_timeout="10" cancel_timeout="5" />
            <AlwaysSuccess/>
        </ReactiveSequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to handle the task of opening a closed door. It consists of a sequence that includes a retry mechanism, attempting to open the door four times before succeeding. The tree also contains various other actions and conditions related to doors, such as closing the door, checking if the door is open, and passing through the door or window.

In summary, the main task of this behavior tree is to repeatedly attempt to open a closed door until it succeeds, while also providing additional functionalities related to door operations such as closing the door, checking its status, and passing through it.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="DoorClosed">
    <!--  //////////  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="DoorClosed">
        <Sequence name="door_closed_sequence">
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="4">
                <Action ID="OpenDoor"/>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  //////////  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="CloseDoor"/>
        <SubTree ID="DoorClosed"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDoorOpen"/>
        <Action ID="OpenDoor"/>
        <Action ID="PassThroughDoor"/>
        <Action ID="PassThroughWindow"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  //////////  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the task of a robot navigating through a door or window. The "MainTree" sequence first attempts to check if the door is open; if it is, the robot passes through the door. If the door is closed, the robot follows the behavior specified in the "DoorClosed" subtree. This subtree includes an attempt to open the door, with a retry mechanism if unsuccessful, and then passing through the door.

If both these attempts fail, the robot resorts to passing through a window. Finally, regardless of the outcome, the robot closes the door behind it. The behavior tree is designed to ensure that the robot successfully navigates from one side of the door or window to the other, adapting its approach based on the state of the door.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="DoorClosed">
        <Sequence name="door_closed_sequence">
            <Inverter>
                <Condition ID="IsDoorOpen"/>
            </Inverter>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="4">
                <Action ID="OpenDoor"/>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <Action ID="PassThroughDoor"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Fallback name="root_Fallback">
                <Sequence name="door_open_sequence">
                    <Condition ID="IsDoorOpen"/>
                    <Action ID="PassThroughDoor"/>
                </Sequence>
                <SubTree ID="DoorClosed"/>
                <Action ID="PassThroughWindow"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="CloseDoor"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="CloseDoor"/>
        <SubTree ID="DoorClosed"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDoorOpen"/>
        <Action ID="OpenDoor"/>
        <Action ID="PassThroughDoor"/>
        <Action ID="PassThroughWindow"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot's navigation and recovery in case of being stuck. It begins by checking if the robot is stuck, and if so, it initiates a recovery sequence involving stopping, backing up, and spinning to free itself. If not stuck, it proceeds with the navigation branch based on the "parallel.xml" file.

In the navigation branch, it computes a path to a specific pose using the given endpoints and stores it as 'path'. Then, it enters a parallel node where it simultaneously follows the computed path and updates the path at a specified rate. This allows the robot to navigate while continuously updating its path to adapt to any changes in the environment.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can recover from being stuck and efficiently navigate to its designated pose, adapting to changes in the environment during navigation.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree first goes into a branch where it will check if the robot is stuck.
  If that is the case, it will attempt to recover. Otherwise it will continue with
  the navigation branch. In this case the navigation branch is based on `parallel.xml`.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence name="root">
      <FallbackStar name="check_motion">
        <Inverter name="is_not_stuck">
          <IsStuck/>
        </Inverter>
        <SequenceStar name="stuck_recovery">
          <Stop/>
          <BackUp/>
          <Spin/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </FallbackStar>
      <SequenceStar name="navigate">
        <ComputePathToPose endpoints="${endpoints}" path="${path}"/>
        <ParallelNode threshold="1">
          <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
          <Sequence>
            <RateController hz="2">
              <ComputePathToPose endpoints="${endpoints}" path="${path}"/>
            </RateController>
            <UpdatePath/>
          </Sequence>
        </ParallelNode>
      </SequenceStar>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to navigate a robot while continuously replanning the global path after every 1 meter of movement. It uses a pipeline sequence consisting of two steps: 
1. The DistanceController component computes a new path to the goal pose using the "GridBased" planner whenever the robot has moved 1 meter.
2. The FollowPath component then guides the robot along the computed path.

This setup ensures that the robot dynamically adjusts its path as it moves, allowing for efficient and adaptive navigation in changing environments.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path after every 1m.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <DistanceController distance="1.0">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </DistanceController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
This behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate within an environment, specifically in the context of an elevator. The tree includes recovery actions and periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz. 

The sequence begins with restoring configurations for various nodes related to mapping, control, and footprints. It then proceeds to execute a series of actions within a recovery node named "NavigateRecovery". This involves updating the path to the goal, following the updated path, and performing recovery actions if needed.

The "UpdatePathRecovery" node attempts to compute a new path to the goal, while the "FollowPathRecovery" node follows the computed path using a specific controller. If necessary, it also executes recovery actions such as clearing the global and local costmaps and waiting.

Overall, this behavior tree ensures that the robot can navigate within the elevator environment by periodically updating its path and executing recovery actions when required.
output:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

<!--
 Copyright (c) 2020  Carnegie Mellon University

 Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
 of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
 in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
 to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
 copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
 furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

 The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
 copies or substantial portions of the Software.

 THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
 IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
 FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
 AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
 LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
 OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
 SOFTWARE.
-->
<!--
    This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
    recovery actions.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="ElevatorTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="ElevatorTree">
    <RestoreConfig node_name="/footprint_publisher">
      <RestoreConfig node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap">
	<RestoreConfig node_name="/controller_server">
	  <Sequence>
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/controller_server"
			 param_name="FollowPath.max_vel_x"
			 param_value="0.5"  name="ChangeParamSpeedDown"/>
	    
	    <ChangeParam node_name="/global_costmap/global_costmap"
			 param_name="people_obstacle_layer.people_enabled"
			 param_value="false"  name="DisablePeopleObstacle"/>

	    <SetBlackboard value="true" output_key="first_time" />

	    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="99999999" name="NavigateRecovery">
	      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
		<!-- Not using RateController, so that the robot can keep trying to find the initial/updated path -->
		<RecoveryNode number_of_retries="99999999" name="UpdatePathRecovery">
		  <Sequence>
		    <WaitFloat wait_duration_float="0.5"/>
		    <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased" />
		    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="{first_time}" value_B="true">
		      <Sequence>
			<PublishTopic topic="/cabot/event" value="navigation;event;elevator_door_may_be_ready"/>
			<SetBlackboard value="false" output_key="first_time" />
		      </Sequence>
		    </BlackboardCheckString>
		  </Sequence>
		  <AlwaysSuccess/>
		</RecoveryNode>
		<RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPathRecovery">
		  <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath" />
		  <AlwaysSuccess/>
		</RecoveryNode>
	      </PipelineSequence>
	      <RecoveryNode>
		<SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
		  <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-context" server_timeout="5000"
                                      service_name="/global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
		  <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" server_timeout="5000"
				      service_name="/local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
		  <Wait wait_duration="1.0"/>		  
		</SequenceStar>
		<AlwaysSuccess/>
	      </RecoveryNode>
	    </RecoveryNode>
	  </Sequence>
	</RestoreConfig>
      </RestoreConfig>
    </RestoreConfig>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot named mobipick to fetch a tool, offer it to a person, stow it away if necessary, and then drive back home. It consists of several sequential steps:

1. Initialization
2. Fetching the tool from a table if not already holding any objects
3. Driving to the handover location
4. Moving the arm to hand over the tool to a person
5. User interaction
6. Placing any held object onto the table if necessary
7. Driving back home

The tree handles contingencies such as checking if the robot is already holding objects before fetching the tool and ensuring that any held object is placed on the table if needed. Once all these tasks are completed, the robot signals that it's done.

Overall, the behavior tree coordinates a series of actions for mobipick to perform a tool-handling task, including error handling and user interaction.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <!-- This behavior tree lets mobipick fetch the tool, offer it to a person, stow it away if needed,
        and finally drive back home. -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <SequenceStar name="mobipick_pick_n_place">
            <InitNode name="Init"/>
            <!-- The get_tool_fallback lets mobipick fetch the tool from the table if it is not holding any objects already. -->
            <Fallback name="get_tool_fallback">
                <HasAttachedObjects name="HasAttachedObjects"/>
                <SequenceStar name="fetch_tool_sequence">
                    <DriveToNode name="DriveTo" goal="pick"/>
                    <MoveItNode name="MoveIt" function="CaptureObject"/>
                    <MoveItNode name="MoveIt" function="PickUpObject"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </Fallback>
            <DriveToNode name="DriveTo" goal="handover"/>
            <MoveItNode name="MoveIt" function="MoveArmToHandover"/>
            <UserInteractionNode name="UserInteraction"/>
            <!-- The clear_gripper_fallback lets mobipick place any object it is holding onto the table. -->
            <Fallback name="clear_gripper_fallback">
                <Inverter>
                    <HasAttachedObjects name="HasAttachedObjects"/>
                </Inverter>
                <SequenceStar name="stash_tool_sequence">
                    <DriveToNode name="DriveTo" goal="place"/>
                    <MoveItNode name="MoveIt" function="PlaceObject"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </Fallback>
            <DriveToNode name="DriveTo" goal="home"/>
            <DoneNode name="Done"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for a robot. The robot is programmed to perform various tasks based on different conditions and events. 

Initially, it attempts to autonomously navigate through a sequence of actions. If it encounters an obstacle or challenge, it will either follow a human for guidance, search for a specific object (bottle), or attempt to grasp the bottle if found. If none of these actions are feasible, it will resort to asking for help.

The tree encompasses multiple fallbacks and sequences, each containing conditions and actions such as navigating to a room, following a human, finding and grasping a bottle, computing inverse poses, and handling invalid poses. Additionally, there are conditions to check if the robot is in a known room, if the bottle is found, if it's grasped, if it's located, and if the inverse pose is computed and valid.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's decision-making process, enabling it to autonomously perform tasks,
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="bt0008">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="bt0008">
        <Fallback name="Main">
            <Sequence name="Autonomus">
                <Fallback name="ReachRoom">
                    <Sequence name="ShouldFollow">
                        <Condition ID="RoomKnown"/>
                        <Fallback name="GoToRoom_Fal">
                            <Condition ID="RobotInRoom"/>
                            <Action ID="GoToRoom"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="FollowHuman"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="BottleFound">
                    <Condition ID="BottleFound"/>
                    <Action ID="FindBottle"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fetch">
                    <Condition ID="BottleGrasped"/>
                    <Sequence name="Grasp">
                        <Fallback name="InvPoseCompute">
                            <Sequence name="SeqInvPose">
                                <Condition ID="InvPoseComputed"/>
                                <Condition ID="InvPoseValid"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="ComputeInvPose"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="GoInvPose">
                            <Condition ID="RobotAtInvPose"/>
                            <Sequence name="prepare">
                                <Action ID="KeepArmsForGrasp"/>
                                <Action ID="GoToInvPose"/>
                            </Sequence>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="Locate">
                            <Condition ID="BottleLocated"/>
                            <Action ID="LocateBottle"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="GraspBottle"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="SetInvPoseInvaild"/>
                    <Action ID="KeepRunning"/>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="AskForHelp"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AskForHelp"/>
        <Condition ID="BottleFound"/>
        <Condition ID="BottleGrasped"/>
        <Condition ID="BottleLocated"/>
        <Action ID="ComputeInvPose"/>
        <Action ID="FindBottle"/>
        <Action ID="FollowHuman"/>
        <Action ID="GoToInvPose"/>
        <Action ID="GoToRoom"/>
        <Action ID="GraspBottle"/>
        <Condition ID="InvPoseComputed"/>
        <Condition ID="InvPoseValid"/>
        <Action ID="KeepArmsForGrasp"/>
        <Action ID="KeepRunning"/>
        <Action ID="LocateBottle"/>
        <Condition ID="RobotAtInvPose"/>
        <Condition ID="RobotInRoom"/>
        <Condition ID="RoomKnown"/>
        <Action ID="SetInvPoseInvaild"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree defines a sequence for arm movement with user input. It prompts the user to input x, y, and z coordinates in millimeters within the range of -1000 to 1000. Additionally, it requests the gripper position as a value between 0 (open) and 1 (closed). Once these inputs are provided, the ArmMovement action is executed using the specified coordinates and gripper position. This behavior tree essentially facilitates user-driven control of the robot arm's movement by taking user input for the desired arm position and gripper state, and then executing the arm movement accordingly.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "ArmMovementWithRequest" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="ArmMovementWithRequest">
        <Sequence>
            <FloatParameterRequest title="Bitte geben Sie x, y und z in [mm] an"
                                   value="{x}" key="x" min="-1000" max="1000"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest value="{y}" key="y" min="-1000" max="1000"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest value="{z}" key="z" min="-1000" max="1000"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest msg="Geben Sie die Greiferposition von 0 [open] bis 1 [closed] an"
                                   value="{gripper_position}" key="gripper_position" min="0" max="1"/>
            <ArmMovement x="{x}" y="{y}" z="{z}" gripper_position="{gripper_position}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
 </root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a social robot's interactions over a period of 100 cycles. During each cycle, the robot performs a sequence of actions. It first checks the time using "Chrono", then attempts a social interaction with another agent ("agent_3") by navigating to a specific goal ("hri"). If this social interaction fails, it navigates back home ("navigate_to_wp" with goal "home"), turns, and writes data to a CSV file.

This behavior is designed for a social robot to engage in repeated social interactions while also ensuring it can navigate back home, record its activities, and manage its overall behavior within a defined timeframe.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <Repeat num_cycles="100">
                <Sequence name="social_interaction">
                    <Chrono/>
                    <ReactiveFallback name="SocialActionFallback">
                        <isGoalReached/>
                        <SocialNav2Action 
                            name="social_nav2_action" 
                            goal="hri" 
                            agent_id="agent_3"/>
                    </ReactiveFallback>
                    <NavigateToWp  name="navigate_to_wp" goal="home"/>
                    <TurnAgent/>
                    <WriteCSV/>
                </Sequence>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
     </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a system to dynamically navigate towards a specific pose while continuously updating the goal and path. The system operates at a frequency of 2 Hz, ensuring that the navigation process is updated regularly. It uses a planner with the ID "GridBased" to compute the path to the updated goal. If the goal is updated, it triggers the system to follow the updated path using the "FollowPath" controller. This approach allows the system to adapt its navigation based on changes in the environment or the target pose.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree follows a dynamic pose to a certain distance
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="2.0">
        <Sequence>
          <GoalUpdater input_goal="{goal}" output_goal="{updated_goal}">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{updated_goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          </GoalUpdater>
        </Sequence>
      </RateController>
      <ReactiveFallback name="test">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate through an environment with periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions. The main sequence involves navigating with replanning, where the robot computes a path to a specific pose using a grid-based planner and then follows that path using a specified controller. If there are issues during this process, it allows for a limited number of retries before moving on to recovery actions.

The recovery actions involve clearing the entire local and global costmaps to reset the robot's perception of the environment and waiting for a brief duration. This ensures that if the robot encounters difficulties in navigation, it can recover by resetting its understanding of the surroundings and taking a momentary pause before resuming its navigation tasks.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
        <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
        <Wait wait_duration="2"/>
      </SequenceStar>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for an animal, with different actions based on various conditions. The "MainTree" starts with a fallback node that contains a single action "RandomMoveBig". 

The "ShedTree" consists of three main sequences within a fallback node. The first sequence involves leaving the shed, finding a random pasture field, and moving there. The second sequence is triggered when it's night and involves finding the shed, moving there, and entering the shed. The third sequence occurs during the day and if not in the shed, triggers a random move action.

The tree includes numerous conditions and actions such as determining if it's day or night, being in the shed or on the pasture, finding prey, giving birth, laying eggs, and more. It also includes sub-tree references like "ShedTree" to encapsulate complex behaviors.

Overall, the behavior tree models the decision-making process of an animal, encompassing various activities and responses based on environmental and internal conditions
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <FallbackStar name="AnimalStandard">
            <Action ID="RandomMoveBig"/>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="ShedTree">
        <FallbackStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsOnPasture"/>
                <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
                <Action ID="LeaveShed"/>
                <Action ID="FindRandomPastureField"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsOnPasture"/>
                <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Action ID="FindShed"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="EnterShed"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
            </SequenceStar>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="CanHaveSex"/>
        <Action ID="EatPrey"/>
        <Action ID="EnterShed"/>
        <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindRandomPastureField"/>
        <Action ID="FindRetreat"/>
        <Action ID="FindShed"/>
        <Action ID="GiveBirth"/>

        <Condition ID="IsHerbivore"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMale"/>
        <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
        <Condition ID="IsOnPasture"/>
        <Condition ID="IsPregnant"/>
        <Condition ID="IsProducer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsReadyToGiveBirth"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWoodVermin"/>
        <Condition ID="IsYoung"/>
        <Action ID="KillPrey"/>
        <Action ID="LayEgg"/>
        <Action ID="LeaveShed"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <Action ID="Produce"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMoveBig"/>
        <SubTree ID="ShedTree"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        <Action ID="TryHaveSex"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the decision-making process for a virtual character. The character's main priorities are addressing its needs (hunger, thirst, and sleep) and performing various job-related tasks.

When the character is hungry, it will first attempt to find food and then eat. If thirsty, it will search for a drink and then consume it. When sleepy, it will locate a bed and proceed to sleep. These actions are prioritized within the "Hunger," "Thirst," and "Sleepy" sub-trees.

In addition to managing its basic needs, the character also engages in job-related activities. It follows a sequence of steps for standard jobs, including initializing the job, claiming items, finding tools, moving, equipping tools, working, and finishing the job. It also handles specific tasks such as leaving the map or trading at a market stall.

The overarching "MainTree" coordinates these activities, ensuring that the character addresses its needs before attending to its job responsibilities. If
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Hunger">
        <SequenceStar name="Hunger">
            <FallbackStar>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
                    <Action ID="FindFood"/>
                </Sequence>
            </FallbackStar>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="Eat"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobStandard">
        <SequenceStar name="StandardJobs">
            <Action ID="InitJob"/>
            <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
            <Action ID="FindTool"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="20">
                <Inverter>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Inverter>
                            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                        </Inverter>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                </Inverter>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="Work"/>
            <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Jobs">
        <FallbackStar>
            <SequenceStar name="Leave">
                <Condition ID="IsTimeToLeave"/>
                <Action ID="GetExitPosition"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="LeaveMap"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar name="WorkAtMarketStall">
                <Action ID="GetMarketStallPosition"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="Trade"/>
            </SequenceStar>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <FallbackStar name="GnomeTrader">
            <FallbackStar name="Needs">
                <SubTree ID="Hunger"/>
                <SubTree ID="Thirst"/>
                <SubTree ID="Sleepy"/>
            </FallbackStar>
            <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Sleepy">
        <SequenceStar name="Sleep">
            <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="FindBed"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Thirst">
        <SequenceStar name="Thirst">
            <FallbackStar>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
                    <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
                </Sequence>
            </FallbackStar>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="Drink"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
        <Action ID="Drink"/>
        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
        <Action ID="Eat"/>
        <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
        <Action ID="FindBed"/>
        <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
        <Action ID="FindFood"/>
        <Action ID="FindDining"/>
        <Action ID="FindTool"/>
        <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetExitPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetMarketStallPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="Hunger"/>
        <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitButcherJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsButcherJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
        <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTimeToLeave"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryThirsty"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
        <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
        <Action ID="LeaveMap"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>
