</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the decision-making process for an entity, likely a game character or AI agent. The entity has several actions and conditions that guide its behavior. 

The main tree "MainTree" follows a fallback pattern, where it first attempts to execute a sequence of actions: getting a target, moving, checking if the target is adjacent, and attacking the target if so. If any of these fail, it resorts to a random movement action.

The available actions include "AttackTarget," "GetTarget," "Move," "RandomMove," and "Sleep." Additionally, there are conditions such as "IsDay," "IsFemale," "IsHungry," "IsMale," "IsNight," and "TargetAdjacent" which likely influence the decision-making within the tree.

Overall, the behavior tree governs the entity's decision-making process, considering various conditions and executing appropriate actions based on the circumstances.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Fallback>
            <SequenceStar name="Main">
                <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Sequence>
                    <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
                    <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
                </Sequence>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
        <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
        <Condition ID="IsFemale"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsMale"/>
        <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle is programmed to perform various actions based on conditions and events encountered during its operation.

The main sequence "Core_seq" includes sub-sequences and actions such as initializing, generating global paths, handling mission start conditions, lane change checks, local path generation, collision checks, and driving actions. These sequences and actions are executed based on specific conditions like checking for nearby objects, lane change feasibility, collision avoidance, and mission wait status.

Additionally, the behavior tree contains a sub-tree "treeGenGlobalFollowPath" that handles the generation of global paths with considerations for lane changes, collision avoidance, and following predefined routes.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the vehicle's decision-making process by evaluating environmental conditions and executing appropriate actions to ensure safe and efficient navigation.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback name="Core_seq">
            <Sequence>
                <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
                <Action ID="stop"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="init"/>
                <SubTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath"/>
                <Fallback name="mission_start">
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
                                <Fallback name="loc_check">
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
                                        <Action ID="acc"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                </Fallback>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Fallback name="lane_check">
                                <Sequence>
                                    <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
                                    <Fallback name="lane_check">
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Condition ID="checkLeftchageAble"/>
                                            <Fallback>
                                                <Sequence>
                                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                    <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                                <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Fallback>
                                            <Sequence>
                                                <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                            <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                                        </Fallback>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="Local_path">
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
                                        <Sequence name="Gen_Local">
                                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                                            <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
                                            <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Fallback name="local_check">
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
                                            <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Condition ID="checkPassAble"/>
                                <Sequence>
                                    <Sequence>
                                        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                        <Action ID="stop"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="stop"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="setPath"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath">
        <Fallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
                <Fallback>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="checkLetfChange"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                            <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="acc"/>
        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
        <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLeftchageAble"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLetfChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
        <Condition ID="checkPassAble"/>
        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
        <Action ID="drive"/>
        <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
        <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
        <Action ID="init"/>
        <Action ID="keepLane"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="localPathFollow"/>
        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
        <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
        <Action ID="setPath"/>
        <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
        <Action ID="stop"/>
        <SubTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree initializes navigation and instructs a robot to navigate and find an object. It first sets up the navigation system and then attempts to find the object. If the object is not found, it enters a recovery mode where it repeatedly navigates and spins in an attempt to locate the object. Once the object is found, it will perform the next sequence of tasks. The behavior tree allows for flexibility by specifying parameters such as timeout duration, number of retries, goal poses, spin cycles, spin distance, and wait time. Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the process of navigating and searching for a specific object while incorporating recovery mechanisms to handle potential failures.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree initialize navigation at the moment, but will navigate and find an object
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
      <Sequence name="root_sequence">
          <InitializeNavigation timeout_s="{timeout_s}"/>
          <!-- Set this value at task_monitor! -->
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="100" name="FindElementRecovery">
              <ElementFound/>
              <Sequence name="navigate_and_spin_sequence">
                  <GetNextPose goal_poses="{goal_poses}" new_position_goal="{goal_position}" new_orientation_goal="{goal_orientation}"/>
                  <NavigateToPose position="{goal_position}" orientation="{goal_orientation}"/>
                  <Repeat num_cycles="{spin_cycles}">
                      <Sequence name="spin_and_wait">
                          <Spin spin_dist="{spin_angle}"/>
                          <Wait wait_duration="{wait_time}"/>
                      </Sequence>
                  </Repeat>
              </Sequence> 
            <!-- Insert next sequence once the element is found -->
          </RecoveryNode>
      </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to dynamically navigate to a specific location while continuously updating its path. The robot's movement is controlled by a pipeline sequence that includes rate control and path following with replanning.

At a set frequency of 1.0 Hz, the robot updates its goal pose and computes a new path using the GridBased planner. This updated path is then truncated based on a specified distance. The robot will continuously follow this truncated path until it reaches the goal or encounters a failure.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's navigation by dynamically adjusting its path while ensuring continuous movement towards the goal location.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree follows a dynamic pose to a certain distance
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Sequence>
          <GoalUpdater input_goal="{goal}" output_goal="{updated_goal}">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{updated_goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          </GoalUpdater>
         <TruncatePath distance="1.0" input_path="{path}" output_path="{truncated_path}"/>
        </Sequence>
      </RateController>
      <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        <FollowPath path="{truncated_path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a high-level mission planner for a vehicle. It first computes a route to the desired goal pose using a server named "/route_planner/plan_route". Then, it uses a rate controller to ensure a frequency of 10 Hz and computes a trajectory based on the route using a server named "/trajectory_planner/plan_trajectory". Finally, it follows the computed trajectory using a path tracking controller with the server name "/path_tracking_controller/follow_trajectory".

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the process of planning a route, computing a trajectory, and then following that trajectory to reach the desired goal pose. This sequence of actions allows the vehicle to navigate towards its intended destination while considering constraints and collision information.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <!-- Compute the route to desired goal pose. This will be the high-level mission planner which doesn't 
            consider any vehicle constraints or collison information. Later change "trajectory" to "route" -->
            <ComputeRoute goal_pose="{goal_pose}" route="{route}" server_name="/route_planner/plan_route"/>
            <!-- <ComputePlan route="{route}" path="{path}" server_name="/path_planner/plan_path"/> -->
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <RateController hz="10.0">
                    <ComputeTrajectory route="{route}" trajectory="{trajectory}" server_name="/trajectory_planner/plan_trajectory"/>
                </RateController>
                <FollowTrajectory trajectory="{trajectory}" server_name="/path_tracking_controller/follow_trajectory"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate with periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions. The main sequence involves navigating with replanning, which consists of computing a path to a specific pose using a grid-based planner and then following that path while clearing the local costmap. If there are any failures during this process, it allows for retries before moving to recovery fallback actions. The recovery fallback includes clearing both the local and global costmaps, performing a spin action, and then waiting for a specified duration. This entire process is encapsulated within a recovery node with a set number of retries. Overall, the behavior tree ensures robust navigation by incorporating periodic replanning and recovery mechanisms to handle potential failures in the navigation process.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
          <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate through an environment with periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions. The main sequence involves navigating with replanning, where the robot computes a path to a specified goal using a grid-based planner. If there are failures in computing the path or following the path, recovery nodes are triggered with a limited number of retries. These recovery nodes include actions such as clearing the global and local costmaps, waiting for a specific duration, and spinning to recover from errors. Additionally, if the robot receives updated goals during any phase, it will wait for a specified duration before attempting to recover. This behavior tree ensures that the robot can navigate effectively through the environment while handling potential failures and adapting to changing circumstances.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="2" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="4" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ReactiveFallback name="PathToPoseFallback">
              <GoalUpdated/>
              <RoundRobin name="GlobalPlannerRecoveryActions">
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
                <Wait wait_duration="2"/>
              </RoundRobin>
            </ReactiveFallback>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="4" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathFallback">
            <GoalUpdated/>
            <RoundRobin name="PlannerRecoveryActions">
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
              <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
            </RoundRobin>
          </ReactiveFallback>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a set of tasks for an AI entity. The tasks include combat, acquiring a uniform, managing hunger and thirst, performing various job types such as butchering animals, dyeing animals, harvesting animals, hauling multiple items, leading animals to pasture, standard jobs, and taming animals. Additionally, it includes actions related to sleeping, training, and supervising training.

The "Combat" behavior involves checking if the entity is in combat, aborting the current job, getting a target, moving towards the target, and attacking if the target is adjacent.

The "GetUniform" behavior focuses on checking, equipping, and cleaning up a uniform.

The "Hunger" and "Thirst" behaviors involve finding food or drink, moving to the location, picking up items, and consuming them until full.

The "Job" behaviors are specific to different types of jobs with sequences for each type, including conditions and actions related to the respective job type.

Overall, the behavior tree
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Combat">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
                        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="GetUniform">
        <SequenceStar name="GetUniform">
            <Action ID="CheckUniform"/>
            <Fallback>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="UniformCleanUp"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="EquipUniform"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Hunger">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
            <Sequence>
                <SequenceStar name="Hunger">
                    <Action ID="FindFood"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                    <Action ID="Eat"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsFull"/>
            </Sequence>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobButcherAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="ButcherAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobDyeAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="DyeAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                    <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="DyeAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="HarvestAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobHaulMultiple">
        <BB_Precondition expected="HauleMultipleItems" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                    <Action ID="FindTool"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
                    <Inverter>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Inverter>
                                <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
                            </Inverter>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Action ID="Move"/>
                                <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="DropAllItems"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture">
        <BB_Precondition expected="LeadAnimalToPasture" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobStandard">
        <Fallback>
            <SequenceStar name="StandardJobs">
                <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
                <Action ID="FindTool"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
                <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
                <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="Work"/>
                <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobTameAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="TameAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="TameAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Jobs">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="GetJob"/>
            <FallbackStar>
                <SubTree ID="JobButcherAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobDyeAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobTameAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobHaulMultiple"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
            </FallbackStar>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob">
        <Sequence>
            <Inverter>
                <Sequence>
                    <Inverter>
                        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                    </Inverter>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Inverter>
            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="OldMoveAllItemsToJob">
        <FallbackStar>
            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="20">
                <Sequence>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                            <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                            <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                    <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                </Sequence>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <ForceFailure>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </ForceFailure>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Sleepy">
        <SequenceStar name="Sleep">
            <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="FindBed"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Thirst">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
            <Sequence>
                <SequenceStar name="Thirst">
                    <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                    <Action ID="Drink"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsDrinkFull"/>
            </Sequence>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Trainer">
        <SequenceStar name="Trainer">
            <Condition ID="IsTrainer"/>
            <Action ID="FindTrainerPosition"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="SuperviseTraining"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Training">
        <SequenceStar name="Training">
            <Condition ID="IsTrainingTime"/>
            <Action ID="FindTrainingGround"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="Train"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
        <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="CheckUniform"/>
        <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
        <SubTree ID="Combat"/>
        <Action ID="Drink"/>
        <Action ID="DropAllItems"/>
        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
        <Action ID="DyeAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="Eat"/>
        <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
        <Action ID="EquipUniform"/>
        <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="FindBed"/>
        <Action ID="FindDining"/>
        <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
        <Action ID="FindFood"/>
        <Action ID="FindTool"/>
        <Action ID="FindTrainerPosition"/>
        <Action ID="FindTrainingGround"/>
        <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
        <SubTree ID="GetUniform"/>
        <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="Hunger"/>
        <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitButcherJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsButcherJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDrinkFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
        <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
        <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTrainer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTrainingTime"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryThirsty"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobButcherAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobDyeAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobHaulMultiple"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobTameAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
        <SubTree ID="OldMoveAllItemsToJob"/>
        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>

    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robotic system that controls the movement and blinking of its antennas. The system is designed to continuously run a sequence of actions until it encounters a failure. 

Initially, the system activates the antennas with a specific rate and intensity, causing them to blink in a certain pattern for 3 seconds. After this, there is another delay of 3 seconds before the antennas are activated again with a different rate and intensity, resulting in a new blinking pattern. Following another 9-second delay, the antennas are once more activated with an altered rate, intensity, and blinking pattern.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates a continuous cycle where the robot's antennas undergo predefined actions involving activation, delays, and changes in blinking patterns. This process continues indefinitely unless a failure occurs.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<KeepRunningUntilFailure>
			<Sequence>
				<Delay delay_msec="3000">
					<AntennaAction rate="0" intensity="10" left_blink_pattern="01" right_blink_pattern="10" />
				</Delay>
				<Delay delay_msec="3000">
					<AntennaAction rate="5" intensity="100" left_blink_pattern="01" right_blink_pattern="10" />
				</Delay>
        		<Delay delay_msec="9000">
          			<AntennaAction rate="10" intensity="100" left_blink_pattern="111100000" right_blink_pattern="00001111" />
        		</Delay>
			</Sequence>
		</KeepRunningUntilFailure>
	</BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's movement towards a specified goal. Initially, the robot is instructed to move to a location with coordinates (1, 2, 3). The "MoveRobot" subtree handles this movement and provides feedback on the outcome. If successful, the robot will say "mission accomplished"; otherwise, it will say "mission failed".

The "MoveRobot" subtree employs a fallback mechanism, attempting to execute a sequence of moving to the specified goal and updating the output accordingly. In case of failure, it directly sets the output as "mission failed". This structure ensures that the robot communicates the result of its movement operation.

In summary, the behavior tree manages the robot's navigation to a designated location and conveys the success or failure of this task through verbal communication.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">

        <Sequence name="main_sequence">
            <SetBlackboard output_key="move_goal" value="1;2;3" />
            <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="move_goal" output="move_result" />
            <SaySomething message="{move_result}"/>
        </Sequence>

    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Fallback name="move_robot_main">
            <SequenceStar>
                <MoveBase       goal="{target}"/>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="output" value="mission accomplished" />
            </SequenceStar>
            <ForceFailure>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="output" value="mission failed" />
            </ForceFailure>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree defines a sequence of actions for a robot. First, it checks if the battery is okay, then it says "Mission Started!", moves to a specific location (1;2;3), and finally says "Mission completed!". The behavior tree follows a linear sequence of these actions.

The "BatteryOK" action presumably checks the status of the robot's battery. Then, the "SaySomething" action is used twice to communicate messages at the beginning and end of the mission. The "MoveBase" action directs the robot to move to a specific location defined by the coordinates (1;2;3).

Additionally, there are other actions defined in the TreeNodesModel section such as "ThinkWhatToSay", which seems to generate some text output based on input. However, these actions are not utilized in the main BehaviorTree.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action ID="BatteryOK"/>
            <Action ID="SaySomething" message="Mission Started!"/>
            <Action ID="MoveBase" goal="1;2;3"/>
            <Action ID="SaySomething" message="Mission completed!"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="BatteryOK"/>
        <Action ID="MoveBase">
            <input_port name="goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SaySomething">
            <input_port default=""Start thinking..."" name="message"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ThinkWhatToSay">
            <output_port default="{the_answer}" name="text"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to control a system that involves repeating a sequence of actions for a specified number of cycles. The actions include "LTLPreCheck" which checks the current and desired state sequence, "MoveAction" which initiates a move based on given parameters, and "UpdateLTL" which updates the action sequence and desired state while also outputting a new navigation goal.

The behavior tree iterates through these actions for a defined number of cycles, with each cycle involving the execution of the sequence of actions. The input and output ports of the actions facilitate the flow of data between them, enabling the coordination of the overall system behavior.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the repetitive execution of a sequence of actions, facilitating the monitoring and updating of states and goals within the system.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                <Action ID="MoveAction" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <output_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to control the actions of a robotic system. It consists of a sequence of actions that are repeated for a specified number of cycles. The tree includes various conditions, actions, and fallbacks to handle different scenarios.

The main sequence involves checking a pre-defined state against a desired sequence and executed sequence. If certain conditions are met, it triggers replanning requests at different levels. Additionally, there are reactive sequences that handle fake detections and check reactive LTL (Linear Temporal Logic) states.

Within the sequence, there's a switch statement that determines the type of action to be performed, such as moving, staying, picking, dropping, resetting, or guiding. Each action has specific input and output ports for managing the state and execution flow.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's actions based on its current state, desired sequences, and reactive inputs, while also handling replanning requests and executing different types of actions based on the situation.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel1" replanning_fake_input="{replanning_fake_input}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel3" replanning_fake_input="{replanning_fake_input}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Switch6 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="pick" case_4="drop" case_5="reset" case_6="start_guiding" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                            <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                            <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="PickAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="DropActionNew" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="ResetAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="GuideActionNew" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                        </Switch6>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="BackNormalAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DropAction">

            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DropActionNew">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel1">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel2">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel3">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GuideActionNew">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="PickAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ResetAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's movement towards three different goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c) in a repeated sequence. The robot is instructed to move towards each goal sequentially for a total of 3 cycles. The "MoveRobot" behavior tree specifies the navigation to a given target using the Nav2Client.

In summary, the robot will repeatedly navigate to Goal_a, then Goal_b, and finally Goal_c, for a total of 3 cycles. Each cycle involves moving to all three goals in sequence. This behavior can be interrupted if needed, allowing flexibility in the robot's task execution.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="3">
            <Sequence>
                <!-- The goal value="position-x;position-y;orientaion-z;orientation-w" -->
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-0.579;-1.341;0.0;1.0" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="5.214;-1.533;0.0;1.0" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-1.588;1.253;0.0;1.0" />
                <Sequence>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
                </Sequence>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <Nav2Client goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree controls a robot's actions in an environment. The robot is programmed to perform a sequence of tasks, starting with checking if it is in a specific room. If not, it will approach the room. Then, it sets the transformation frame for a specified object. Following this, it checks if it needs to turn towards the object and approaches the object if necessary.

The behavior tree uses Fallback to prioritize approaching the room over other tasks if the condition is met. It also utilizes ReactiveSequence to ensure that the robot only approaches the object after successfully turning towards it. This allows the robot to efficiently navigate its environment and interact with objects based on the specified conditions.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
     <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <!-- Utilizo Fallback por que en caso de que se cumpla -->
            <!-- la primera condicion, no es necesario AproachRoom -->
            <Fallback name="check_room"> <!-- Fallback: comprueba si esta en la habitacion, si no, va a ella-->
                <inRoom         name="in_room"        room="{room}"/>
                <ApproachRoom   name="approach_room"  room="{room}"/>
            </Fallback>
            <setTF         name="setTF"          object="{object}"/>
            <ReactiveSequence name="check_room"> <!-- Secuencia reactiva: si turnToTf no da success, no se ejcuta approach object-->
                <turnToTf        name="turn_to_tf"        object="{object}"/>
                <ApproachObject name="approach_object" object="{object}"/> <!-- Si esta en frente del objeto, se acerca-->
            </ReactiveSequence>
        </Sequence>
     </BehaviorTree>
 </root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot's navigation system. It continuously plans and adjusts the global path at 1 Hz, with specific recovery actions for planning, control, and general system issues. The RecoveryNode "NavigateRecovery" handles retries and contains a PipelineSequence "NavigateWithReplanning", which includes a RateController to control the planning frequency.

Within the "NavigateWithReplanning" sequence, there are two RecoveryNodes: "ComputePathToPose" and "FollowPath". "ComputePathToPose" calculates the path to the goal using a grid-based planner and has a recovery fallback mechanism. "FollowPath" executes the planned path and also has a recovery fallback in case of issues.

If any of the above recovery nodes fail, the "RecoveryFallback" handles general recovery actions such as clearing the costmaps, spinning, waiting, and backing up. These actions are executed in a round-robin manner to address various types of issues that may arise during navigation.

Overall
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions specific to planning / control as well as general system issues.
  This will be continuous if a kinematically valid planner is selected.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ReactiveFallback name="ComputePathToPoseRecoveryFallback">
              <GoalUpdated/>
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
            </ReactiveFallback>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathRecoveryFallback">
            <GoalUpdated/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          </ReactiveFallback>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <RoundRobin name="RecoveryActions">
          <Sequence name="ClearingActions">
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </Sequence>
          <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
          <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
          <BackUp backup_dist="0.15" backup_speed="0.025"/>
        </RoundRobin>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robot's task. The robot is programmed to perform a series of actions based on certain conditions and events. Initially, it will attempt to go to a known room. If the room is known, it will execute the action "Go_to_room"; otherwise, it will follow a human. Following this, the robot will try to find a bottle and fetch it. If any of these actions fail, the robot will resort to asking for help. 

This behavior tree outlines a decision-making process for the robot, where it prioritizes specific tasks but also has fallback options in case of failure. The actions are executed based on the state of the environment and the success or failure of preceding actions.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Root>
            <Fallback name="FB1">
                <Sequence name="S1">
                    <Fallback name="FB2">
                        <Sequence name="S3">
                            <Condition ID="Room_known"/>
                            <Action ID="Go_to_room"/>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Action ID="Follow_human"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Sequence name="S2">
                        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
                        <Action ID="Fetch_bottle"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
            </Fallback>
        </Root>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
        <Action ID="Fetch_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Follow_human"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_room"/>
        <Condition ID="Room_known"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--------------------------------------->
</root>

The behavior tree orchestrates a robotic system to perform a series of tasks in a structured sequence. The robot is programmed to execute the following steps:
1. ResetAX12: The robot resets its AX12 arm by performing a sequence of movements.
2. PickAllYellowAtoms: The robot moves to specific locations, picks up yellow atoms, and then performs a U-turn to drop the atoms.
3. EmptyBarrelRight: The robot empties a barrel by pushing items out from the right side.
4. TakeChaos: The robot navigates towards chaos and moves ahead a certain distance.

Each task involves a sequence of subtasks such as moving the arm, turning, picking up items, and waiting for specified durations. Additionally, there are parallel actions involved in some tasks, where the robot simultaneously performs multiple subtasks within certain thresholds.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines a complex set of coordinated actions for the robot, involving precise movements and interactions with its environment to accomplish various objectives.

            <MoveArmSideJoint name="move arm back to the center (joint mode)" pos="235"/>

            <TurnArm name="turn arm to the center"
                     pos="510"/>
            <MoveArmFront name="move arm to the front" pos="460"/>

            <!--<DeactivatePump/>-->
            <Wait name="wait for the atom to fall" delay="1000"/>

            <MoveArmFront name="move arm to the back" pos="950"/>

            <Wait name="wait for the atom to fall" delay="500"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="TurnBarrel">
        <Sequence>
            <ActivateBarrel name="start turning the barrel"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="10000000">
                <IsBarrelMoveFinished name="check if the barrel has turned enough"
                                      goalPosition="{barrelGoalPosition}"/>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <DeactivateBarrel name="stop turning the barrel"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="PushLeft">
        <Sequence>
            <PushLeftAtom name="push it"
                          pos="530"/>
            <PushLeftAtom name="come back"
                          pos="1000"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="PushRight">
        <Sequence>
            <!--<Wait name="visual" delay="2000"/>-->
            <PushRightAtom name="push it" pos="1000"/>
            <PushRightAtom name="come back" pos="580"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="TakeChaos">
        <Sequence>
            <!--<MoveAhead name="move ahead" distance="632"/>
            <Turn name="turn to the left" angle="-90"/>
            <MoveAhead name="move ahead" distance="255"/>
            <Turn name="adjust" angle="-1"/>
            <MoveAhead name="move ahead" distance="700"/>-->
            <Turn name="towards chaos" angle="-45"/>
            <MoveAhead name="move ahead" distance="500"/>
            <Turn name="towards chaos" angle="-137"/>
            <MoveAhead name="move ahead" distance="1200"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robotic system in a healthcare environment. It encompasses various tasks such as arm and base movements, battery charging, device pairing, emergency response, and patient transportation.

The main sequence within the "MainTree" includes reactive checks for stopping, diagnostic status, battery level, and patient condition. If any of these checks fail, it falls back to recharging or handling an emergency situation.

Furthermore, it allows selection between different behaviors such as free walking, guided walking, and transport with devices based on user input. Each behavior involves a series of movements and interactions, including parameter requests for user input and decision-making based on the responses.

Overall, the behavior tree provides a framework for the robot to perform essential tasks in a healthcare setting, including assisting patients, responding to emergencies, and managing its own energy requirements.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >

    <BehaviorTree ID="ArmMovementWithRequest">
        <Sequence>
            <FloatParameterRequest title="Bitte geben Sie x, y und z in [mm] an"
                                   value="{x}" key="x" min="-1000" max="1000"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest value="{y}" key="y" min="-1000" max="1000"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest value="{z}" key="z" min="-1000" max="1000"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest msg="Geben Sie die Greiferposition von 0 [open] bis 1 [closed] an"
                                   value="{gripper_position}" key="gripper_position" min="0" max="1"/>
            <ArmMovement x="{x}" y="{y}" z="{z}" gripper_position="{gripper_position}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="BaseMovementWithRequest">
        <Sequence>
            <FloatParameterRequest title="Bitte geben Sie x und y in [m] an"
                                   value="{x}" key="x" min="-10" max="10"/>
            <FloatParameterRequest value="{y}" key="y" min="-10" max="10"/>
            <BaseMovement x="{x}" y="{y}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="BatteryChargingWithRequest">
        <Sequence>
            <FloatParameterRequest title="Bitte geben Sie die Zielladung an von 0 [empty] bis 1 [full]"
                                   value="{goal_percentage}" key="goal_percentage" min="0" max="1"/>
            <BatteryCharging goal_percentage="{goal_percentage}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="DevicePairingWithRequest">
        <Sequence>
            <!--pairing_mode und device_type mÃ¼ssen den Konstanten im .action file entsprechen-->
            <IntParameterRequest title="Bitte geben Sie den Kopplungsmodus und das GerÃ¤t an"
                                   options="pair,unpair"
                                   value="{pairing_mode}"/>
            <IntParameterRequest options="wheelchair,rollator,hospitalbed,chargingstation"
                                   value="{device_type}"/>
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="{pairing_mode}" device_type="{device_type}"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="Emergency">
        <Sequence>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Emergency finished?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="FreeWalking">
        <Sequence>
            <!--room1 = (2,2)-->
            <BaseMovement x="2" y="2"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Start walking to destination?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--room2 = (5,5)-->
            <BaseMovement x="5" y="5"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Patient arrived?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--waiting_area = (0,0)-->
            <BaseMovement x="0" y="0"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="GuidedWalking">
        <Sequence>
            <!--room1 = (2,2)-->
            <BaseMovement x="2" y="2"/>
            <!--arm_support_position = (200,200,0,0)-->
            <ArmMovement x="200" y="200" z="0" gripper_position="0"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Start walking to destination?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--room2 = (5,5)-->
            <BaseMovement x="5" y="5"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Patient arrived?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--arm_home_position = (0,0,0,0)-->
            <ArmMovement x="0" y="0" z="0" gripper_position="0"/>
            <!--waiting_area = (0,0)-->
            <BaseMovement x="0" y="0"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="Recharge">
        <Sequence>
            <!--charging_station = (-5,-5)-->
            <BaseMovement x="-5" y="-5"/>
            <!--mode 1 = pair, type 4 = chargingstation-->
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="1" device_type="4"/>
            <BatteryCharging goal_percentage="1"/>
            <!--mode 2 = unpair, type 4 = chargingstation-->
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="2" device_type="4"/>
            <!--waiting_area = (0,0)-->
            <BaseMovement x="0" y="0"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="TransportWithDevice">
        <Sequence>
            <!--room1 = (2,2)-->
            <BaseMovement x="2" y="2"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Start pairing and move to destination?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <IntParameterRequest options="wheelchair,rollator,hospitalbed,chargingstation"
                                   value="{device_type}"/>
            <!--mode 1 = pair-->
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="1" device_type="{device_type}"/>
            <!--room2 = (5,5)-->
            <BaseMovement x="5" y="5"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Patient arrived?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--mode 2 = unpair-->
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="2" device_type="{device_type}"/>
            <!--waiting_area = (0,0)-->
            <BaseMovement x="0" y="0"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <ReactiveSequence>
            <CheckStop/>
            <CheckDiagnosticStatus/>
            <Fallback>
                <CheckBattery/>
                <Recharge/>
            </Fallback>
            <Fallback>
                <CheckPatientCondition/>
                <Emergency/>
            </Fallback>
            <Sequence>
                <StringParameterRequest title="Select a behavior"
                                       options="FreeW,GuidedW,TransportWD"
                                       value="{selected_behavior}"/>
                <BehaviorSwitch variable="{selected_behavior}" case_1="FreeW" case_2="GuidedW" case_3="TransportWD">
                    <FreeWalking/>
                    <GuidedWalking/>
                    <TransportWithDevice/>
                    <AlwaysFailureNode name="default"/>
                </BehaviorSwitch>
            </Sequence>
        </ReactiveSequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <TreeNodesModel>
        <SubTree ID="BaseMovementWithRequest"/>
        <SubTree ID="ArmMovementWithRequest"/>
        <SubTree ID="BatteryChargingWithRequest"/>
        <SubTree ID="DevicePairingWithRequest"/>
        <SubTree ID="FreeWalking"/>
        <SubTree ID="GuidedWalking"/>
        <SubTree ID="TransportWithDevice"/>
        <SubTree ID="Emergency"/>
        <SubTree ID="Recharge"/>

        <Condition ID="CheckStop"/>
        <Condition ID="CheckBattery"/>
        <Condition ID="CheckDiagnosticStatus"/>
        <Condition ID="CheckPatientCondition"/>
        <Condition ID="CheckBlackboard"/>
            <input_port name="input" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="compare_to" type="std::string"/>

        <Decorator ID="BehaviorSwitch"/>

        <Action ID="DevicePairing">
            <input_port name="pairing_mode" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="device_type" type="int"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ArmMovement">
            <input_port name="x" type="float"/>
            <input_port name="y" type="float"/>
            <input_port name="z" type="float"/>
            <input_port name="gripper" type="float"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="BatteryCharging">
            <input_port name="goal_percentage" type="float"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="BaseMovement">
            <input_port name="x" type="float"/>
            <input_port name="y" type="float"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StringParameterRequest">
            <output_port name="value" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="title" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="msg" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="key" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="min" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="max" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="default_value" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="options" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FloatParameterRequest">
            <output_port name="value" type="float"/>
            <input_port name="title" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="msg" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="key" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="min" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="max" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="default_value" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="options" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="IntParameterRequest">
            <output_port name="value" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="title" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="msg" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="key" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="min" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="max" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="default_value" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="options" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="AlwaysFailureNode"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
 </root>
