instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a series of actions for a robot to perform in a household environment. The robot is programmed to execute a set of tasks in a hierarchical manner, with fallbacks and sequences guiding its decision-making process.

Initially, the robot attempts to go to the kitchen. If successful, it then tries to find a bottle. If the bottle is found, it proceeds to grasp it. Subsequently, it computes an inverse pose and validates it before moving towards the computed pose. If the bottle's location is confidently identified, the robot locates and grasps the bottle; otherwise, it marks the inverse pose as invalid and continues running.

If at any point the robot fails to complete a task, it resorts to asking for help. Additionally, there are conditions such as "Robot_in_kitchen," "Bottle_found," "Bottle_grasped," etc., along with corresponding actions defined in the TreeNodesModel section, which guide the robot's decision-making process based on its environment and internal
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
	
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Root>
            <Fallback name="FB1">
                <Sequence name="S1">
                    <Fallback name="FB2">
                        <Condition ID="Robot_in_kitchen"/>
                        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Sequence name="S2">
                        <Fallback name="FB3">
                            <Condition ID="Bottle_found"/>
                            <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="FB4">
                            <Condition ID="Bottle_grasped"/>
                            <Fallback name="FB5">
                                <Sequence name="S3">
                                    <Fallback name="FB7">
                                        <Sequence name="S6">
                                            <Condition ID="Inv_pose_computed"/>
                                            <Condition ID="Inv_pose_valid"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="Compute_inv_pose"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Sequence name="S4">
                                        <Fallback name="FB8">
                                            <Condition ID="Robot_at_inv_pose"/>
                                            <Action ID="Go_to_inv_pose"/>
                                        </Fallback>
                                        <Sequence name="S5">
                                            <Fallback name="FB9">
                                                <Condition ID="Bottle_located_with_confidence_x"/>
                                                <Action ID="Locate_bottle"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Action ID="Grasp_bottle"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Sequence>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Fallback name="FB6">
                                    <Action ID="Set_inv_pose_not_valid"/>
                                    <Action ID="Keep_running"/>
                                </Fallback>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
            </Fallback>
        </Root>
    </BehaviorTree>
    
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_found"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_grasped"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_located_with_confidence_x"/>
        <Action ID="Compute_inv_pose"/>
        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_inv_pose"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
        <Action ID="Grasp_bottle"/>
        <Condition ID="Inv_pose_computed"/>
        <Condition ID="Inv_pose_valid"/>
        <Action ID="Keep_running"/>
        <Action ID="Locate_bottle"/>
        <Condition ID="Robot_at_inv_pose"/>
        <Condition ID="Robot_in_kitchen"/>
        <Action ID="Set_inv_pose_not_valid"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot in a task-oriented manner. The robot is programmed to perform a series of tasks, including pushing a puck, retrieving an object labeled "G," weighing the object, and performing a snowplow maneuver. Each task is represented by a sub-tree within the main behavior tree.

The "PushPuck" sub-tree instructs the robot to move forward, turn left, push a puck, and then move backward. The "GetG" sub-tree involves opening the clamp, moving forward to reach a specific location, closing the clamp, and repositioning the clamp. The "WeightG" sub-tree directs the robot to move backward, turn left, move forward to a waiting point, proceed to a scale, manipulate the clamp, and open it before closing it again. Finally, the "ChasseNeige" sub-tree commands the robot to move backward, turn left, and move forward.

Overall, the behavior tree coordinates the robot's movements
output:

<ReactiveSequence>
<Fallback>

    <Avoid/>
</Fallback>
<Move pos= positions['P2'] />

-->

<!-- AX1 : Open/Close clamp
    AX2 : Move clamp forward/backwards
    AX3 : Moe clamp left/right
    AX4 :  Turn clamp
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="PushPuck">
        <Sequence>
            <MoveAhead moveForward="true"
                       distance = ""
            />
            <Turn name = "turn_90_left"
                  angle = ""
            />
            <MoveAhead moveForward="true"
                       distance = ""
            />
            <MoveAX_4 name="turn_clamp_90_right"
                      pos=""
                      mode="joint"
            />
            <MoveAX_3 name="move_clamp_forward"
                      pos=""
                      mode="joint"
            />
            <MoveAhead name = "psuh_pcuk"
                        moveForward="true"
                       distance = ""
            />
            <MoveAX_3 name="move_clamp_backward"
                      pos=""
                      mode="joint"
            />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>


    <BehaviorTree ID="GetG">
        <Sequence>
        <MoveAX_1 name="open_clamp"
                  pos=""
                  mode="joint"
        />
        <MoveAhead name = "reach_goldonium"
                   moveForward="true"
                   distance = ""
        />
        <MoveAX_1 name="close_clamp"
                  pos=""
                  mode="joint"
        />
        <MoveAX_3 name="move_clamp_backward"
                  pos=""
                  mode="joint"
        />
        <MoveAX_4 name="turn_clamp_90_right"
                  pos=""
                  mode="joint"
        />
        <Sequence/>
    </BehaviorTree>


    <BehaviorTree ID="WeightG">
        <Sequence>
            <MoveAhead name = "move_backwards"
                       moveForward="false"
                       distance = ""
            />
            <Turn name = "turn_90_left"
                  angle = ""
            />
            <MoveAhead name = "reach_waiting_point"
                       moveForward="true"
                       distance = ""
            />
            <!-- The small robot stops there and waits until the big robot turns left to face the place
            where he will drop the 6th puck. Then the way is clear and the small robot can move towards the scale.
            -->
            <MoveAhead name = "reach_scale"
                       moveForward="true"
                       distance = ""
            />
            <MoveAX_2 name="move_clamp_forward"
                      pos=""
                      mode="joint"
            />
            <OpenClamp/>
            <MoveAX_2 name="move_clamp_backward"
                      pos=""
                      mode="joint"
            />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>


    <BehaviorTree ID="ChasseNeige">
        <MoveAhead name = "move_backward"
                   moveForward="false"
                   distance = ""
        />
        <!-- Turn left to face the red area ? -->
        <Turn name = "turn_left"
              angle = ""
        />
        <MoveAhead name = "move_forward"
                   moveForward="false"
                   distance = ""
        />
    </BehaviorTree>


    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SubTree ID="PushPuck"/>
            <SubTree ID="GetG"/>
            <SubTree ID="WeightG"/>
            <SubTree ID="ChasseNeige"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for a robot. It first checks if it needs to stop, then assesses its battery level and diagnostic status. Following this, it evaluates the patient's condition. After these checks, it selects an action based on the current situation. If the selected action is not suitable for the current state, it falls back to alternative actions until a suitable one is found. The available actions include device pairing, base movement, arm movement, battery charging, and confirming a dialog.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's decision-making process, ensuring that it responds appropriately to various conditions and executes the most suitable action based on the given circumstances.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <ReactiveSequence>
            <CheckStop/>
            <CheckBattery/>
            <CheckDiagnosticStatus/>
            <CheckPatientCondition/>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="SkillSelection" selected_action="{selected_action}" />
                <Fallback>
                    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="{selected_action}" value_B="DevicePairing" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE" />
                        <Action ID="DevicePairing"/>
                    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="{selected_action}" value_B="BaseMovement" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE" />
                        <Action ID="BaseMovement"/>
                    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="{selected_action}" value_B="ArmMovement" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE" />
                        <Action ID="ArmMovement"/>
                    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="{selected_action}" value_B="BatteryCharging" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE" />
                        <Action ID="BatteryCharging"/>
                    <BlackboardCheckString value_A="{selected_action}" value_B="ConfirmDialog" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE" />
                        <Action ID="ConfirmDialog"/>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
        </ReactiveSequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
 </root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate through an environment, periodically replanning its global path at a rate of 1 Hz and incorporating recovery actions. The main sequence involves navigating with replanning, where it computes a path to a specific pose using a grid-based planner and then follows the computed path while clearing the costmaps. If there are issues during navigation, it allows for recovery by retrying a set number of times and executing recovery actions such as clearing the costmaps, spinning, and waiting. This setup ensures that the robot can adapt to changing environments and recover from unexpected obstacles or disruptions in its path.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
        <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        <ClearEntireCostmap service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
        <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
        <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
      </SequenceStar>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robot's continuous task execution. The robot is programmed to repeatedly pursue goals, with no limit on the number of cycles. Within this pursuit, it follows a priority sequence: first attempting to place an item if it is holding one, and then trying to remove an item by picking it up if it sees one. This cycle continues indefinitely.

Additionally, the behavior tree includes specific nodes for conditions and actions such as "HoldingItem," "Pick," "Place," and "SeeItem," which are utilized within the main tree for decision-making and task execution.

In summary, the behavior tree outlines a perpetual loop where the robot prioritizes placing or removing items based on its current state, ensuring continuous task execution without a set endpoint.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
            <Fallback name="Pursue Goals">
                <Sequence name="Place Item">
                    <Condition ID="HoldingItem" name="Holding an Item"/>
                    <Action ID="Place" name="Place it"/>
                </Sequence>
                <Sequence name="Remove Item">
                    <Condition ID="SeeItem" name="See an Item"/>
                    <Action ID="Pick" name="Pick it up"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="HoldingItem"/>
        <Action ID="Pick"/>
        <Action ID="Place"/>
        <Condition ID="SeeItem"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's actions. It begins by initializing, then repeatedly attempts to pursue goals. If the robot is holding an item, it tries to place it; if not, it looks for an item to pick up. This cycle continues until successful.

The "Init" subtree initializes the robot. The main behavior tree consists of a sequence that first initializes and then repeatedly attempts to pursue goals. Within this sequence, there are two possible paths: placing an item and picking up an item. Each path involves checking a condition and performing an action. The process continues until successful.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures the robot is continuously active, attempting to achieve its goals of either placing or picking up items. If one action fails, it retries until successful, ensuring the robot remains productive in its environment.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SubTree ID="Init"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="-1">
                <Fallback name="Pursue Goals">
                    <ForceFailure name="No Item to Place">
                        <Sequence name="Place Item">
                            <Condition ID="HoldingItem" name="Holding an Item"/>
                            <Action ID="Place" name="Place it"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </ForceFailure>
                    <ForceFailure name="No Item to Pick">
                        <Sequence name="Remove Item">
                            <Condition ID="SeeItem" name="See an Item"/>
                            <Action ID="Pick" name="Pick it up"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Init">
        <Action message="Initialize" ID="Print"/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AlwaysRunning"/>
        <Condition ID="HoldingItem"/>
        <SubTree ID="Init"/>
        <Action ID="Pick"/>
        <Action ID="Place"/>
        <Action ID="Print">
            <input_port name="message"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="SeeItem"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to dynamically navigate to a specified pose while continuously updating its path. The robot's movement is controlled by a rate controller that ensures the navigation frequency. It first updates the goal pose and computes a path using a grid-based planner. The computed path is then truncated to a certain distance to prevent over-planning. The robot follows the truncated path using a specific controller until it reaches the goal or encounters a failure. This behavior allows the robot to adaptively plan and navigate towards a dynamic pose, ensuring continuous and efficient movement.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree follows a dynamic pose to a certain distance
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Sequence>
          <GoalUpdater input_goal="{goal}" output_goal="{updated_goal}">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{updated_goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          </GoalUpdater>
         <TruncatePath distance="1.0" input_path="{path}" output_path="{truncated_path}"/>
        </Sequence>
      </RateController>
      <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        <FollowPath path="{truncated_path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the actions for a robot or an autonomous agent. It begins with "go1" and then proceeds to execute "stay1" and "stay2" concurrently. After this, it continues with "go2" and "go3" in sequence. The tree also includes various other actions such as "dumpRun", "goClosestR", "isFull", "mineResources", "moveBaseToGoal", and "waitFrames", which can be utilized within the behavior tree.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates a series of actions for the robot, including movement ("go1", "go2", "go3"), resource management ("dumpRun", "isFull", "mineResources"), and task execution control ("stay1", "stay2", "waitFrames"). These actions are organized into sequences and can be further customized and expanded by incorporating additional actions from the provided TreeNodesModel.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence name="Sequence1">
            <Action ID="go1"/>
            <Sequence name="Sequence2">
                <Action ID="stay1"/>
                <Action ID="stay2"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="go2"/>
            <Action ID="go3"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="dumpRun"/>
        <Action ID="go1"/>
        <Action ID="go2"/>
        <Action ID="go3"/>
        <Action ID="goClosestR"/>
        <Condition ID="isFull"/>
        <Action ID="mineResources"/>
        <Action ID="moveBaseToGoal">
            <inout_port name="key_name">goal</inout_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="stay1"/>
        <Action ID="stay2"/>
        <Action ID="waitFrames">
            <output_port name="barout"/>
            <inout_port name="baz"/>
            <input_port name="fooin"/>
            <input_port default="15" name="frames">frames</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robot's free walking task. The robot is directed to move sequentially to three locations: room1, room2, and the waiting area. At each location, it prompts for confirmation before proceeding to the next destination. If the confirmation is positive, the robot moves to the next location; otherwise, it waits at the current location. The locations are specified by their coordinates (room1 = (2,2), room2 = (5,5), waiting_area = (0,0)). This behavior ensures that the robot navigates to specific points while allowing for human intervention at key stages of the journey.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "FreeWalking" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="FreeWalking">
        <Sequence>
            <!--room1 = (2,2)-->
            <BaseMovement x="2" y="2"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Start walking to destination?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--room2 = (5,5)-->
            <BaseMovement x="5" y="5"/>
            <StringParameterRequest title="Patient arrived?" 
                                    msg="type [y] or [n]"
                                    value="{confirm}"/>
            <CheckBlackboard input="{confirm}" compare_to="y" />
            <!--waiting_area = (0,0)-->
            <BaseMovement x="0" y="0"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree orchestrates the decision-making process for a robot. It first checks various conditions such as stopping, battery status, diagnostic status, and patient condition. Then it selects an action based on the current context. If the selected action is "FreeWalking," it initiates the FreeWalking behavior. If not, it checks for other possible actions like DevicePairing, BaseMovement, ArmMovement, BatteryCharging, and ConfirmDialog in a fallback manner, executing the first available action. This structure allows the robot to dynamically adapt its behavior based on the environmental and contextual inputs. The tree is designed to ensure that the robot can perform a wide range of tasks while prioritizing critical conditions such as stopping and patient well-being.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >

    <include path="FreeWalking.xml"/>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <ReactiveSequence>
            <CheckStop/>
            <CheckBattery/>
            <CheckDiagnosticStatus/>
            <CheckPatientCondition/>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="SkillSelection" selected_action="{selected_action}" />
                <Fallback>
                    <Sequence>
                        <CheckBlackboard input="{selected_action}" compare_to="FreeWalking"/>
                        <FreeWalking/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <CheckBlackboard input="{selected_action}" compare_to="DevicePairing"/>
                        <Action ID="DevicePairing"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <CheckBlackboard input="{selected_action}" compare_to="BaseMovement"/>
                        <Action ID="BaseMovement"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <CheckBlackboard input="{selected_action}" compare_to="ArmMovement"/>
                        <Action ID="ArmMovement"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <CheckBlackboard input="{selected_action}" compare_to="BatteryCharging"/>
                        <Action ID="BatteryCharging"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence>
                        <CheckBlackboard input="{selected_action}" compare_to="ConfirmDialog"/>
                        <Action ID="ConfirmDialog"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
        </ReactiveSequence>

 </root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's movement towards three different goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c) in a repeated sequence for 3 cycles. The robot is directed to move to each goal sequentially using the "MoveRobot" behavior tree. Each goal is specified with its position and orientation. Once the robot reaches all three goals or completes the specified number of cycles, the task is considered complete.

In summary, the behavior tree outlines a repetitive task for the robot: move to Goal_a, then Goal_b, then Goal_c, and repeat this sequence for 3 cycles. This allows the robot to efficiently navigate through the specified locations multiple times.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="3">
            <Sequence>
                <!-- The goal value="position-x;position-y;orientaion-z;orientation-w" -->
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-0.579;-1.341;0.0;1.0" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="5.214;-1.533;0.0;1.0" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-1.588;1.253;0.0;1.0" />
                <Sequence>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
                </Sequence>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <Nav2Client goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree consists of a Parallel node with a threshold of 2, containing two Decorator nodes with the ID "AbsoluteProgressSync" wrapping an Action node with the ID "SmoothAction". Additionally, there is a TreeNodesModel defining various Decorator and Action nodes.

Overall, this behavior tree seems to be orchestrating parallel execution of two instances of the "SmoothAction" with synchronization based on absolute progress. The use of the Parallel node indicates that both instances of "SmoothAction" will run concurrently, and the threshold of 2 suggests that at least two child nodes need to succeed for the Parallel node to return success.

In summary, the behavior tree appears to be managing concurrent execution of specific actions with a synchronization mechanism based on absolute progress.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Parallel threshold="2">
            <Decorator ID="AbsoluteProgressSync">
                <Action ID="SmoothAction"/>
            </Decorator>
            <Decorator ID="AbsoluteProgressSync">
                <Action ID="SmoothAction"/>
            </Decorator>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Decorator ID="AbsoluteProgressSync">
        </Decorator>
        <Decorator ID="RelativeProgressSync">
        </Decorator>
        <Decorator ID="ResourceSync">
        </Decorator>
        <Action ID="SmoothAction">
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot, focusing on object placement and movement. The main task is divided into two parallel processes: 
1. The first process involves repeating a variant action indefinitely and simultaneously moving to a specific location, placing an object, and then dropping it.
2. The second process entails navigating to a designated location using a sequence of path planning and waypoint execution.

The "GoTo" behavior tree handles the navigation process, including path planning, checking conditions, and executing movements to reach waypoints. The main behavior tree coordinates these navigation tasks with other actions such as object manipulation and variant actions.

Overall, the behavior tree enables the robot to perform complex tasks involving navigation, object manipulation, and repetitive actions in a coordinated and efficient manner.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Parallel failure_threshold="1" success_threshold="1">
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <Action ID="VariantAction" value="{variant}"/>
            </Repeat>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="objectplacement" query="WOODENBOX_0.1_0.3_0.3_0.3"/>
                <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo" __shared_blackboard="false" x_input="1.61" y_input="7.76"/>
                <Action ID="objectdrop" obj_index="-1"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="GoTo">
        <Sequence name="GoTo">
            <Action ID="pathPlanner" number_of_waypoints="{number_of_waypoints_}" waypoints="{waypoints_}" x="{x_input}" y="{y_input}"/>
            <Condition ID="CheckPositiveCondition" value="{number_of_waypoints_}"/>
            <Repeat num_cycles="{number_of_waypoints_}">
                <Sequence>
                    <Action ID="ExecutePathAction" w_x="{_w_x}" w_y="{_w_y}" waypoints="{waypoints_}"/>
                    <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="100" x="{_w_x}" y="{_w_y}"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="CheckPositiveCondition">
            <input_port default="{number_of_waypoints}" name="value"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="ExecutePathAction">
            <output_port default="{_w_x}" name="w_x"/>
            <output_port default="{_w_y}" name="w_y"/>
            <input_port default="{waypoints_}" name="waypoints"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
            <input_port default="1.61" name="x_input"/>
            <input_port default="7.76" name="y_input"/>
        </SubTreePlus>
        <Action ID="VariantAction">
            <output_port default="{variant}" name="value"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="activateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="approachLocation">
            <input_port default="1" name="locationId"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="approachWall"/>
        <Action ID="deactivateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="getBaseCharging">
            <output_port default="{charging}" name="charging"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="getPersonPose">
            <input_port default="MARIA" name="personname"/>
            <output_port default="{x_}" name="x"/>
            <output_port default="{y_}" name="y"/>
            <output_port default="{z_}" name="z"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="initNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="loadMap"/>
        <Action ID="loadNavigationMap">
            <input_port default="navigation-map" name="mapname"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsLocation"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsRelative"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotAbs"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotRel"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition">
            <input_port default="50" name="approachRadius"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="objectdrop">
            <input_port name="obj_index"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="objectplacement">
            <input_port name="query"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="pathPlanner">
            <output_port default="{number_of_waypoints_}" name="number_of_waypoints"/>
            <output_port default="{waypoints_}" name="waypoints"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
        <Action ID="setRobotPose">
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="yaw"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="startJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="startReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="triggerGlobalLocalization"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a character in a simulated environment. The character is programmed to perform various tasks based on its needs and job assignments. It includes behaviors such as combat, obtaining a uniform, addressing hunger and thirst, performing specific jobs like butchering animals or hauling items, sleeping, training, and supervising training.

The character's behavior is governed by conditions such as being in combat, hungry, thirsty, sleepy, or assigned to a particular job type. For each task, there are sequences of actions to be executed, including finding specific locations, moving, picking up or dropping items, and completing the assigned job. Additionally, the character can abort a job if necessary.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines a comprehensive set of behaviors for the character, ensuring that it responds to its needs and fulfills its designated responsibilities within the simulated environment.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Combat">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
                        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="GetUniform">
        <SequenceStar name="GetUniform">
            <Action ID="CheckUniform"/>
            <Fallback>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="UniformCleanUp"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="EquipUniform"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Hunger">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
            <Sequence>
                <SequenceStar name="Hunger">
                    <Action ID="FindFood"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                    <Action ID="Eat"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsFull"/>
            </Sequence>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobButcherAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="ButcherAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobDyeAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="DyeAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                    <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="DyeAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="HarvestAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobHaulMultiple">
        <BB_Precondition expected="HauleMultipleItems" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                    <Action ID="FindTool"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
                    <Inverter>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Inverter>
                                <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
                            </Inverter>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Action ID="Move"/>
                                <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="DropAllItems"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture">
        <BB_Precondition expected="LeadAnimalToPasture" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobStandard">
        <Fallback>
            <SequenceStar name="StandardJobs">
                <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
                <Action ID="FindTool"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
                <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
                <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="Work"/>
                <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobTameAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="TameAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="TameAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Jobs">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="GetJob"/>
            <FallbackStar>
                <SubTree ID="JobButcherAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobDyeAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobTameAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobHaulMultiple"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
            </FallbackStar>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob">
        <Sequence>
            <Inverter>
                <Sequence>
                    <Inverter>
                        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                    </Inverter>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Inverter>
            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="OldMoveAllItemsToJob">
        <FallbackStar>
            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="20">
                <Sequence>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                            <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                            <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                    <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                </Sequence>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <ForceFailure>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </ForceFailure>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Sleepy">
        <SequenceStar name="Sleep">
            <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="FindBed"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Thirst">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
            <Sequence>
                <SequenceStar name="Thirst">
                    <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                    <Action ID="Drink"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsDrinkFull"/>
            </Sequence>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Trainer">
        <SequenceStar name="Trainer">
            <Condition ID="IsTrainer"/>
            <Action ID="FindTrainerPosition"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="SuperviseTraining"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Training">
        <SequenceStar name="Training">
            <Condition ID="IsTrainingTime"/>
            <Action ID="FindTrainingGround"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="Train"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
        <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="CheckUniform"/>
        <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
        <SubTree ID="Combat"/>
        <Action ID="Drink"/>
        <Action ID="DropAllItems"/>
        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
        <Action ID="DyeAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="Eat"/>
        <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
        <Action ID="EquipUniform"/>
        <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="FindBed"/>
        <Action ID="FindDining"/>
        <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
        <Action ID="FindFood"/>
        <Action ID="FindTool"/>
        <Action ID="FindTrainerPosition"/>
        <Action ID="FindTrainingGround"/>
        <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
        <SubTree ID="GetUniform"/>
        <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="Hunger"/>
        <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitButcherJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsButcherJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDrinkFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
        <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
        <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTrainer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTrainingTime"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryThirsty"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobButcherAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobDyeAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobHaulMultiple"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobTameAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
        <SubTree ID="OldMoveAllItemsToJob"/>
        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        <SubTree ID="Sleepy"/>
        <Action ID="SuperviseTraining"/>
        <Action ID="TameAnimal"/>
        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
        <SubTree ID="Thirst"/>
        <Action ID="Train"/>
        <SubTree ID="Trainer"/>
        <SubTree ID="Training"/>
        <Action ID="UniformCleanUp"/>
        <Action ID="Work"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot's navigation and recovery process. It begins by checking if the robot is stuck, and if so, it attempts to recover by stopping, backing up, and spinning. If the robot is not stuck, it proceeds with the navigation branch, which involves computing a path to a specific pose based on provided endpoints and then following that path. The tree is structured to ensure that the robot can recover from being stuck and continue with its navigation tasks effectively.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree first goes into a branch where it will check if the robot is stuck.
  If that is the case, it will attempt to recover. Otherwise it will continue with
  the navigation branch. In this case the navigation branch is based on `simple_sequential.xml`.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence name="root">
      <FallbackStar name="check_motion">
        <Inverter name="is_not_stuck">
          <IsStuck/>
        </Inverter>
        <SequenceStar name="stuck_recovery">
          <Stop/>
          <BackUp/>
          <Spin/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </FallbackStar>
      <SequenceStar name="navigate">
        <ComputePathToPose endpoints="${endpoints}" path="${path}"/>
        <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
      </SequenceStar>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot's navigation system. It periodically replans the global path at 1 Hz and incorporates recovery actions in case of failures. The recovery node allows for a maximum of 6 retries before proceeding to the next action.

The main sequence involves navigating with replanning, where the robot computes a path to a specific goal using a grid-based planner. If this process fails, it clears the global costmap and waits for a brief period before retrying. Once a valid path is computed, the robot follows the path while also clearing the local costmap as it moves.

In case of any recovery triggers such as an updated goal, the robot performs recovery actions including clearing both the local and global costmaps, spinning to reassess the environment, and waiting for a specified duration.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can navigate effectively by continuously replanning its path and executing recovery actions when necessary to handle unexpected situations during navigation.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          <!--  <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>-->
            <!--<Wait wait_duration="3"/>-->
            <SequenceStar name="ResetGlobalPath">
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
              <Wait wait_duration="1"/>
            </SequenceStar>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
          <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate through a series of waypoints using the NavigateToPose action. It starts by checking if all goals have been achieved, and if not, it proceeds to navigate to the next goal. If the navigation fails, it moves on to the next waypoint without getting stuck. The process continues until all waypoints are reached.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot efficiently navigates through multiple waypoints, handling any navigation failures along the way. It utilizes reactive sequences and fallbacks to manage the navigation process effectively, ensuring that the robot can adapt to changing conditions and successfully reach its intended destinations.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree processes each of the given waypoints with NavigateToPose and skip to next waypoint if NavigateToPose is failed.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <ReactiveFallback name="FollowWaypoints">
      <AllGoalsAchieved goal_achieved="{goal_achieved}"/>
      <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        <ReactiveSequence>
          <GetNextGoal goals="{goals}" goal="{goal}" goal_achieved="{goal_achieved}"/>
          <ForceSuccess>
            <NavigateToPose goal="{goal}"/>
          </ForceSuccess>
          <SetBlackboard output_key="goal_achieved" value="true"/>
        </ReactiveSequence>
      </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </ReactiveFallback>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a task for a robot to repeatedly move through a sequence of four goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c, Goal_d) in a specific order. The robot is programmed to repeat this sequence three times. Each cycle involves setting the values for the goals and then moving towards each goal sequentially using the "MoveRobot" behavior.

If we break down the steps:
1. Set the values for Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c, and Goal_d.
2. Move towards Goal_a, then Goal_b, then Goal_c, and finally Goal_d.
3. Repeat the above step two more times.

This behavior tree essentially orchestrates the robot's movement through a predefined set of locations in a repeated manner, ensuring that it visits all the specified goals in the given order for a total of three cycles.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="3">
            <Sequence>
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-0.579;-1.341;0.0" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="1.214;-1.533;0.0" />
                <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-1.588;1.253;0.0" />
		<SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_d" value="1.214;1.533;0.0" />
                <Sequence>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
		    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_d" />
                </Sequence>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <MoveBase goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a task for a robot to transport a passenger. The robot is first instructed to pick up the passenger by navigating to their location and then performing the pick-up action. Once the passenger is on board, the robot proceeds to drop off the passenger at their destination by navigating to the specified location and then completing the drop-off action.

The "go deliver passenger" sequence in the main tree orchestrates the sub-trees for picking up and dropping off the passenger in a sequential manner. Each sub-tree contains sequences of actions for navigation and performing the pick-up or drop-off tasks.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines the process for the robot to execute the transportation task efficiently and safely, ensuring that it navigates to the correct locations and performs the necessary actions to pick up and drop off the passenger.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="go deliver passenger">
            <SubTree ID="go pick up passenger" name="" />
            <SubTree ID="go drop off passenger" name="" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="go pick up passenger">
        <Sequence name="go pick up passenger">
            <Sequence name="navigate to passenger">
                <Action ID="move right" name="" />
                <Action ID="move right" name="" />
                <Action ID="move right" name="" />
                <Action ID="move up" name="" />
                <Action ID="move up" name="" />
                <Action ID="move left" name="" />
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="pick up" name="pick up passenger" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="go drop off passenger">
        <Sequence name="go drop off passenger">
            <Sequence name="navigate to destination">
                <Action ID="move right" name="" />
                <Action ID="move down" name="" />
                <Action ID="move down" name="" />
                <Action ID="move left" name="" />
                <Action ID="move left" name="" />
                <Action ID="move left" name="" />
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="drop off" name="drop off passenger" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robot's task execution. It involves repeating a sequence of actions for a specified number of cycles. Within each cycle, the robot performs several subtasks:

1. LTLPreCheck: Checks the current state against the desired sequence.
2. ReactiveSequence:
   - LocomotionStatusCheck: Verifies locomotion status.
   - If locomotion is not in an expected state, it attempts recovery by standing and then initiating locomotion after a delay.
   - If locomotion is normal, it proceeds with MoveAction.

3. MoveAction: Executes a specific movement action based on the provided parameters.

4. UpdateLTL: Updates the action sequence, desired state sequence, and navigation goal.

The tree allows for dynamic adjustments to the robot's behavior based on its environment and internal state. The robot continuously repeats this sequence for a defined number of cycles, adapting its actions based on real-time conditions and goals.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck" locomotion_status="{locomotion_status}"/>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Action ID="RecoveryStand" locomotion_status="{locomotion_status}"/>
                            <Delay delay_msec="2000">
                                <Action ID="LocomotionStart" locomotion_status="{locomotion_status}"/>
                            </Delay>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="MoveAction" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Replanning2"/>
        <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <output_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a complex decision-making process for a robotic system. It involves multiple actions and conditions that are executed in a repeated sequence. The tree includes various levels of reactive sequences, fallbacks, and conditional checks to handle different scenarios and inputs.

The robot's behavior is governed by a series of actions such as moving, staying, guiding, and performing fake detections, along with conditions like checking the locomotion status and LTL (Linear Temporal Logic) state. These actions and conditions are organized within a repeat cycle, allowing the robot to execute them multiple times.

Additionally, the tree incorporates a mechanism for replanning requests at different levels based on the current LTL state and executed sequences. The overall structure suggests a sophisticated decision-making process that enables the robot to adapt its actions based on dynamic environmental changes and internal states.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel1" replanning_fake_input="{replanning_fake_input}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel3" replanning_fake_input="{replanning_fake_input}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Switch4 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="start_training" case_4="terminate_training" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                            <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                            <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="GuideAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="BackNormalAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                        </Switch4>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="BackNormalAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DropAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel1">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel2">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel3">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GuideAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="PickAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's path planning and execution. It first computes a path using the global planner, then runs two sub-branches in parallel. The first sub-branch involves executing the local planner to follow the computed path, while the second sub-branch controls the rate at which new paths are computed by the global planner. The goal for the global planner and the resulting path are stored on the blackboard for communication between different components.

The RateController node regulates the frequency of invoking the ComputePathToPose operation. The Parallel node uses a threshold of 1 to return the result of FollowPath whenever it returns SUCCESS or FAILURE. This ensures that the overall task status reflects the success or failure of the path following operation.

In summary, the behavior tree manages the coordination of global and local path planning and execution for the robot, ensuring continuous path updates and adaptive control based on the robot's progress.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree first computes a path using the global planner (ComputePathToPose).
  Then, it runs two sub-branches in parallel. The first sub-branch is a FollowPath
  operation (the local planner). In parallel, there is a rate controlled execution of
  FollowPath (the global planner). Each time a new path is computed, the path update
  is sent to the local planner. The right branch, which is the rate controlled
  ComputePathToPose, always returns RUNNING. Because the Parallel node uses a
  threshold of 1, whenever the FollowPath returns SUCCESS or FAILURE, the parallel
  node will return this result.

  The goal (input to the global planner) and the resulting path (output of the global
  planner and input to the local planner) are passed on the blackboard.

  The rate at which the ComputePathToPose operation is invoked can be controlled with
  the hz parameter to the RateController node.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence name="root">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Fallback>
          <GoalReached/>
          <ComputePathToPose goal="${goal}"/>
        </Fallback>
      </RateController>
      <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a sequence of actions for a task. Initially, the action "go1" is executed, followed by the action "go2" repeated three times. Subsequently, the action "go3" is performed. The behavior tree structure ensures that these actions are carried out in the specified order.

In summary, the robot first executes "go1", then repeats "go2" three times, and finally performs "go3". This behavior is designed to achieve a specific task or objective through a predefined sequence of actions.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action ID="go1"/>
            <Repeat num_cycles="3">
                <Action ID="go2"/>
            </Repeat>
            <Action ID="go3"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="go1"/>
        <Action ID="go2"/>
        <Action ID="go3"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the navigation and recovery strategy for a robot, specifically an Orca3. The robot is programmed to navigate towards a goal while replanning at a frequency of 1Hz using a grid-based planner. If the navigation encounters issues, it will attempt recovery by retrying up to 6 times. During recovery, it will wait for a few seconds before resuming navigation. The recovery strategy also includes reacting to any updates in the goal.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's navigation process, ensuring that it can adapt to changing environments or unforeseen obstacles by incorporating a recovery mechanism.
output:
<!--
  A simple behavior tree that replans at 1Hz. Recovery consists of waiting (drifting while hovering)
  for a few seconds. Orca3 doesn't use costmaps, so there's no need to clear them.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
        </RateController>
        <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>
