instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a drone's flight mission. It begins with the drone taking off to an altitude of 2.0 units, followed by executing a predefined sequence called "Square" from an external file. The shared blackboard is utilized for communication between different parts of the behavior tree. Once the "Square" sequence is completed, the drone is instructed to land.

Overall, the behavior tree manages the liftoff, execution of a specific flight pattern (in this case, a square), and then safely landing the drone.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <include path="square.xml"/>
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <SequenceStar name="test">
            <ArmTakeoff altitude="2.0"/>
            <SubTree ID="Square" __shared_blackboard="true"/>
            <Land/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate while continuously replanning its global path after every 1 meter of movement. It uses a PipelineSequence that consists of two steps: 
1. DistanceController: This component computes a new path to the goal pose using the "GridBased" planner whenever the robot has moved 1 meter from its current position.
2. FollowPath: The robot follows the computed path using the "FollowPath" controller.

This behavior tree ensures that the robot dynamically adjusts its path to reach the goal, allowing it to adapt to changes in the environment and avoid obstacles in real-time.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path after every 1m.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <DistanceController distance="1.0">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </DistanceController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate or recharge when the battery level is low. It uses reactive sequences and recovery nodes to handle navigation tasks, such as computing paths through poses and following those paths. If the battery is low, it triggers a series of recovery actions including clearing costmaps, spinning, waiting, and backing up. If the battery is not low, the robot will continue navigating through the planned path. If the recovery sequence fails multiple times, the robot will spin in place. Finally, if all else fails, the robot will perform a full spin before attempting to navigate again.

This behavior tree ensures that the robot can effectively manage its energy levels by either continuing with its navigation tasks or initiating a series of recovery actions to conserve power until it can reach a charging dock.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree enables a robot to return to the 
  charging dock when the battery is low.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Fallback name="NavigateOrRecharge">
      <ReactiveSequence name="Navigate">
        <IsBatteryLow min_battery="0.25" battery_topic="/battery_status" is_voltage="false"/>          
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
          <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
            <RateController hz="0.333">
              <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathThroughPoses">
                <ReactiveSequence>
                  <RemovePassedGoals input_goals="{goals}" output_goals="{goals}" radius="0.7"/>
                  <ComputePathThroughPoses goals="{goals}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <ReactiveFallback name="ComputePathThroughPosesRecoveryFallback">
                  <GoalUpdated/>
                  <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
                </ReactiveFallback>
              </RecoveryNode>
            </RateController>
            <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
              <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
              <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathRecoveryFallback">
                <GoalUpdated/>
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
              </ReactiveFallback>
            </RecoveryNode>
          </PipelineSequence>
          <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
            <GoalUpdated/>
            <RoundRobin name="RecoveryActions">
              <Sequence name="ClearingActions">
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
              </Sequence>
              <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
              <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
              <BackUp backup_dist="0.15" backup_speed="0.025"/>
            </RoundRobin>
          </ReactiveFallback>
        </RecoveryNode> 
      </ReactiveSequence> 
      <Spin spin_dist="-3.14"/>
    </Fallback>  
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the actions of a robot in an environment. The robot is programmed to perform various tasks based on conditions and fallback options. 

First, it checks if the room is known; if so, it decides whether to go to the room or follow a human. If a bottle is found, it will attempt to locate and grasp it. After grasping the bottle, it computes the inverse pose and moves to that position. If the bottle is located, it proceeds to grasp it. If the content is poured, the task is considered complete. If any of these tasks fail, the robot is instructed to ask for help.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's autonomous decision-making process, encompassing activities such as navigation, object manipulation, and interaction with its surroundings. It also includes error handling by asking for assistance when needed.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback name="Main">
            <Sequence name="Autonomus">
                <Fallback name="ReachRoom">
                    <Sequence name="ShouldFollow">
                        <Condition ID="RoomKnown"/>
                        <Fallback name="GoToRoom_Fal">
                            <Condition ID="RobotInRoom"/>
                            <Action ID="GoToRoom"/>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="FollowHuman"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="BottleFound">
                    <Condition ID="BottleFound"/>
                    <Action ID="FindBottle"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback name="Fetch">
                    <Condition ID="BottleGrasped"/>
                    <Sequence name="Grasp">
                        <Fallback name="InvPoseCompute">
                            <Sequence name="SeqInvPose">
                                <Condition ID="InvPoseComputed"/>
                                <Condition ID="InvPoseValid"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="ComputeInvPose"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="GoInvPose">
                            <Condition ID="RobotAtInvPose"/>
                            <Sequence name="prepare">
                                <Action ID="KeepArmsForGrasp"/>
                                <Action ID="GoToInvPose"/>
                            </Sequence>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="Locate">
                            <Condition ID="BottleLocated"/>
                            <Action ID="LocateBottle"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="GraspBottle"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Action ID="SetInvPoseInvaild"/>
                </Fallback>
		<Fallback name="Pour">
		<Condition ID="ContentPoured"/>	
		<Sequence name="PourSequence">
                       <Fallback name="LocateFall">
                            <Condition ID="GlassLocated"/>
                            <Action ID="LocateGlass"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="PourDrink"/>
		</Sequence>
		</Fallback>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="AskForHelp"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AskForHelp"/>
        <Condition ID="BottleFound"/>
        <Condition ID="BottleGrasped"/>
        <Condition ID="BottleLocated"/>
        <Action ID="ComputeInvPose"/>
        <Action ID="FindBottle"/>
        <Action ID="FollowHuman"/>
        <Action ID="GoToInvPose"/>
        <Action ID="GoToRoom"/>
        <Action ID="GraspBottle"/>
        <Condition ID="InvPoseComputed"/>
        <Condition ID="InvPoseValid"/>
        <Action ID="KeepArmsForGrasp"/>
        <Action ID="KeepRunning"/>
        <Action ID="LocateBottle"/>
        <Condition ID="RobotAtInvPose"/>
        <Condition ID="RobotInRoom"/>
        <Condition ID="RoomKnown"/>
        <Action ID="SetInvPoseInvaild"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robot's recharging process. The robot is programmed to follow a sequence of actions: first, it moves to the charging station location (-6, 7.5). Then, it pairs with the charging station using pairing mode 1 and device type 4, indicating a specific type of device for charging. After that, the robot initiates the battery charging process until it reaches a goal percentage of 100%. Subsequently, it unpairs from the charging station using pairing mode 2 and device type 4. Finally, the robot moves to a waiting area at coordinates (0, 0).

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's movement to the charging station, pairing for charging, actual charging, unpairing, and then relocating to a designated waiting area.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "Recharge" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="Recharge">
        <Sequence>
            <!--charging_station = (-6,7.5)-->
            <BaseMovement x="-6" y="7.5"/>
            <!--mode 1 = pair, type 4 = chargingstation-->
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="1" device_type="4"/>
            <BatteryCharging goal_percentage="1"/>
            <!--mode 2 = unpair, type 4 = chargingstation-->
            <DevicePairing pairing_mode="2" device_type="4"/>
            <!--waiting_area = (0,0)-->
            <BaseMovement x="0" y="0"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
 </root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of an object-moving robot. It follows a fallback pattern, attempting to execute sequences in order but falling back to alternative sequences if necessary. 

In the first sequence, it attempts to move the object and then waits for 3 seconds. If successful, it continues with its next task. Otherwise, it moves on to the second sequence, where it returns the object to a specific location and then waits again. If both sequences fail, it resorts to putting the object in standby mode.

The tree relies on various actions such as moving the object, returning the object, waiting, and putting the object in standby. Each action has specific input and output ports that facilitate communication between the tree nodes and the robot's control system.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="MoveObject" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" pose_queue_size="{pose_queue_size}"/>
                <Action ID="WaitObject" action="{action}" wait_duration="3"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="ReturnObject" action="{action}" home_pose_far="{home_pose_far}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                <Action ID="WaitObject" action="{action}" wait_duration="3"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="StandbyObject" action="{action}"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="MoveObject">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="pose_queue_size"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReturnObject">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="home_pose_far"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StandbyObject">
            <output_port name="action"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitObject">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port default="1" name="wait_duration"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for an animal, possibly a farm animal or wildlife creature. The tree outlines various behaviors and conditions for the animal to follow in different scenarios. 

The "ShedTree" within the main tree defines the decision-making process for the animal. It considers factors such as time of day, location (shed or pasture), and specific actions like grazing, moving, finding shelter, and reproduction. The tree allows the animal to adapt its behavior based on these conditions. For instance, it will leave the shed during the day if not already outside, find a random pasture field, and graze. At night, it will search for the shed and enter it if not already inside.

The tree also includes a range of conditions and actions that the animal can perform, including eating prey, laying eggs, giving birth, and attempting to reproduce. Additionally, there are conditions related to the animal's age, gender, hunger, and reproductive status. This behavior tree provides a comprehensive set of rules for
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <ForceSuccess/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="ShedTree">
        <FallbackStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsOnPasture"/>
                <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
                <Action ID="LeaveShed"/>
                <Action ID="FindRandomPastureField"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsOnPasture"/>
                <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Action ID="FindShed"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="EnterShed"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsDay"/>
                <Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
                <Action ID="Graze"/>
            </SequenceStar>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="CanHaveSex"/>
        <Action ID="EatPrey"/>
        <Action ID="EnterShed"/>
        <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindRandomPastureField"/>
        <Action ID="FindRetreat"/>

        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsInShed"/>

        <Condition ID="IsNight"/>
        <Condition ID="IsOnPasture"/>
        <Condition ID="IsPregnant"/>
        <Condition ID="IsProducer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsReadyToGiveBirth"/>
        <Condition ID="IsWoodVermin"/>

        <Action ID="KillPrey"/>

        <Action ID="LeaveShed"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for a character, likely in a game or simulation. The character is programmed to perform various actions based on certain conditions and events. 

Initially, it attempts to execute a sequence of actions: "GetTarget", "Move", and then checks if the target is adjacent. If the target is adjacent, it will proceed to "AttackTarget". If any of these steps fail, it will resort to "RandomMove". Additionally, there are specific conditions such as "IsDay", "IsFemale", "IsHungry", "IsMale", and "IsNight" that likely influence the character's decisions.

</root>

The first child is a Condition node that likely determines whether the robot should proceed with the action. The second child is an Action node that utilizes the YARP framework to send a "GoTo" command through a specific port, presumably instructing the robot to move to a designated location.

This behavior tree seems to be a part of a larger system that controls the robot's navigation and actions based on certain conditions and external commands.

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a self-localization process for a robot. Upon receiving the initial pose, the robot attempts to localize itself using a global localization service request. If unsuccessful, it retries the request up to 5 times. Following this, it makes 10 attempts to achieve localization by executing a sequence of actions. This includes spinning, backing up, and then spinning again in case of failure, until successful localization is achieved. The "IsLocalized" condition is checked at various points to determine if the robot has successfully localized itself. Overall, the behavior tree outlines a robust self-localization strategy for the robot, ensuring that it can accurately determine its position within its environment.
output:
<!--AutoLocalization-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <FallbackStar name="root_AutoLocalization">
      <initialPoseReceived/>
      <SequenceStar name="doSelfLocalization">
        <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="5" name="retry_client_request">
          <globalLocalizationServiceRequest/>
        </RetryUntilSuccesful>
        <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="10" name="retry_localization">
          <Sequence>
            <Fallback>
              <IsLocalized/>
              <SequenceStar>
               <Spin/>
               <BackUp/>
               <Spin/>
             </SequenceStar>
            </Fallback>
            <IsLocalized/>
          </Sequence> 
        </RetryUntilSuccesful>
      </SequenceStar>
    </FallbackStar>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot's navigation and recovery system. It first checks if the robot is stuck, and if so, it attempts to recover by stopping, backing up, and spinning. If the robot is not stuck, it proceeds with the navigation branch. The navigation branch involves computing a path to a specific pose using parallel processing. The robot simultaneously follows the computed path and updates the path at a specified rate to ensure efficient navigation.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can navigate to its intended destination while also having mechanisms in place to recover from being stuck.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree first goes into a branch where it will check if the robot is stuck.
  If that is the case, it will attempt to recover. Otherwise it will continue with
  the navigation branch. In this case the navigation branch is based on `parallel.xml`.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence name="root">
      <FallbackStar name="check_motion">
        <Inverter name="is_not_stuck">
          <IsStuck/>
        </Inverter>
        <SequenceStar name="stuck_recovery">
          <Stop/>
          <BackUp/>
          <Spin/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </FallbackStar>
      <SequenceStar name="navigate">
        <ComputePathToPose endpoints="${endpoints}" path="${path}"/>
        <ParallelNode threshold="1">
          <FollowPath path="${path}"/>
          <Sequence>
            <RateController hz="2">
              <ComputePathToPose endpoints="${endpoints}" path="${path}"/>
            </RateController>
            <UpdatePath/>
          </Sequence>
        </ParallelNode>
      </SequenceStar>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
This behavior tree represents the decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle's actions are determined by a series of conditions and reactive sequences. 

The main tree consists of multiple reactive sequences, each containing conditions and actions related to different driving maneuvers such as pulling over, pulling out, lane changes, and lane following. These sequences allow the vehicle to reactively plan and execute various driving tasks based on environmental inputs and system readiness.

Additionally, there are two separate behavior trees labeled "a" and "b", each containing their own reactive fallback structures with specific conditions and actions related to lane change approval and avoidance maneuvers.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the vehicle's decision-making process for safe and efficient navigation, encompassing a range of driving behaviors including lane changes, lane following, and maneuvering in response to potential obstacles or hazards.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="PullOver_Request"/>
                <Condition ID="PullOver_Ready"/>
                <Action ID="PullOver_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="PullOut_Request"/>
                <Condition ID="PullOut_Ready"/>
                <Action ID="PullOut_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <ReactiveSequence>
                <Condition ID="LaneChange_Request"/>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LaneChange_Ready"/>
                    <Condition ID="ForceLaneChange_ForceApproval"/>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="LaneChange_Plan" output="{output}"/>
            </ReactiveSequence>
            <Action ID="LaneFollowing_Plan" output="{output}"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="a">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Condition ID="LaneChange_CheckApproval"/>
            <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
                <Action ID="LaneChange_PlanCandidate" output="{output}"/>
            </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="b">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Condition ID="Avoidance_CheckApproval"/>
            <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
                <Action ID="Avoidance_PlanCandidate" output="{output}"/>
            </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Condition ID="Avoidance_CheckApproval"/>
        <Action ID="Avoidance_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Avoidance_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="Avoidance_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="Avoidance_Request"/>
        <Condition ID="ExternalApproval"/>
        <Condition ID="ForceApproval"/>
        <Condition ID="ForceLaneChange_ForceApproval"/>
        <Condition ID="LaneChange_CheckApproval"/>
        <Action ID="LaneChange_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LaneChange_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LaneChange_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="LaneChange_Request"/>
        <Action ID="LaneFollowing_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LaneFollowing_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output_candidate" type="boost::optional<autoware_planning_msgs::PathWithLaneId_<std::allocator<void> > >">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LaneFollowing_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="LaneFollowing_Request"/>
        <Action ID="PullOut_Plan">
            <output_port name="output"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="PullOut_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="PullOut_Request"/>
        <Action ID="PullOver_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="PullOver_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="PullOver_Request"/>
        <Condition ID="SideShift_CheckApproval"/>
        <Action ID="SideShift_Plan">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SideShift_PlanCandidate">
            <output_port name="output" type="behavior_path_planner::BehaviorModuleOutput">desc</output_port>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="SideShift_Ready"/>
        <Condition ID="SideShift_Request"/>
        <SubTree ID="SubTree"/>
        <SubTree ID="a"/>
        <SubTree ID="b"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the charging process for a robot. Initially, it triggers a sub-tree "ChargeST" to manage the charging sequence. Within "ChargeST", the robot first speaks a message in Portuguese, then moves to a specific location while attempting multiple times if necessary. Subsequently, it either charges or repeats speaking a phrase five times in parallel. After a brief wait, the robot speaks another message and stops charging.

Additionally, the behavior tree defines various actions and conditions that can be utilized within the tree, such as moving the robot's base, speaking messages, waiting for a specified duration, checking battery status, detecting faces, and more.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines a comprehensive charging routine for the robot, incorporating speech interactions, movement, and monitoring of the charging process.

                        </Repeat>

                </SequenceStar>

            <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="10"/>
            <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="Estou cheio, vou sair da estaÃ§Ã£o" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
            <Action ID="Charge" action="STOP_CHARGE" action_name="charging_action"/>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robot's decision-making process based on its battery and charging status. The robot has three main reactive sequences:
1. If the battery level is low (less than 3) and it is not charging, it will initiate a charging sequence.
2. If the robot is charging and the battery level is full (100%), it will stop charging and speak a message before continuing with its tasks.
3. If the battery level is low and it is not charging for an extended period, it will seek assistance by speaking a message, clearing cost maps, and waiting for a specified duration.

Additionally, there is a separate behavior tree for the charging sequence, which involves speaking a message, attempting to move to a specific location multiple times, and running a parallel action of charging and speaking a message repeatedly.

Overall, the behavior tree enables the robot to manage its energy levels effectively, prioritize charging when necessary, communicate its status, and seek help if needed.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <ReactiveFallback>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="CheckBattery" battery_state="k_bat_state" percentage="k_bat_perc" service_name="/vizzy_batteries_state"/>
                <Condition A="{k_bat_state}" B="3" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                <Action ID="CheckCharging" charging_state="charge_state" service_name="battery_charging_state"/>
                <Condition A="{charge_state}" B="0" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                <SubTree ID="ChargeST"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="CheckCharging" charging_state="charge_state" service_name="battery_charging_state"/>
                <Condition A="{charge_state}" B="1" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                <Action ID="CheckBattery" battery_state="k_bat_state" percentage="k_bat_perc" service_name="/vizzy_batteries_state"/>
                <Condition A="{k_bat_state}" B="0" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="Estou cheio, vou sair da estaÃ§Ã£o" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
                <Action ID="Charge" action="STOP_CHARGE" action_name="charging_action"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="CheckBattery" battery_state="k_bat_state" percentage="k_bat_perc" service_name="/vizzy_batteries_state"/>
                <Condition A="{k_bat_state}" B="3" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                <Action ID="CheckCharging" charging_state="charge_state" service_name="battery_charging_state"/>
                <Condition A="{charge_state}" B="0" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="Ajudem-me, tenho fome e nÃ£o consigo carregar" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
                <Action ID="CallEmptySrv" service_name="/move_base/clear_costmaps"/>
                <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="10"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Action ID="DebugAction" string="Ok"/>
        </ReactiveFallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="ChargeST">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="Tenho fome" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
            <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" name="Wait2Seconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="2"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
                <Action ID="MoveBase" action_name="move_base" frame_id="map" goal_pose="-4.88723403052;-6.0285904746;0.0;0.0;0.0;0.997843662386;0.0503172395835" name="Go to first point"/>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <Parallel failure_threshold="1" success_threshold="2">
                <Action ID="Charge" action="CHARGE" action_name="charging_action"/>
                <Repeat num_cycles="10">
                    <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="bip bip" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
                </Repeat>
            </Parallel>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ArmCartesian">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="pose"/>
            <input_port name="type"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ArmRoutines">
            <input_port name="gesture"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="CallEmptySrv">
            <input_port name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Charge">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="ChargeST"/>
        <Action ID="CheckBattery">
            <output_port name="battery_state" type="int"/>
            <output_port name="percentage" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CheckBool">
            <input_port name="variable" type="std::string"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="CheckCharging">
            <output_port name="charging_state" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CompareDouble">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <Condition ID="CompareInt">
            <input_port name="A" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="B" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="Condition" type="std::string"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="DebugAction">
            <input_port name="string" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Destroy"/>
        <Action ID="DetectBlocks">
            <output_port name="block_list" type="social_cues::BlockList_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <input_port name="block_topic" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DetectFaces">
            <output_port name="faceListOut"/>
            <input_port name="face_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FaceCounter">
            <input_port name="faceListIn"/>
            <input_port name="number_faces"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GazeAtTarget">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="fixation_pose"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GeneralActionlib">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="constants">A coma separated list of constants.</input_port>
            <output_port name="result">This is a string</output_port>
            <input_port name="variables">A coma separated list of variables.</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetFloat64">
            <output_port name="number" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetInt16">
            <output_port name="number"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetPoseArray">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GiveFeedback">
            <input_port default="850" name="almost_thr"/>
            <input_port name="correct_blocks"/>
            <input_port name="incorrect_blocks"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="personality"/>
            <input_port name="score"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveBase">
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="goal_pose" type="geometry_msgs::PoseStamped_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveTorso">
            <input_port name="angle"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ResetVars"/>
        <Action ID="SelectBlock">
            <input_port name="block_list" type="social_cues::BlockList_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <output_port name="block_pose" type="geometry_msgs::PoseStamped_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectFieldFromPoseStamped">
            <input_port name="field"/>
            <output_port name="output_val"/>
            <input_port name="pose_stamped"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectPose">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="pose_stamped"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SenseScore">
            <output_port name="score"/>
            <input_port name="score_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Speak">
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="language" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="utterance" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="voice" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="SubTree"/>
        <Action ID="TimerAction">
            <input_port name="s_between_success">Time (s) before this node returns SUCCESS. It will return FAILURE in the meanwhile</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds">
            <input_port name="result" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="seconds" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to control the actions of a robotic system based on various conditions and inputs. The tree consists of a repeating sequence that includes multiple sub-tasks such as checking preconditions, reactive actions based on current state, and updating the overall task sequence.

The robot's actions are determined by the input parameters and the current state, with options for moving, staying in place, picking up objects, or dropping them. The tree also handles recovery and replanning requests at different levels based on the current state and executed sequences.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's behavior by continuously executing a sequence of actions while considering the current state, desired sequences, and specific action types. It provides a structured approach to managing the robot's tasks and responses to dynamic environmental changes.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Switch4 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="pick" case_4="drop" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                            <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                            <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="PickAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="DropAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                        </Switch4>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="DropAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GuideAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="PickAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robotic system to execute a sequence of actions in a repeatable manner, with the number of cycles specified by an input parameter. The sequence involves several fallbacks and actions that are conditionally executed based on the state of the system.

The main sequence includes:
1. LTLPreCheck action followed by ReplanningRequestLevel2 action within a fallback.
2. Another fallback containing a Switch3 node which selects an action based on the value of bt_action_type, with MoveAction, StayAction, or SynchronizedTransitionAction being potential actions, and then ReplanningRequestLevel3 action.
3. UpdateLTL action at the end of the sequence.

Each action has specific input and output ports through which it interacts with the system. The behavior tree allows for handling locomotion status, executing different types of actions, checking and updating the system's state, and requesting replanning if necessary.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <Fallback>
                    <Switch3 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="synchronized_transition" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                        <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                        <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                        <AlwaysFailure/>
                    </Switch3>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a system that involves repetitive actions based on certain conditions. It includes a sequence of actions to be repeated a specified number of times. The actions involve checking a current state against a desired sequence, performing a move action based on certain conditions, and updating a sequence of actions and the desired state.

The "LTLPreCheck" action checks the current state against the desired sequence, while the "MoveAction" performs a move based on specific conditions and updates the state accordingly. The "UpdateLTL" action updates the sequence of actions and the desired state based on the outcome of the move action.

Overall, the behavior tree represents a system that iterates through a sequence of actions, including state checks, movement, and state updates, for a specified number of cycles.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                <Action ID="MoveAction" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <output_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robotic system to execute a series of actions in a repeatable sequence. The robot will perform a set of actions, including checking the current state and desired sequence, handling locomotion status, moving to a specific goal, updating the action sequence, and performing recovery and replanning if necessary. 

The tree structure ensures that the robot repeats this sequence a specified number of times. It also incorporates reactive sequences to handle failures and timeouts during locomotion, ensuring robustness in navigation and task execution.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's behavior by defining a structured sequence of actions, error handling, and recovery strategies to achieve its objectives while adapting to dynamic environmental conditions.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="Replanning2"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck"/>
                        <Timeout msec="">
                            <Sequence>
                                <Action ID="RecoveryStand"/>
                                <Action ID="LocomotionStart"/>
                            </Sequence>
                        </Timeout>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="MoveAction" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart"/>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck"/>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand"/>
        <Action ID="Replanning2"/>
        <Action ID="Replanning3"/>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <output_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robot's navigation system with periodic global path replanning at 1 Hz and recovery actions. It uses a hierarchical structure to handle navigation and recovery. The "NavigateWithReplanning" sequence includes a rate controller for the path planning process, which contains a recovery node for computing the path to a specific pose using a grid-based planner. If this fails, it triggers recovery actions such as clearing the global costmap and waiting. Additionally, there is a separate recovery node for following the computed path, with its own set of recovery actions like clearing the local costmap and spinning. If both navigation and path following fail, the overall recovery node triggers a wait action before retrying. This behavior tree ensures robust navigation by incorporating periodic replanning and recovery strategies in case of failures.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="2" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="4" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ReactiveFallback name="PathToPoseFallback">
              <GoalUpdated/>
              <RoundRobin name="GlobalPlannerRecoveryActions">
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
                <Wait wait_duration="2"/>
              </RoundRobin>
            </ReactiveFallback>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="4" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathFallback">
            <GoalUpdated/>
            <RoundRobin name="PlannerRecoveryActions">
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
              <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
            </RoundRobin>
          </ReactiveFallback>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the control logic for a robot's movement in response to different visual stimuli. The robot is programmed to continuously execute a sequence of movements based on the detection of specific objects using an OpenVINOEvent. When the "cat" is detected, the robot will move forward, stop, move backward, and then stop again. If the "dog" is detected, the robot will move backward, stop, move forward, and then stop. Finally, if the "cow" is detected, the robot will move left, stop, move right, and then stop.

This sequence of movements is repeated indefinitely unless interrupted. Additionally, the robot has predefined movements such as forward, stop, backward, right, and left, each associated with specific velocity values. These movements are executed by calling the "MoveRobot" behavior tree, which sends corresponding movement commands to the robot.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's responses to visual stimuli, guiding its movements based on the objects detected
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Foward" value="i;0.5" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Stop"   value="k;0.25"/>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Backward" value="<;0.5" /> 
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Right" value="l;2" /> 
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Left" value="j;2" /> 
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <ForceSuccess>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Sequence>
                            <OpenVINOEvent object="cat"/>
                            <Sequence>
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Foward" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Stop" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Backward" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Stop" />
                            </Sequence>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence>
                            <OpenVINOEvent object="dog"/>
                            <Sequence>
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Backward" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Stop" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Foward" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Stop" />
                            </Sequence>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence>
                            <OpenVINOEvent object="cow"/>
                            <Sequence>
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Left" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Stop" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Right" />
                                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Stop" />
                            </Sequence>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Fallback>
                </ForceSuccess>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <SendCommandVel movement="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a sequence of actions for a robotic arm. It begins by retrieving the joint positions for a specific pose called "UPTRAY" and then simultaneously sets the joints of the left and right arms to these positions. This is followed by similar sequences for poses labeled "EXTENDED", "GRIPPING", and "REST". Each pose's joint positions are retrieved and then set for both arms in parallel.

The use of parallel nodes ensures that the arm joints are set concurrently, with a success threshold of 2 and a failure threshold of 2. This means that at least 2 of the parallel tasks must succeed for the overall sequence to continue, providing redundancy and fault tolerance.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the movement of a robotic arm through a predefined sequence of poses, ensuring that the arm joints are correctly positioned in parallel for each pose before proceeding to the next one.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="UPTRAY" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <Parallel success_threshold="2" failure_threshold="2">
                <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
                <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            </Parallel>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="EXTENDED" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <Parallel success_threshold="2" failure_threshold="2">
                <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
                <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            </Parallel>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="GRIPPING" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <Parallel success_threshold="2" failure_threshold="2">
                <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
                <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            </Parallel>
            <GetArmJointsForPose pose="REST" joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            <Parallel success_threshold="2" failure_threshold="2">
                <SetArmJointsLeft joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
                <SetArmJointsRight joints_pose="{joints_pose}" />
            </Parallel>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree controls a robotic system with two grippers. The system is designed to perform a sequence of actions in parallel. Initially, it attempts to control both grippers simultaneously, with the requirement that at least two out of the four actions (two for each gripper) must succeed for the overall sequence to be considered successful. If this condition is not met, the sequence fails.

Following this, the system performs another set of parallel actions where both grippers are controlled again. Similar to the previous step, the success threshold is set to two out of four actions. If this condition is met, the sequence succeeds; otherwise, it fails.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the coordinated control of the robot's grippers, ensuring that specific combinations of actions are executed successfully in parallel.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">

    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Parallel success_threshold="2" failure_threshold="2">
                <GripperControlRight relative_gripper_gap="1.0" />
                <GripperControlLeft relative_gripper_gap="1.0" />
            </Parallel>
            <Parallel success_threshold="2" failure_threshold="2">
                <GripperControlRight relative_gripper_gap="0.0" />
                <GripperControlLeft relative_gripper_gap="0.0" />
            </Parallel>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a recovery system for a robot's navigation. The robot is programmed to recover from navigation failures using a series of recovery behaviors. If the robot encounters navigation issues, it will attempt recovery actions up to 6 times before giving up.

The recovery process consists of navigating with replanning, which involves computing a new path to the goal and following that path. If these actions fail, the recovery fallback behavior is triggered. This includes clearing the local and global costmaps, spinning the robot, and waiting for a specified duration.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can recover from navigation failures by attempting replanning and executing specific recovery actions when necessary.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
          <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
        </SequenceStar>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for the auto-localization task of a robot. It first checks if the initial pose has been received. If so, it attempts to perform self-localization. The self-localization process involves making a global localization service request and retrying up to 5 times if unsuccessful. Then, it retries the localization process up to 10 times, where it checks if the robot is localized. If not, it performs a sequence of spinning, backing up, and spinning again before checking for localization once more. This process continues until successful localization is achieved.
output:
<!--AutoLocalization-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <FallbackStar name="root_AutoLocalization">
      <initialPoseReceived/>
      <SequenceStar name="doSelfLocalization">
        <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="5" name="retry_client_request">
          <globalLocalizationServiceRequest/>
        </RetryUntilSuccesful>
        <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="10" name="retry_localization">
          <Sequence>
            <Fallback>
              <IsLocalized/>
              <SequenceStar>
               <Spin/>
               <BackUp/>
               <Spin/>
             </SequenceStar>
            </Fallback>
            <IsLocalized/>
          </Sequence> 
        </RetryUntilSuccesful>
      </SequenceStar>
    </FallbackStar>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.

The behavior tree represents the decision-making process for an animal in a simulated environment. The "ShedTree" defines the actions and conditions for the animal's behavior. 

The animal will prioritize its activities based on various conditions such as time of day, location, hunger, and reproductive state. It will attempt to find shelter in the shed during the night, graze during the day if not in the shed, and perform random movements when hungry and outside the shed. Additionally, it will seek prey, give birth, and attempt reproduction under specific conditions.

The tree is designed to simulate natural behaviors such as seeking shelter, foraging, and reproduction in an ecosystem. It provides a framework for the animal's decision-making process based on its current state and environmental factors.

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">

                <Action ID="LeaveShed"/>

                </Inverter>

    <TreeNodesModel>

        <Action ID="FindPrey"/>
        <Action ID="FindRandomPastureField"/>
