instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree represents a robot's task of patrolling and recharging. The robot is programmed to repeat the sequence 100 times, where it alternates between patrolling waypoints (wp_1 to wp_7) and recharging at a designated station. During patrolling, the robot navigates to each waypoint in sequence. If the battery runs low, it interrupts the patrolling sequence, navigates to the recharge station, and initiates the recharge process before resuming the patrolling sequence. This cycle continues until the specified number of repetitions is completed. Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's autonomous operation of patrolling an area while ensuring periodic recharging to maintain its functionality.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="root_sequence">
            <Repeat num_cycles="100">
                <Fallback>
                    <Sequence name="patrolling">
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_1"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_2"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_3"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_4"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_5"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_6"/>
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="wp_7"/>
                    </Sequence>
                    <Sequence name="recharging">
                        <NavigateToWp   name="navigate_to_wp" goal="recharge_station"/>
                        <Recharge/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
     </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents the actions of a robot or virtual agent. It begins by speaking a phrase in Portuguese, then waits for 2 seconds. If it fails to reach a specific point after three attempts, it proceeds to charge itself. The charging process involves setting a "charged" flag to 0, initiating the charging action, and then setting the "charged" flag to 1 upon completion. Following this, it waits for 45 seconds. If the "charged" flag is still 1, it emits a sound and waits for 2 seconds, repeating this process up to 100 times if necessary.

In summary, the behavior tree simulates a scenario where a robot communicates, navigates, charges itself, and responds to its charging status. This sequence of actions demonstrates a basic decision-making process and adaptive behavior based on environmental conditions.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="Tenho fome" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
            <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" name="Wait2Seconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="2"/>
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
                        <Action ID="MoveBase" action_name="move_base" frame_id="map" goal_pose="-1.7971;-5.5118;0.0;0;0;-0.72703;0.68659" name="Go to first point"/>
                    </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                    <Parallel failure_threshold="1" success_threshold="2">
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <SetBlackboard output_key="charged" value="0"/>
                            <Action ID="Charge" action="CHARGE" action_name="charging_action"/>
                            <SetBlackboard output_key="charged" value="1"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="45"/>
                            <ReactiveFallback>
                                <Condition A="{charged}" B="1" Condition="==" ID="CompareInt"/>
                                <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="100">
                                    <ForceFailure>
                                        <Sequence>
                                            <Action ID="Speak" action_name="/gcloud_tts" language="pt_PT" utterance="bip bip" voice="pt-PT-Wavenet-D"/>
                                            <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="2"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </ForceFailure>
                                </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                            </ReactiveFallback>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </Parallel>
                </SequenceStar>
            </Fallback>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Charge">
            <input_port name="action" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CompareInt">
            <input_port name="A" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="B" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="Condition" type="std::string"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="MoveBase">
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="goal_pose" type="geometry_msgs::PoseStamped_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Speak">
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="language" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="utterance" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="voice" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds">
            <input_port name="result" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="seconds" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's actions to interact with faces. It starts by obtaining a list of faces, selects the first face from the list, and then directs the robot to gaze at the selected face. The tree utilizes various predefined actions such as getting pose arrays, selecting poses, and gazing at targets.

Additionally, it includes a set of defined actions and conditions that can be used within the behavior tree, including tasks like detecting blocks, speaking, moving the base, and waiting for a specified duration. These actions are designed to enable the robot to perform diverse tasks related to interacting with its environment and communicating with humans.

Overall, the behavior tree represents a sequence of actions for the robot to identify and interact with faces, showcasing a structured approach to social interaction and task execution in a robotic context.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action topic="faces" ID="GetPoseArray" name="GetFaceList" pose_array="face_array"/>
            <Action pose_stamped="face" position_in_list="0" ID="SelectPose" pose_array="{face_array}"/>
            <Action frame_id="base_footprint" fixation_pose="{face}" action_name="gaze" ID="GazeAtTarget"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ArmCartesian">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="pose"/>
            <input_port name="type"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ArmRoutines">
            <input_port name="gesture"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="BiggerThan">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="Charge">
            <input_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="ChargeST"/>
        <Action ID="CheckBattery">
            <output_port name="battery_state" type="int"/>
            <output_port name="percentage" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CheckBool">
            <input_port name="variable"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="CheckCharging">
            <output_port name="charging_state" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CompareDouble">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <Condition ID="CompareInt">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <SubTree ID="Congratulate"/>
        <Action ID="DetectBlocks">
            <output_port name="block_list" type="social_cues::BlockList_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <input_port name="block_topic" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DetectFaces">
            <output_port name="faceListOut"/>
            <input_port name="face_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="ErrorGameState"/>
        <Action ID="FaceCounter">
            <input_port name="faceListIn"/>
            <input_port name="number_faces"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="GazeAtFace"/>
        <Action ID="GazeAtTarget">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="fixation_pose"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetInt16">
            <output_port name="number"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetPoseArray">
            <output_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="HelpPrepare"/>
        <Action ID="MoveBase">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="goal_pose"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTree ID="ResetVariables"/>
        <SubTree ID="SayHello"/>
        <Action ID="SelectBlock">
            <input_port name="block_list" type="social_cues::BlockList_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <output_port name="block_pose" type="geometry_msgs::PoseStamped_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectPose">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <output_port name="pose_stamped"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Speak">
            <input_port name="action_name" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="language" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="utterance" type="std::string"/>
            <input_port name="voice" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds">
            <input_port name="result" default="SUCCESS">Result after specified time: SUCCESS or FAILURE</input_port>
            <input_port name="seconds" default="5">Time in seconds</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robotic system to execute a sequence of actions based on certain conditions and inputs. The tree contains a main loop that repeats a sequence of actions a specified number of times. Within the sequence, it first checks for specific conditions using fallbacks and reactive sequences, and then performs various actions based on the results.

The actions include moving, staying in place, picking up an item, dropping an item, updating the state, requesting replanning at different levels, and handling locomotion status. These actions are governed by input ports and conditional checks, ensuring that the robot responds appropriately to its environment and internal states.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's decision-making process, enabling it to navigate, manipulate objects, update its state, and request replanning as necessary while adhering to a predefined sequence and reacting to dynamic conditions.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Switch4 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="pick" case_4="drop" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                            <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                            <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="PickAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="DropAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                        </Switch4>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="DropAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GuideAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="PickAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to control a robotic system's actions and decision-making process. It consists of multiple nodes that handle various tasks such as checking the current state against desired sequences, requesting replanning at different levels, detecting fake inputs, performing different types of actions (move, stay, pick, drop), updating the action sequence, and managing locomotion status.

The tree structure includes repeating a sequence for a specified number of cycles, where within each cycle, it performs a series of actions based on reactive sequences, conditions, and fallbacks. The robot's behavior is influenced by the input parameters such as the current state, desired sequences, action type, and execution status.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's decision-making process, handling both normal actions and recovery processes in case of failures or unexpected inputs. It aims to ensure that the robot follows the desired sequences while adapting to changing conditions and executing appropriate actions based on its environment.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel1" replanning_fake_input="{replanning_fake_input}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel3" replanning_fake_input="{replanning_fake_input}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Switch4 case_1="move" case_2="stay" case_3="pick" case_4="drop" variable="{bt_action_type}">
                            <Action ID="MoveAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" goal_sent="{goal_sent}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}"/>
                            <Action ID="StayAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="PickAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <Action ID="DropAction" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}"/>
                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                        </Switch4>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_executed_sequence="{ltl_state_executed_sequence}" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" action_sequence_executed="{action_sequence_executed}" bt_action_type="{bt_action_type}" current_action="{current_action}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="BackNormalAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="DropAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel1">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel2">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FakeDetectionLevel3">
            <input_port name="replanning_fake_input"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GuideAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <output_port name="goal_sent"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="PickAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="ReactiveLTLStateCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel1">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_executed_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StayAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SynchronizedTransitionAction">
            <input_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <input_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="action_sequence_executed"/>
            <output_port name="bt_action_type"/>
            <output_port name="current_action"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate a global path with periodic replanning at 1 Hz and includes recovery actions. The robot will attempt the navigation sequence, and if it encounters failures, it will retry a specified number of times before moving on to the next step. 

The "NavigateWithReplanning" sequence involves computing a path to a specific goal using a grid-based planner, following the computed path, and handling recovery actions in case of failures during navigation. If the robot encounters issues during path planning or following, it will execute recovery actions such as clearing the costmaps and waiting for a specific duration.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can continuously navigate towards its goal while handling potential failures and dynamically replanning its path to ensure successful navigation.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="2" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
        <RateController hz="1.0">
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="4" name="ComputePathToPose">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            <ReactiveFallback name="PathToPoseFallback">
              <GoalUpdated/>
              <RoundRobin name="GlobalPlannerRecoveryActions">
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
                <Wait wait_duration="2"/>
              </RoundRobin>
            </ReactiveFallback>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </RateController>
        <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="4" name="FollowPath">
          <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathFallback">
            <GoalUpdated/>
            <RoundRobin name="PlannerRecoveryActions">
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
              <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
            </RoundRobin>
          </ReactiveFallback>
        </RecoveryNode>
      </PipelineSequence>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate while continuously replanning its global path after every 1 meter of movement. It uses a pipeline sequence that consists of a distance controller and a follow path action. The distance controller triggers the computation of a new path to the goal pose using a "GridBased" planner whenever the robot has moved 1 meter, and then the robot follows this newly computed path using the follow path action. This setup ensures that the robot dynamically adjusts its path as it progresses towards its goal, allowing for efficient and adaptive navigation in changing environments.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path after every 1m.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <DistanceController distance="1.0">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </DistanceController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robotic system that performs various tasks based on different scenarios. The robot is capable of executing actions such as picking, delivering, charging, and navigating to specific coordinates.

The main behavior tree consists of two parallel branches. The first branch continuously repeats an action (VariantAction) based on a specified variant. The second branch selects a sub-behavior tree based on the value of the variant and executes the corresponding sequence of actions for pick, deliver, or charge operations.

Each specific task, such as charging, delivering, or navigation, is represented by its own behavior tree with sequences of actions. For example, the "Charge" behavior tree includes a sequence to move the robot to a specific location for charging.

Additionally, there are reusable sub-behavior trees like "PickDeliverCharge" and "pick_subtree" which encapsulate sequences of actions for common tasks like picking objects and delivering them.

Overall, the behavior tree enables the robot to perform complex tasks involving navigation, object
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Parallel failure_threshold="1" success_threshold="1">
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <Action ID="VariantAction" value="{variant}"/>
            </Repeat>
            <Switch3 case_1="pick" case_2="deliver" case_3="dock" variable="{variant}">
                <SubTreePlus ID="PickDeliverCharge"/>
                <SubTreePlus ID="DeliverCharge"/>
                <SubTreePlus ID="Charge"/>
                <SubTreePlus ID="PickDeliverCharge"/>
            </Switch3>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Charge">
        <Sequence name="Charge">
            <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo" __shared_blackboard="false" x_input="-9.33" y_input="2.17"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Deliver">
        <Sequence name="deliver">
            <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo" __shared_blackboard="false" x_input="-8.08" y_input="4.11"/>
            <Action ID="objectdrop" obj_index="-1"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="DeliverCharge">
        <Sequence name="Deliver/Charge">
            <SubTreePlus ID="Deliver"/>
            <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo" __shared_blackboard="false" x_input="-9.33" y_input="8"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="GoTo">
        <Sequence name="GoTo">
            <Action ID="pathPlanner" number_of_waypoints="{number_of_waypoints_}" waypoints="{waypoints_}" x="{x_input}" y="{y_input}"/>
            <Condition ID="CheckPositiveCondition" value="{number_of_waypoints_}"/>
            <Repeat num_cycles="{number_of_waypoints_}">
                <Sequence>
                    <Action ID="ExecutePathAction" w_x="{_w_x}" w_y="{_w_y}" waypoints="{waypoints_}"/>
                    <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="150" x="{_w_x}" y="{_w_y}"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="PickDeliverCharge">
        <Sequence name="Pick/Deliver/Charge">
            <SubTreePlus ID="pick_subtree"/>
            <SubTreePlus ID="Deliver"/>
            <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo" __shared_blackboard="false" x_input="-9.33" y_input="2.17"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="pick_subtree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action ID="objectplacement" query="WOODENBOX_0.1_0.3_0.3_0.3"/>
            <Repeat num_cycles="4">
                <ForceSuccess>
                    <Sequence name="pick">
                        <Action ID="TxtToWaypointsAction" goal_path="boxes" x="{x}" y="{y}"/>
                        <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo" __shared_blackboard="false" x_input="{x}" y_input="{y}"/>
                        <Action ID="objectplacement" query="MOCK_0.5_0.3_0.3_0.3"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </ForceSuccess>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <SubTreePlus ID="Charge"/>
        <Condition ID="CheckPositiveCondition">
            <input_port default="{number_of_waypoints}" name="value"/>
        </Condition>
        <SubTreePlus ID="Deliver"/>
        <SubTreePlus ID="DeliverCharge"/>
        <Action ID="ExecutePathAction">
            <output_port default="{_w_x}" name="w_x"/>
            <output_port default="{_w_y}" name="w_y"/>
            <input_port default="{waypoints_}" name="waypoints"/>
        </Action>
        <SubTreePlus ID="GoTo">
            <input_port default="false" name="__shared_blackboard">If false (default), the Subtree has an isolated blackboard and needs port remapping</input_port>
            <input_port default="1.61" name="x_input"/>
            <input_port default="7.76" name="y_input"/>
        </SubTreePlus>
        <SubTreePlus ID="PickDeliverCharge"/>
        <Action ID="TxtToWaypointsAction">
            <input_port default="boxes" name="goal_path"/>
            <output_port default="{x}" name="x"/>
            <output_port default="{y}" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="VariantAction">
            <output_port default="{variant}" name="value"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="activateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="approachLocation">
            <input_port default="1" name="locationId"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="approachWall"/>
        <Action ID="deactivateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="getBaseCharging">
            <output_port default="{charging}" name="charging"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="getPersonPose">
            <input_port default="MARIA" name="personname"/>
            <output_port default="{x_}" name="x"/>
            <output_port default="{y_}" name="y"/>
            <output_port default="{z_}" name="z"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="initNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="loadMap"/>
        <Action ID="loadNavigationMap">
            <input_port default="navigation-map" name="mapname"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsLocation"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsRelative"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotAbs"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotRel"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition">
            <input_port default="50" name="approachRadius"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="objectdrop">
            <input_port name="obj_index"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="objectplacement">
            <input_port name="query"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="pathPlanner">
            <output_port default="{number_of_waypoints_}" name="number_of_waypoints"/>
            <output_port default="{waypoints_}" name="waypoints"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
        <SubTreePlus ID="pick_subtree"/>
        <Action ID="setRobotPose">
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="yaw"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="startJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="startReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="triggerGlobalLocalization"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to make a system say "hello" and then "world" using a sub-tree. The main behavior tree first sets the blackboard with the value "hello" and passes it to the sub-tree "MySubtree" which says the message. Then, it sets the blackboard with the value "world" and again passes it to the same sub-tree "MySubtree" for saying.

The "MySubtree" defines an action to say the received message. It takes the input message and uses it to perform the action "SaySomething".

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the process of setting messages in the blackboard and then utilizing a sub-tree to say these messages. This allows for a modular and reusable way of performing actions based on the provided messages.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SetBlackboard value="hello" output_key="myMsg"/>
            <SubTree ID="MySubtree" message="myMsg"/>
            <SetBlackboard value="world" output_key="myMsg"/>
            <SubTree ID="MySubtree" message="myMsg"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MySubtree">
        <Action msg="{message}" ID="SaySomething"/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <SubTree ID="MySubtree">
            <input_port name="message"/>
        </SubTree>
        <Action ID="SaySomething">
            <input_port name="msg"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot. It operates in parallel, continuously repeating a variant action while also performing people recognition. If the recognition fails, it attempts to locate a person named THOMAS and move the robot towards their position. Additionally, it contains various sub-trees and individual actions for tasks such as recharging, navigation, localization, and movement.

The tree is designed to handle complex scenarios by concurrently executing multiple tasks, ensuring continuous operation through repeated cycles. It integrates both reactive behaviors, triggered by immediate events like people recognition, and planned actions, represented by the variant action and sequential movements towards specific locations.

Overall, the behavior tree enables the robot to autonomously manage its energy levels, navigate to designated areas, recognize individuals, and respond to dynamic environmental changes, showcasing a comprehensive set of capabilities for autonomous robotic operations.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Parallel threshold="1">
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <Action ID="VariantAction" value="{variant}"/>
            </Repeat>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
                <Fallback>
                    <Action ID="getPersonPose" personname="THOMAS" x="{x_}" y="{y_}" z="{z_}"/>
                    <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" x="3000" y="-12000"/>
                </Fallback>
            </Sequence>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <SubTree ID="Recharge"/>
        <SubTree ID="SearchThomasRoom2"/>
        <SubTree ID="SearchThomasRoom4"/>
        <Action ID="VariantAction">
            <output_port default="{variant}" name="value"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="activateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="approachLocation">
            <input_port default="1" name="locationId"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="approachWall"/>
        <Action ID="deactivateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="getBaseCharging">
            <output_port default="{charging}" name="charging"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="getPersonPose">
            <input_port default="MARIA" name="personname"/>
            <output_port default="{x_}" name="x"/>
            <output_port default="{y_}" name="y"/>
            <output_port default="{z_}" name="z"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="initNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="loadMap"/>
        <Action ID="loadNavigationMap">
            <input_port default="navigation-map" name="mapname"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsLocation"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsRelative"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotAbs"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotRel"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition">
            <input_port default="50" name="approachRadius"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
        <Action ID="setRobotPose">
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="yaw"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="startJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="startReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="triggerGlobalLocalization"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
This behavior tree orchestrates the decision-making and actions of a character in a simulated environment. The character is programmed to perform various tasks based on its needs, job assignments, and environmental conditions.

The main behavior tree "MainTree" encompasses several sub-trees for handling different scenarios:
1. AlarmTree: Manages the response to an alarm, including seeking safety or aborting the current task.
2. Combat: Handles combat situations, including engaging targets and aborting the current task if necessary.
3. Mission: Coordinates actions related to mission execution, such as leaving for and returning from a mission.
4. Needs: Addresses the character's basic needs like hunger, thirst, and sleep, ensuring they are fulfilled.
5. GnomeStandard: Covers standard activities like obtaining uniforms, bandages, training, and performing regular jobs.
6. Jobs: Orchestrates various job-related tasks, including butchering animals, dyeing animals, leading animals to pasture, harvesting animals, hauling multiple items,
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="AlarmTree">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="Alarm"/>
            <Condition ID="IsCivilian"/>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Condition ID="IsInSafeRoom"/>
                    <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="GetSafeRoomPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </Fallback>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Combat">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Fallback>
                <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
                <Condition ID="HasHuntTarget"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Sequence>
                        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
                        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="GetUniform">
        <SequenceStar name="GetUniform">
            <Action ID="CheckUniform"/>
            <Fallback>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="UniformCleanUp"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="EquipUniform"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Hunger">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
            <Sequence>
                <SequenceStar name="Hunger">
                    <Action ID="FindFood"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                    <Action ID="Eat"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsFull"/>
            </Sequence>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobButcherAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="ButcherAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobDyeAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="DyeAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                    <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
                    <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="DyeAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="HarvestAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobHaulMultiple">
        <BB_Precondition expected="HauleMultipleItems" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                    <Action ID="FindTool"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
                    <Inverter>
                        <Sequence>
                            <Inverter>
                                <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
                            </Inverter>
                            <Sequence>
                                <Action ID="Move"/>
                                <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Inverter>
                    <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="DropAllItems"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture">
        <BB_Precondition expected="LeadAnimalToPasture" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobStandard">
        <Fallback>
            <SequenceStar name="StandardJobs">
                <Action ID="InitJob"/>
                <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
                <Action ID="FindTool"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
                <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
                <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
                <Action ID="Move"/>
                <Action ID="Work"/>
                <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
            </SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="JobTameAnimal">
        <BB_Precondition expected="TameAnimal" key="JobType">
            <Fallback>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="TameAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
                    <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </Fallback>
        </BB_Precondition>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Jobs">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="GetJob"/>
            <FallbackStar>
                <SubTree ID="JobButcherAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobDyeAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobTameAnimal"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobHaulMultiple"/>
                <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
            </FallbackStar>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Fallback>
            <SubTree ID="AlarmTree"/>
            <SubTree ID="Combat"/>
            <SubTree ID="Mission"/>
            <FallbackStar name="Needs">
                <SubTree ID="Hunger"/>
                <SubTree ID="Thirst"/>
                <SubTree ID="Sleepy"/>
            </FallbackStar>
            <FallbackStar name="GnomeStandard">
                <FallbackStar>
                    <SubTree ID="GetUniform"/>
                    <SubTree ID="PickUpBandages"/>
                    <SubTree ID="Training"/>
                    <SubTree ID="Trainer"/>
                </FallbackStar>
                <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
                <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
            </FallbackStar>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Mission">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsOnMission"/>
            <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            <Action ID="GetExitPosition"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="LeaveForMission"/>
            <Action ID="DoMission"/>
            <Action ID="ReturnFromMission"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob">
        <Sequence>
            <Inverter>
                <Sequence>
                    <Inverter>
                        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                    </Inverter>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Inverter>
            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="OldMoveAllItemsToJob">
        <FallbackStar>
            <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="20">
                <Sequence>
                    <SequenceStar>
                        <Action ID="Move"/>
                        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
                            <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                            <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
                    </SequenceStar>
                    <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
                </Sequence>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
            <ForceFailure>
                <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
            </ForceFailure>
        </FallbackStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="PickUpBandages">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Action ID="CheckBandages"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Sleepy">
        <SequenceStar name="Sleep">
            <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
            <ForceSuccess>
                <SequenceStar>
                    <Action ID="FindBed"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                </SequenceStar>
            </ForceSuccess>
            <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Thirst">
        <SequenceStar>
            <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
            <Sequence>
                <SequenceStar name="Thirst">
                    <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
                    <Action ID="Move"/>
                    <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
                    <ForceSuccess>
                        <SequenceStar>
                            <Action ID="FindDining"/>
                            <Action ID="Move"/>
                        </SequenceStar>
                    </ForceSuccess>
                    <Action ID="Drink"/>
                </SequenceStar>
                <Condition ID="IsDrinkFull"/>
            </Sequence>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Trainer">
        <SequenceStar name="Trainer">
            <Condition ID="IsTrainer"/>
            <Action ID="FindTrainerPosition"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="SuperviseTraining"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Training">
        <SequenceStar name="Training">
            <Condition ID="IsTrainingTime"/>
            <Action ID="FindTrainingGround"/>
            <Action ID="Move"/>
            <Action ID="Train"/>
        </SequenceStar>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AbortJob"/>
        <Condition ID="Alarm"/>
        <SubTree ID="AlarmTree"/>
        <Condition ID="AllItemsInPlaceForJob"/>
        <Condition ID="AllPickedUp"/>
        <Action ID="AttackTarget"/>
        <Action ID="ButcherAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="CheckBandages"/>
        <Action ID="CheckUniform"/>
        <Action ID="ClaimItems"/>
        <SubTree ID="Combat"/>
        <Action ID="DoMission"/>
        <Action ID="Drink"/>
        <Action ID="DropAllItems"/>
        <Action ID="DropItem"/>
        <Action ID="DyeAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="Eat"/>
        <Action ID="EnterMap"/>
        <Action ID="EquipTool"/>
        <Action ID="EquipUniform"/>
        <Action ID="FinalMoveAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="FindBed"/>
        <Action ID="FindDining"/>
        <Action ID="FindDrink"/>
        <Action ID="FindFood"/>
        <Action ID="FindTool"/>
        <Action ID="FindTrainerPosition"/>
        <Action ID="FindTrainingGround"/>
        <Action ID="FinishJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetExitPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetItemDropPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetJob"/>
        <Action ID="GetSafeRoomPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GetTarget"/>
        <SubTree ID="GetUniform"/>
        <Action ID="GetWorkPosition"/>
        <Action ID="GrabAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="HarvestAnimal"/>
        <Condition ID="HasHuntTarget"/>
        <SubTree ID="Hunger"/>
        <Action ID="InitAnimalJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitButcherJob"/>
        <Action ID="InitJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsButcherJob"/>
        <Condition ID="IsCivilian"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDrinkFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsFull"/>
        <Condition ID="IsHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsInCombat"/>
        <Condition ID="IsInSafeRoom"/>
        <Condition ID="IsOnMission"/>
        <Condition ID="IsSleepy"/>
        <Condition ID="IsThirsty"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTrainer"/>
        <Condition ID="IsTrainingTime"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryHungry"/>
        <Condition ID="IsVeryThirsty"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobButcherAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobDyeAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobHarvestAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobHaulMultiple"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobLeadAnimalToPasture"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobStandard"/>
        <SubTree ID="JobTameAnimal"/>
        <SubTree ID="Jobs"/>
        <Action ID="LeaveForMission"/>
        <Action ID="LeaveMap"/>
        <SubTree ID="Mission"/>
        <Action ID="Move"/>
        <SubTree ID="MoveAllItemsToJob"/>
        <SubTree ID="OldMoveAllItemsToJob"/>
        <SubTree ID="PickUpBandages"/>
        <Action ID="PickUpItem"/>
        <Action ID="RandomMove"/>
        <Action ID="ReleaseAnimal"/>
        <Action ID="ReturnAlwaysRunning"/>
        <Action ID="ReturnFromMission"/>
        <Action ID="Sleep"/>
        <SubTree ID="Sleepy"/>
        <Action ID="SuperviseTraining"/>
        <Action ID="TameAnimal"/>
        <Condition ID="TargetAdjacent"/>
        <SubTree ID="Thirst"/>
        <Action ID="Train"/>
        <SubTree ID="Trainer"/>
        <SubTree ID="Training"/>
        <Action ID="UniformCleanUp"/>
        <Action ID="Work"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--  ===================================  -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:

It seems that the behavior tree is designed to carry out a series of operations involving input and output parameters, possibly related to processing data or performing specific tasks based on the provided inputs. The actions are structured within a sequence, indicating a specific order of execution.

Overall, the behavior tree appears to define a workflow for handling input and output parameters within a sequence of actions, but without additional context or details about the specific functionalities of each action, it is challenging to provide a more detailed summary.
output:

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the decision-making process for a robot navigating through obstacles. The robot is programmed to follow a sequence of actions: first, attempting to pass through a door; if that fails, it will then attempt to pass through a window. If both attempts fail, it will resort to closing the door.

Additionally, the tree includes specific actions that the robot can take, such as opening or closing a door, and passing through a door or window. It also checks whether the door is open before taking any action.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's navigation through obstacles by defining a series of actions and conditions, enabling it to make decisions based on its environment.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence name="SeqA">
            <Fallback name="root_Fallback">
                <Sequence name="SeqB">
                    <Action ID="PassThroughDoor"/>
                </Sequence>
                <Sequence name="SeqE">
                    <Action ID="PassThroughWindow"/>
                    <Action ID="PassThroughWindow"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="CloseDoor"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="CloseDoor"/>
        <Condition ID="IsDoorOpen"/>
        <Action ID="OpenDoor"/>
        <Action ID="PassThroughDoor"/>
        <Action ID="PassThroughWindow"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate while considering battery levels and implementing recovery actions. If the battery level falls below 70%, the robot will prioritize returning to a base location (0,0,0) at a rate of 1 Hz. In case of navigation failures, it will attempt recovery by replanning the path and clearing costmaps. Additionally, if the goal is updated during navigation, it will clear costmaps and execute recovery actions such as spinning and waiting. This ensures that the robot can effectively navigate its environment, replan paths when necessary, and recover from potential issues like map inconsistencies or goal updates.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz and it also has
  recovery actions such as moving forward and spinning.
-->
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <ReactiveFallback name="BatteryFallback">
      <Sequence name="LowBatteryBehavior">
        <IsBatteryLow min_battery="70" battery_topic="/battery_status" is_voltage="true"/>
        <PipelineSequence name="GoBase">
            <RateController hz="1.0">
              <ComputePathToPose goal="0;0;0" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
            </RateController>
            <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
          </PipelineSequence>
      </Sequence>
      <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
        <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
          <RateController hz="1.0">
            <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
              <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
            </RecoveryNode>
          </RateController>
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
            <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
          </RecoveryNode>
        </PipelineSequence>
        <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
          <GoalUpdated/>
          <SequenceStar name="RecoveryActions">
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
            <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/>
            <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
          </SequenceStar>
        </ReactiveFallback>
      </RecoveryNode>
    </ReactiveFallback>
    
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree is designed for a robot to navigate with periodic global path replanning at a rate of 1 Hz. It consists of a sequence of actions within a pipeline, where the robot first computes a path to a specified goal using a "GridBased" planner at a frequency of 1 Hz. Once the path is computed, the robot follows this path using a specified controller ("FollowPath"). This setup ensures that the robot continuously updates its global path to adapt to changing environments and obstacles while navigating towards its goal.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path periodically at 1 Hz.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </RateController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a sequence of actions to be executed by a robot or an autonomous agent. The sequence consists of three main actions: "go1", "go2", and "go3" which are performed in that order. 

Additionally, the tree includes other potential actions such as "dumpRun", "goClosestR", "isFull", "mineResources", "moveBaseToGoal", and "waitFrames". These actions can be utilized in different scenarios based on specific conditions and requirements.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines a structured plan for the robot's behavior, where it will execute the specified actions sequentially, potentially incorporating other actions based on certain conditions or events.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence name="Sequence1">
            <Action ID="go1"/>
            <Action ID="go2"/>
            <Action ID="go3"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="dumpRun"/>
        <Action ID="go1"/>
        <Action ID="go2"/>
        <Action ID="go3"/>
        <Action ID="goClosestR"/>
        <Condition ID="isFull"/>
        <Action ID="mineResources"/>
        <Action ID="moveBaseToGoal">
            <inout_port name="key_name">goal</inout_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="waitFrames">
            <output_port name="barout"/>
            <inout_port name="baz"/>
            <input_port name="fooin"/>
            <input_port default="15" name="frames">frames</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input: The behavior tree outlines the actions for a robot. Initially, it attempts to execute a sequence of actions. If the "CheckLaser" action fails, indicating an obstacle in the path, it then tries to perform a "Backward" action for 3 units of time followed by a "Turn" action for 4 units of time. If the "CheckLaser" action succeeds, the robot will simply execute a "Forward" action.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence>
      <Fallback ID="Fallback">
        <CheckLaser name="check_laser"/>
        <Sequence>
          <Backward name="backward" duration="3"/>
          <Turn name="turn" duration="4"/>
        </Sequence>
      </Fallback>
      <Forward name="forward"/>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot. It first checks if the robot is holding an item, and if not, it attempts to place an item. If there is no item to pick up, it then looks for an item and picks it up. Regardless of these conditions, the "AlwaysRunning" action is continuously executed.

Additionally, there is an initialization behavior tree that simply prints "Initialize" when triggered.

In summary, the behavior tree controls the robot's decision-making process by prioritizing placing items, picking up items, and continuously running, while also including an initialization step.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <ReactiveSequence name="Pursue Goals">
            <Fallback name="No Item in gripper">
                <Inverter name="Not">
                    <Condition ID="HoldingItem" name="Holding an Item"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Action ID="Place" name="Place it"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Fallback name="No Item to pick">
                <Inverter name="Not">
                    <Condition ID="SeeItem" name="See an Item"/>
                </Inverter>
                <Action ID="Pick" name="Pick it up"/>
            </Fallback>
            <Action ID="AlwaysRunning" name="Keep Running"/>
        </ReactiveSequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Init">
        <Action ID="Print" message="Initialize"/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AlwaysRunning"/>
        <Action ID="GetItemPose"/>
        <Condition ID="HoldingItem"/>
        <SubTree ID="Init"/>
        <Action ID="Pick"/>
        <Action ID="Place"/>
        <Action ID="Print">
            <input_port name="message"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="SeeItem"/>
        <Action ID="Trigger">
            <input_port name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a decision-making process for an autonomous vehicle. The vehicle's actions are determined by various conditions and sequences of actions. 

The tree begins with a fallback node named "Core_seq" that contains multiple sequences and conditions. It includes checking mission status, stopping the vehicle, generating a path, handling lane keeping and lane changing scenarios, as well as dealing with traffic lights.

Each sequence within "Core_seq" handles specific tasks such as lane keeping, lane changing (left and right), A* path planning, and recovery actions in case of failure.

The tree also involves checking various conditions related to collision, lane change feasibility, traffic light status, and the vehicle's current state. Additionally, it includes actions like acceleration, setting paths, initiating movement, stopping, and publishing data.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates the vehicle's decision-making process, considering factors like path availability, traffic conditions, and vehicle state to navigate effectively and safely.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Fallback name="Core_seq">
            <Sequence name="">
                <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
                <Action ID="stop"/>
            </Sequence>
            <Sequence name="">
                <Sequence name="gen_path">
                    <Condition ID="checkExistPathGlobal"/>
                    <Action ID="init"/>
                    <Fallback name="StateSelect">
                        <Sequence name="LaneKeeping">
                            <Condition ID="checkStateLaneKeeping"/>
                            <Action ID="genPathLaneKeeping"/>
                            <Action ID="setPath"/>
                            <Fallback name="">
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Fallback name="lane_keeping">
                                            <Sequence name="">
                                                <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
                                                <Action ID="acc"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                            <Sequence name="">
                                                <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
                                                <Action ID="acc"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                            <Sequence name="">
                                                <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
                                                <Action ID="acc"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                        </Fallback>
                                        <Fallback name="lane_change">
                                            <Sequence name="lane_change_left">
                                                <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeLeft"/>
                                                <Condition ID="checkLaneChangeableLeft"/>
                                                <Fallback name="">
                                                    <Sequence name="">
                                                        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                        <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                                        <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                    </Sequence>
                                                    <Sequence name="">
                                                        <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeLeft"/>
                                                        <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                                                    </Sequence>
                                                </Fallback>
                                            </Sequence>
                                            <Sequence name="lane_change_right">
                                                <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeRight"/>
