                                                <Condition ID="checkLaneChangeableRight"/>
                                                <Fallback name="">
                                                    <Sequence name="">
                                                        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                        <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                                        <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                    </Sequence>
                                                    <Sequence name="">
                                                        <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeRight"/>
                                                        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                                                    </Sequence>
                                                </Fallback>
                                            </Sequence>
                                        </Fallback>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Sequence name="astar">
                                            <Condition ID="checkAbleAstar"/>
                                            <Sequence name="Gen_Local">
                                                <Action ID="stop"/>
                                                <Action ID="setStateAstar"/>
                                                <Action ID="genPathAstar"/>
                                            </Sequence>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <AlwaysSuccess/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
                                    <Fallback name="">
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Condition ID="checkLeftChange"/>
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeLeft"/>
                                                <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Sequence name="">
                                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                                    <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                                <Sequence name="">
                                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeLeft"/>
                                                    <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                            </Fallback>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Sequence name="">
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeRight"/>
                                                <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Fallback name="">
                                                <Sequence name="">
                                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                                    <Action ID="keepLane"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                                <Sequence name="">
                                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeRight"/>
                                                    <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
                                                </Sequence>
                                            </Fallback>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Fallback>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence name="LaneChangeLeft">
                            <Condition ID="checkStateLaneChangeLeft"/>
                            <Action ID="setPath"/>
                            <Fallback name="">
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkEndLaneChange"/>
                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeLeft"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence name="LaneChangeRigth">
                            <Condition ID="checkStateLaneChangeRight"/>
                            <Action ID="setPath"/>
                            <Fallback name="">
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkEndLaneChange"/>
                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeRight"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence name="Astar">
                            <Condition ID="checkStateAstar"/>
                            <Action ID="setPath"/>
                            <Fallback name="local_check">
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                    <Action ID="stop"/>
                                    <Action ID="genPathAstar"/>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Sequence name="">
                                    <Condition ID="checkFinishAstar"/>
                                    <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
                                    <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Sequence>
                        <Sequence name="Recovery">
                            <AlwaysFailure/>
                        </Sequence>
                    </Fallback>
                </Sequence>
                <Sequence name="traffic_check">
                    <Fallback name="">
                        <Fallback name="">
                            <Sequence name="">
                                <Condition ID="checkPassAbleTrafficLight"/>
                                <Fallback name="">
                                    <Sequence name="">
                                        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
                                        <Action ID="stop"/>
                                    </Sequence>
                                    <Action ID="drive"/>
                                </Fallback>
                            </Sequence>
                            <Action ID="stopTrafficLight"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Action ID="drive"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Action ID="setPath"/>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="publishData"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="acc"/>
        <Condition ID="checkAbleAstar"/>
        <Condition ID="checkCollision"/>
        <Condition ID="checkEmptyLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkEndLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkExistPathGlobal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFinishAstar"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFinishLocal"/>
        <Condition ID="checkFrontObject"/>
        <Condition ID="checkGenPathLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkGlobalLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkInitPose"/>
        <Condition ID="checkIsGlobalFollow"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLaneChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLaneChangeableLeft"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLaneChangeableRight"/>
        <Condition ID="checkLeftChange"/>
        <Condition ID="checkMissionWait"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearCorner"/>
        <Condition ID="checkNearStopline"/>
        <Condition ID="checkPassAbleTrafficLight"/>
        <Condition ID="checkProfitKeeplane"/>
        <Condition ID="checkStateAstar"/>
        <Condition ID="checkStateLaneChangeLeft"/>
        <Condition ID="checkStateLaneChangeRight"/>
        <Condition ID="checkStateLaneKeeping"/>
        <Condition ID="checkTrafficLight"/>
        <Action ID="drive"/>
        <Action ID="genGlobalFollowPath"/>
        <Action ID="genLocalPath"/>
        <Action ID="genPathAstar"/>
        <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="genPathLaneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="genPathLaneKeeping"/>
        <Action ID="init"/>
        <Action ID="keepLane"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="laneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="localPathFollow"/>
        <Action ID="localPathfollow"/>
        <Action ID="publishData"/>
        <Action ID="setFinishLocal"/>
        <Action ID="setPath"/>
        <Action ID="setStartLocal"/>
        <Action ID="setStateAstar"/>
        <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeLeft"/>
        <Action ID="setStateLaneChangeRight"/>
        <Action ID="setStateLaneKeeping"/>
        <Action ID="stop"/>
        <Action ID="stopTrafficLight"/>
        <SubTree ID="treeGenGlobalFollowPath"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a navigation system for a robot to dynamically move to a specified position while continuously replanning its path. The process involves the following steps:

1. The robot updates its goal pose and computes a path to the updated goal using a GridBased planner.
2. The computed path is then truncated to a certain distance to ensure the robot follows a manageable segment of the path at a time.
3. The robot continuously follows the truncated path using a specific controller until it reaches the goal, with the ability to replan if necessary.

This behavior tree ensures that the robot can navigate to a dynamic pose while adapting its path based on real-time changes in the environment, providing robust and adaptive navigation capabilities.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree follows a dynamic pose to a certain distance
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Sequence>
          <GoalUpdater input_goal="{goal}" output_goal="{updated_goal}">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{updated_goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          </GoalUpdater>
         <TruncatePath distance="1.0" input_path="{path}" output_path="{truncated_path}"/>
        </Sequence>
      </RateController>
      <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        <FollowPath path="{truncated_path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the actions of a robot in a complex environment. The robot is programmed to perform multiple tasks simultaneously and sequentially, such as recognizing people, navigating to specific locations, recharging, and searching for a person named Thomas.

The main sequence involves parallel execution of variant actions (with repetition) and a series of actions related to people recognition, robot movement, and decision-making based on the "variant" variable. If the "variant" is "one" or "two", the robot will either recharge or search for Thomas in different rooms. If neither of these conditions is met, it will continue with other variant actions.

The sub-trees handle specific tasks like recharging, searching for Thomas in two different rooms, and handling failure scenarios. These sub-trees encapsulate the detailed logic for each task, including movement, person recognition, and decision-making.

Overall, the behavior tree coordinates the robot's activities, ensuring it performs various tasks efficiently within its environment while adapting its actions based on
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Parallel threshold="1">
            <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
                <Action ID="VariantAction" value="{variant}"/>
            </Repeat>
            <Sequence>
                <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" x="5630" y="-12000"/>
                <Switch2 case_1="one" case_2="two" variable="{variant}">
                    <SubTree ID="Recharge"/>
                    <SubTree ID="Recharge"/>
                    <Fallback name="SearchThomas">
                        <SubTree ID="SearchThomasRoom1"/>
                        <SubTree ID="SearchThomasRoom2"/>
                        <SubTree ID="Recharge"/>
                    </Fallback>
                </Switch2>
            </Sequence>
        </Parallel>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Recharge">
        <Sequence name="Recharge">
            <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door8" x="23200" y="-12000"/>
            <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="10" name="GotoCharger" x="23200" y="-14800"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="SearchThomasRoom1">
        <Fallback name="Room1">
            <Sequence name="SearchRoom1">
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door2" x="7520" y="-12000"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" x="7520" y="-9040"/>
                <Action ID="getPersonPose" personname="THOMAS" x="{x_}" y="{y_}" z="{z_}"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="500" name="MoveToPerson" x="{x_}" y="{y_}"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door2" x="7520" y="-12000"/>
            </Sequence>
            <ForceFailure>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door2" x="7520" y="-12000"/>
            </ForceFailure>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="SearchThomasRoom2">
        <Fallback name="Room4">
            <Sequence name="SearchRoom4">
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door4" x="14500" y="-12000"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" x="14400" y="-9640"/>
                <Action ID="getPersonPose" personname="THOMAS" x="{x_}" y="{y_}" z="{z_}"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="500" name="MoveToPerson" x="{x_}" y="{y_}"/>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door4" x="14500" y="-12000"/>
            </Sequence>
            <ForceFailure>
                <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition" approachRadius="200" name="Door4" x="14500" y="-12000"/>
            </ForceFailure>
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <SubTree ID="Recharge"/>
        <SubTree ID="SearchThomasRoom1"/>
        <SubTree ID="SearchThomasRoom2"/>
        <Action ID="VariantAction">
            <output_port default="{variant}" name="value"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="activateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="approachLocation">
            <input_port default="1" name="locationId"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="approachWall"/>
        <Action ID="deactivateLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="getBaseCharging">
            <output_port default="{charging}" name="charging"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="getPersonPose">
            <input_port default="MARIA" name="personname"/>
            <output_port default="{x_}" name="x"/>
            <output_port default="{y_}" name="y"/>
            <output_port default="{z_}" name="z"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="initNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="loadMap"/>
        <Action ID="loadNavigationMap">
            <input_port default="navigation-map" name="mapname"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsLocation"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterBackwardsRelative"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotAbs"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterOrientateRobotRel"/>
        <Action ID="moveRoboterPosition">
            <input_port default="50" name="approachRadius"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="peoplerecognition"/>
        <Action ID="setRobotPose">
            <input_port default="0" name="x"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="y"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="yaw"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="startJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="startReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopJoystickNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="stopReactiveNavigation"/>
        <Action ID="triggerGlobalLocalization"/>
        <Action ID="objectplacement">
            <input_port default="0" name="query"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's movement towards three goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c) in a loop for three cycles. At each cycle, the robot checks for the presence of a human pose and if detected, it moves towards the respective goal. If no human pose is detected, the robot continues to the next goal in sequence. The "MoveRobot" behavior tree contains the logic for setting the goal and navigating the robot to the specified target location using the Nav2Client.

Overall, the behavior tree enables the robot to repeatedly attempt to reach the specified goals while reacting to the presence or absence of a human pose. If a pose is detected, the robot will navigate towards the corresponding goal; otherwise, it will proceed to the next goal in the sequence.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<Repeat num_cycles="3">
			<Sequence>
				<SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-4.3,-4,180.0" />
				<SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="-4.7,-6.6,270.0" />
				<SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-6.0,-4.2,206.0" />
				<Sequence>
					<ReactiveSequence>
						<Inverter>
							<HumanPoseDetect pose_lr_check="presence" expected_pose_left="" expected_pose_right=""
								detected_person="{detected_person}" pose_left_speech="{pose_left_speech}"
								pose_right_speech="{pose_right_speech}" />
						</Inverter>
						<SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
					</ReactiveSequence>
					<ReactiveSequence>
						<Inverter>
							<HumanPoseDetect pose_lr_check="presence" expected_pose_left="" expected_pose_right=""
								detected_person="{detected_person}" pose_left_speech="{pose_left_speech}"
								pose_right_speech="{pose_right_speech}" />
						</Inverter>
						<SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
					</ReactiveSequence>
					<ReactiveSequence>
						<Inverter>
							<HumanPoseDetect pose_lr_check="presence" expected_pose_left="" expected_pose_right=""
								detected_person="{detected_person}" pose_left_speech="{pose_left_speech}"
								pose_right_speech="{pose_right_speech}" />
						</Inverter>
						<SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
					</ReactiveSequence>
				</Sequence>
			</Sequence>
		</Repeat>
	</BehaviorTree>

	<BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
		<Sequence name="SetGoal">
			<Nav2Client goal="{target}" />
		</Sequence>
	</BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a system to dynamically navigate towards a specific pose while continuously replanning its path. The system updates the goal pose and computes a new path using a planner. It then truncates the computed path based on a specified distance. The robot or agent follows this truncated path using a specific controller, ensuring continuous movement until the goal is reached.

This behavior tree allows for dynamic navigation with continuous path planning and execution, ensuring that the system can adapt to changes in the environment or goal poses while maintaining smooth and efficient movement towards the target.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree follows a dynamic pose to a certain distance
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <RateController hz="1.0">
        <Sequence>
          <GoalUpdater input_goal="{goal}" output_goal="{updated_goal}">
            <ComputePathToPose goal="{updated_goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
          </GoalUpdater>
         <TruncatePath distance="1.0" input_path="{path}" output_path="{truncated_path}"/>
        </Sequence>
      </RateController>
      <KeepRunningUntilFailure>
        <FollowPath path="{truncated_path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
      </KeepRunningUntilFailure>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed to navigate a robot while replanning its global path after every 1 meter of movement. It utilizes a pipeline sequence consisting of two steps: 
1. DistanceController: This component computes a new path to the goal pose using the "GridBased" planner whenever the robot has moved 1 meter.
2. FollowPath: The robot then follows the computed path using the specified controller.

This approach ensures that the robot continuously updates its path to adapt to the environment as it moves, allowing for more efficient and dynamic navigation.
output:
<!--
  This Behavior Tree replans the global path after every 1m.
-->

<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <PipelineSequence name="NavigateWithReplanning">
      <DistanceController distance="1.0">
        <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path}" planner_id="GridBased"/>
      </DistanceController>
      <FollowPath path="{path}"  controller_id="FollowPath"/>
    </PipelineSequence>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree defines a sequence of actions for a robot to perform. It involves executing a specific set of joint states for the robot's arm, with the option to repeat this sequence multiple times. The tree also includes various other actions such as connecting waypoints, adding and attaching objects, planning, removing objects, and sensing object poses.

The main focus appears to be on controlling the robot's movements and interactions with its environment. This could involve tasks such as picking up and placing objects, adjusting joint states, and performing specific motions. Additionally, there are actions related to sensing and storing information about detected objects.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines a series of steps for the robot to follow in order to accomplish a variety of tasks involving manipulation, perception, and planning within its environment.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence name="Robot Minimal Demo">
            <Repeat num_cycles="1">
                <Sequence>
                    <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates" goal="0.9737, 1.4487, 2.0451, -0.3455, 0.0, 0.0" group_name="arm" name="pre middle left" service_name="execute_group_joint_states" tolerance="0.01"/>
                </Sequence>
            </Repeat>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ConnectWaypoints">
            <output_port name="connected_waypoints">PoseArray</output_port>
            <input_port default="connect_waypoints" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port name="waypoint1">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint2">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint3">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint4">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port name="waypoint5">Pose</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteAddBox">
            <input_port default="1" name="auto_subfix"/>
            <input_port default="box" name="box_name"/>
            <input_port default="{place_pose}" name="box_pose"/>
            <input_port default="0.2 0.2 0.2" name="box_size"/>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="1" name="is_absolute"/>
            <input_port default="execute_add_box" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteAddPlane">
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="ground" name="plane_name"/>
            <input_port default="0 0 1" name="plane_normal"/>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="plane_pose">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port default="execute_add_plane" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteAttachBox">
            <input_port name="box_name"/>
            <input_port name="box_pose"/>
            <input_port name="box_size"/>
            <input_port default="gripper" name="eef_group_name"/>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="execute_attach_box" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteDetachObject">
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port name="obj_name"/>
            <input_port default="execute_detach_object" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupAngularJointStates">
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 0" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="panda_arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="execute_group_joint_states" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupLinearJointStates">
            <input_port default="0.04 0.04" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="hand" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="execute_group_joint_states" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupManyPoses">
            <input_port name="constraint">If 'r', 'p', or 'y' is given, the eef_frame should not rotate about itself along x-, y-, or z-axis. You can combine them like 'rp', 'ry', 'py', and 'rpy'. Default ''</input_port>
            <input_port default="0.1" name="eef_step"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="goal_type">0: Pose wrt the global base frame (robot base); 1: Pose wrt the base frame transferred to current eef base position; 2: pose wrt the eef frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="goals">Goals for each waypoint to reach, seperate with ; </input_port>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name">The group providing the reference frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="execute_group_many_poses" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupPose">
            <input_port name="constraint">If 'r', 'p', or 'y' is given, the eef_frame should not rotate about itself along x-, y-, or z-axis. You can combine them like 'rp', 'ry', 'py', and 'rpy'. Default ''</input_port>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="goal_type">0: Pose wrt the global base frame (robot base); 1: Pose wrt the base frame transferred to current eef base position; 2: pose wrt the eef frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name">The group providing the reference frame</input_port>
            <input_port default="execute_group_pose" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteGroupShift">
            <input_port default="z" name="axis">Could be x y z roll pitch yaw</input_port>
            <input_port default="0" name="goal"/>
            <input_port default="arm" name="group_name"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="is_absolute"/>
            <input_port default="execute_group_shift" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0.01" name="tolerance"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecutePlanning">
            <input_port default="0" name="category">0 for large box, 1 for small box</input_port>
            <output_port name="pick_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <output_port name="place_obj_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <output_port name="place_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port name="pose">Pose</input_port>
            <output_port name="pre_pick_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <output_port name="pre_place_pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port default="execute_planning" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteRemoveObject">
            <input_port default="1" name="is_exact"/>
            <input_port name="obj_name"/>
            <input_port default="execute_remove_object" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ExecuteSuction">
            <input_port default="0" name="enable"/>
            <input_port default="execute_suction" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FetchDetectedInfo">
            <output_port name="category">String, 0 for large box, 1 for small box</output_port>
            <output_port name="pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port default="fetch_detected_info" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SenseObjectPose">
            <output_port name="category">String, 0 for large box, 1 for small box</output_port>
            <output_port name="pose">Pose</output_port>
            <input_port default="sense_object_pose" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StoreDetectedInfo">
            <input_port name="category">String, 0 for large box, 1 for small box</input_port>
            <input_port name="pose">Pose</input_port>
            <input_port default="store_detected_info" name="service_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="TypeInPose">
            <output_port name="pose_on_blackboard">Pose on blackboard</output_port>
            <input_port default="type_in_pose" name="service_name"/>
            <input_port default="0 0 0 0 0 0 1" name="type_in_pose">Pose to be typed in</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robot's navigation recovery process. The robot is programmed to recover from navigation failures using a series of recovery actions. If the initial navigation attempt fails, the RecoveryNode will retry the navigation up to 6 times.

The recovery process includes several stages:
1. NavigateWithReplanning: This stage involves resetting the navigation goal and checking progress. It also includes computing a new path to the goal, smoothing the path, and following the path while handling any feedback received during navigation.

2. RecoveryFallback: If the navigation still fails after multiple retries, the robot will perform recovery actions such as clearing the local and global costmaps, waiting for a specified duration, and backing up a short distance.

Overall, the behavior tree ensures that the robot can recover from navigation failures by attempting to replan the path, handle feedback, and execute specific recovery actions when necessary.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="6" name="NavigateRecovery">
      <ResetterNode>
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <ProgressCheckerPipeline name="NavigateWithReplanning">
          <RateController hz="0.02">
            <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="ComputePathToPose">
              <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path_coarse}" planner_id="GridBased" server_timeout="60.0"/>
              <ReactiveFallback name="ComputePathToPoseRecoveryFallback">
                <GoalUpdated/>
                <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
              </ReactiveFallback>
            </RecoveryNode>
          </RateController>
          <DistanceController distance="2.0">
            <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="SmoothPath">
              <SmoothPath path_in="{path_coarse}" path_out="{path}" smoother_id="SmoothPath"/>
              <ReactiveFallback name="SmoothPathRecoveryFallback">
                <GoalUpdated/>
                <Sequence>
                  <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmapSmoother-Context" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
                  <ComputePathToPose goal="{goal}" path="{path_coarse}" planner_id="GridBased" server_timeout="60.0"/>
                </Sequence>
              </ReactiveFallback>
            </RecoveryNode>
          </DistanceController>
          <RecoveryNode number_of_retries="1" name="FollowPath">
            <FollowPath path="{path}" controller_id="FollowPath"/>
            <ReactiveFallback name="FollowPathRecoveryFallback">
              <GoalUpdated/>
              <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Context" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
            </ReactiveFallback>
          </RecoveryNode>
          <HadFeedback name="HadFeedback_FollowPath"/>
        </ProgressCheckerPipeline>
      </ResetterNode>
      <ReactiveFallback name="RecoveryFallback">
        <GoalUpdated/>
        <RoundRobin name="RecoveryActions">
          <Sequence name="ClearingActions">
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearLocalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="local_costmap/clear_entirely_local_costmap"/>
            <ClearEntireCostmap name="ClearGlobalCostmap-Subtree" service_name="global_costmap/clear_entirely_global_costmap"/>
          </Sequence>
          <!-- <Spin spin_dist="1.57"/> -->
          <Wait wait_duration="5"/>
          <BackUp backup_dist="0.15" backup_speed="0.025"/>
        </RoundRobin>
      </ReactiveFallback>
    </RecoveryNode>
  </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines a task for a robot to fetch a bottle from the kitchen. The robot is programmed to first go to the kitchen, then find the bottle, and finally fetch it. These actions are organized in a sequence within a fallback structure, ensuring that if any action fails, the robot will resort to asking for help as an alternative. This indicates a robust decision-making process where the robot attempts to autonomously perform the tasks but has a backup plan in case of failure.

Overall, the behavior tree represents a clear and structured approach for the robot to accomplish its goal, with built-in resilience through the fallback mechanism.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Root>
            <Fallback name="FB">
                <Sequence name="S1">
                    <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
                    <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
                    <Action ID="Fetch_bottle"/>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
            </Fallback>
        </Root>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!--------------------------------------->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
        <Action ID="Fetch_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!--------------------------------------->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the actions and decisions for a robot's task execution. The robot is programmed to perform a series of tasks in a kitchen environment, primarily centered around finding and grasping a bottle.

Initially, the robot attempts to go to the kitchen. If unsuccessful, it will ask for help. Once in the kitchen, it searches for the bottle. If the bottle is found, it proceeds to grasp it. If not, it goes through a sequence of steps to compute and validate an inverse pose, then locates the bottle with confidence. If successful, it grasps the bottle; otherwise, it marks the inverse pose as not valid.

Throughout this process, the robot continuously checks various conditions such as its location, the presence of the bottle, and the validity of computed poses. It also has the option to keep running if needed.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's actions in a dynamic and adaptive manner, allowing it to navigate, search, and manipulate objects within the kitchen
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Root>
            <Fallback name="FB1">
                <Sequence name="S1">
                    <Fallback name="FB2">
                        <Condition ID="Robot_in_kitchen"/>
                        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Sequence name="S2">
                        <Fallback name="FB3">
                            <Condition ID="Bottle_found"/>
                            <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
                        </Fallback>
                        <Fallback name="FB4">
                            <Condition ID="Bottle_grasped"/>
                            <Fallback name="FB5">
                                <Sequence name="S3">
                                    <Fallback name="FB7">
                                        <Sequence name="S6">
                                            <Condition ID="Inv_pose_computed"/>
                                            <Condition ID="Inv_pose_valid"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                        <Action ID="Compute_inv_pose"/>
                                    </Fallback>
                                    <Sequence name="S4">
                                        <Fallback name="FB8">
                                            <Condition ID="Robot_at_inv_pose"/>
                                            <Action ID="Go_to_inv_pose"/>
                                        </Fallback>
                                        <Sequence name="S5">
                                            <Fallback name="FB9">
                                                <Condition ID="Bottle_located_with_confidence_x"/>
                                                <Action ID="Locate_bottle"/>
                                            </Fallback>
                                            <Action ID="Grasp_bottle"/>
                                        </Sequence>
                                    </Sequence>
                                </Sequence>
                                <Action ID="Set_inv_pose_not_valid"/>
                            </Fallback>
                        </Fallback>
                    </Sequence>
                </Sequence>
                <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
            </Fallback>
        </Root>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="Ask_for_help"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_found"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_grasped"/>
        <Condition ID="Bottle_located_with_confidence_x"/>
        <Action ID="Compute_inv_pose"/>
        <Action ID="Find_bottle"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_inv_pose"/>
        <Action ID="Go_to_kitchen"/>
        <Action ID="Grasp_bottle"/>
        <Condition ID="Inv_pose_computed"/>
        <Condition ID="Inv_pose_valid"/>
        <Action ID="Keep_running"/>
        <Action ID="Locate_bottle"/>
        <Condition ID="Robot_at_inv_pose"/>
        <Condition ID="Robot_in_kitchen"/>
        <Action ID="Set_inv_pose_not_valid"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates a robot's interaction with humans in a game scenario. The robot is programmed to perform the following sequence of actions:
1. Initially, it waits for 1 second and then enables pose detection control.
2. It tracks an object or person using specific parameters.
3. The robot spins to get localized if necessary.
4. It finds and initializes the game based on certain conditions.
5. If the game needs setup, it prompts the user through speech and verifies their response before setting up the game.
6. If the game is already set up, it proceeds to guide the user through the game by providing instructions and tracking their movements.
7. After completing the game or if the game does not need setup, the robot guides the user through the game, provides feedback, and concludes the game.

Overall, the behavior tree outlines the robot's interactions during the game, including setup, guiding the user, and providing feedback. It incorporates various sensory inputs, speech interactions, and movement
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="MainTree">
	<BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
		<Repeat num_cycles="10">
			<Sequence>
				<Delay delay_msec="1000">
					<PoseDetectionControlAction enable="true" />
				</Delay>
				<TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" detect_voice="0" turn_base="0" />

				<!-- Spin a bit to get localized in the case the initial pose was just set -->
				<RobotSpin angle="-180" velocity="0.4" />
				<RobotSpin angle="180" velocity="0.4" />

				<RobotFindInitAction game_file="robot_find_numbers.json" random_order="0" needs_init="{needs_init}" robot_pose="{robot_pose}" />

				<ForceSuccess>
					<Sequence>
						<!-- Prompt for game setup if already setup -->
						<BlackboardCheckInt value_A="{needs_init}" value_B="0" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE">
							<Sequence>
								<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Do you want to setup the game?" />
								<SpeechToTextActionClient text="{said}" />
								<TextCompareAction text="{said}" ck_for=".*(yes|yeah|okay|ok|sure|yep).*" />
								<SetBlackboard output_key="needs_init" value="1" />
							</Sequence>
						</BlackboardCheckInt>
					</Sequence>
				</ForceSuccess>

				<Fallback>
					<BlackboardCheckInt value_A="{needs_init}" value_B="1" return_on_mismatch="FAILURE">
						<Sequence>
							<TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" detect_voice="0" turn_base="1" />
							<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Game setup. I will ask you to stand at each of the locations.  Put both hands on your hips when you arrive at each location to continue." />
							<ForceSuccess>
								<Sequence>
									<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Please send in the middle of the game. After the robot aligns to you, put both hands on your hips." />
									<RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="20">
										<Delay delay_msec="2000">
											<HumanPoseDetect expected_pose_left="OnHip" expected_pose_right="OnHip" pose_lr_check="both" detected_person="{detected_person}" pose_left_speech="{pose_left_speech}" pose_right_speech="{pose_right_speech}" />
										</Delay>
									</RetryUntilSuccesful>
									<TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" detect_voice="0" turn_base="0" />
								</Sequence>
							</ForceSuccess>

							<ForceSuccess>
								<KeepRunningUntilFailure>
									<Sequence>
										<RobotFindNextStepAction item_name="{item_name}" />
										<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Please stand on " msg2="{item_name}" />
										<RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="20">
											<Delay delay_msec="2000">
												<Sequence>
													<HumanPoseDetect expected_pose_left="OnHip" expected_pose_right="OnHip" pose_lr_check="both" detected_person="{detected_person}" pose_left_speech="{pose_left_speech}" pose_right_speech="{pose_right_speech}" />
													<ObjectLocationStatusAction x="{x}" y="{y}" />
													<RobotFindSetPositionAction x="{x}" y="{y}" />
												</Sequence>
											</Delay>
										</RetryUntilSuccesful>
									</Sequence>
								</KeepRunningUntilFailure>
							</ForceSuccess>
							<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Finished setting up" />
							<TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" detect_voice="0" turn_base="0" />
						</Sequence>
					</BlackboardCheckInt>

					<Sequence>
						<Nav2Client goal="{robot_pose}" />
						<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Let's play the game!" />

						<TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" detect_voice="0" turn_base="0" />
						<ForceSuccess>
							<KeepRunningUntilFailure>
								<Sequence>
									<RobotFindNextStepAction item_name="{item_name}" />
									<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Please stand on " msg2="{item_name}" />
									<RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="200">
										<Delay delay_msec="1000">
											<Sequence>
												<ObjectLocationStatusAction x="{x}" y="{y}" />
												<RobotFindCheckStepAction x="{x}" y="{y}" />
												<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Good job" />
											</Sequence>
										</Delay>
									</RetryUntilSuccesful>
								</Sequence>
							</KeepRunningUntilFailure>
						</ForceSuccess>
						<TextToSpeechActionClient msg="Finished playing the game" />
						<TrackAction mode="Track" rate="3" detect_voice="0" turn_base="0" />
					</Sequence>
				</Fallback>
			</Sequence>
		</Repeat>
	</BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a system where a robot repeatedly performs a sequence of actions. The robot will continuously check if it is holding an item, and if not, it will look for an item and pick it up. If the robot is holding an item, it will place it down. This entire sequence will repeat indefinitely.

Additionally, there is an initialization behavior represented by the "Init" tree, which simply prints "Initialize" when executed.

In summary, the behavior tree orchestrates the robot's continuous task of picking up items if they are seen, placing them down if already held, and repeating this process without a set limit.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
            <Sequence name="">
                <Fallback name="">
                    <Condition ID="HoldingItem" name="Holding an Item"/>
                    <Sequence name="">
                        <Condition ID="SeeItem" name="See an Item"/>
                        <Action ID="Pick" name="Pick it up"/>
                    </Sequence>
                </Fallback>
                <Action ID="Place" name="Place it"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="Init">
        <Action ID="Print" message="Initialize"/>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="AlwaysRunning"/>
        <Condition ID="HoldingItem"/>
        <SubTree ID="Init"/>
        <Action ID="Pick"/>
        <Action ID="Place"/>
        <Action ID="Print">
            <input_port name="message"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="SeeItem"/>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree orchestrates the movement of three robots, each with their own set of goals. The robots are labeled as robot1, robot2, and robot3, and they are assigned specific sets of goals. Each robot operates independently and attempts to reach its designated goals in a sequence. If a robot fails to reach a goal, it retries the sequence for a specified number of attempts.

The behavior tree employs parallel processing to control all three robots simultaneously. It ensures that if one robot fails to reach its goal, it will retry the sequence before moving on to the next goal. Additionally, if a robot repeatedly fails to reach a goal, it will be redirected to a backup goal.

Overall, the behavior tree manages the navigation of multiple robots towards their respective goals, allowing for robust and autonomous operation while handling failures and ensuring task completion.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree" >
  <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
    <Sequence>
      <!-- Set goal -->
      <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="1.298;2.056;0.000" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="5.253;1.184;0.0" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="1.557;0.364;0.00" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_backup" value="0.163;0.332;0.00" />

      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_1_Goal_a" value="2.250;6.140;0.000" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_1_Goal_b" value="5.335;5.169;0.0" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_1_Goal_c" value="2.624;4.787;0.00" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_1_Goal_backup" value="0.309;4.153;0.00" />

      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_2_Goal_a" value="2.537;-1.663;0.000" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_2_Goal_b" value="5.253;-2.699;0.0" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_2_Goal_c" value="2.220;-3.666;0.00" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="nb2_2_Goal_backup" value="0.456;-3.630;0.00" />

      <!-- Set joined robot name -->
      <SetBlackboard output_key="robot1" value="" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="robot2" value="nb2_1" />
      <SetBlackboard output_key="robot3" value="nb2_2" />

      <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">  <!-- Retry once fail -->
        <Parallel threshold="3">    <!-- threshold = number of robot -->
          
          <!-- robot1 -->
          <Repeat num_cycles="-1">    <!-- repeat infinitely -->
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
              <Fallback>    <!-- set goal to Goal_backup once the Sequence below fails -->
                <Sequence>
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot1" target="Goal_a" />
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot1" target="Goal_b" />
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot1" target="Goal_c" />
                </Sequence>
                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot1" target="Goal_backup" />
              </Fallback>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
          </Repeat>
          
          <!-- robot2 -->
          <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
              <Fallback>
                <Sequence>
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot2" target="nb2_1_Goal_b" />
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot2" target="nb2_1_Goal_c" />
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot2" target="nb2_1_Goal_a" />
                </Sequence>
                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot2" target="nb2_1_Goal_backup" />
              </Fallback>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
          </Repeat>
          
          <!-- robot3 -->
          <Repeat num_cycles="-1">
            <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
              <Fallback>
                <Sequence>
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot3" target="nb2_2_Goal_c" />
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot3" target="nb2_2_Goal_a" />
                  <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot3" target="nb2_2_Goal_b" />
                </Sequence>
                <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" robot_num="robot3" target="nb2_2_Goal_backup" />
              </Fallback>
            </RetryUntilSuccesful>
          </Repeat>

        </Parallel>
      </RetryUntilSuccesful>
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>


  <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
    <Sequence name="SetGoal">
      <MoveBase robot="{robot_num}" goal="{target}" />
    </Sequence>
  </BehaviorTree>

</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree outlines the task for a robot. It begins by setting its initial pose and three goals (Goal_a, Goal_b, Goal_c). The robot then follows a sequence of actions: moving to the initial pose, then sequentially moving towards Goal_a, Goal_c, and finally Goal_b. During this sequence, it periodically checks the battery status and reacts accordingly. If the battery is low, it will execute an alarm event and return to the initial pose. 

This behavior tree emphasizes the robot's ability to navigate to specific locations while managing its power resources. If the battery level becomes critical, the robot prioritizes returning to its initial position over completing its set goals.
output:
<root main_tree_to_execute = "MainTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="MainTree">
        <Sequence>
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Initial_pose" value="-6.615;-7.224;-0.245" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_a" value="-4.550;0.0;-0.405" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_b" value="-0.107;-0.281;2.989" />
            <SetBlackboard output_key="Goal_c" value="-1.5;1.8;0.0" />
            <Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <CheckBattery wait_tick="125" />
                    <Sequence>
                        <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Initial_pose" />
                        <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_a" />
                        <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_c" />
                        <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Goal_b" />
                    </Sequence>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Sequence>
                    <AlarmEventLED />
                    <SubTree ID="MoveRobot" target="Initial_pose" />
                </Sequence>
            </Fallback>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>

    <BehaviorTree ID="MoveRobot">
        <Sequence name="SetGoal">
            <MoveBase goal="{target}" />
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree represents a robotic system that performs a sequence of actions. Initially, it waits for 5 seconds and then publishes a message "Makankosappoooo!" to the topic "special_beam_canon". The tree is designed with various nodes representing different actions such as arm control, battery checking, face detection, movement, speech generation, and more.

The WaitForXSeconds action introduces a delay before proceeding to the next action, while the StringPublisher action sends a specific message to a designated topic. Additionally, there are numerous other actions available in the system, including those related to arm control, battery status checking, face detection, movement control, speech generation, and more.

Overall, the behavior tree orchestrates a series of actions for the robot, enabling it to perform tasks such as waiting, communicating messages, controlling its arms and torso, detecting faces, moving, and interacting through speech.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Sequence>
            <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds" result="SUCCESS" seconds="5"/>
            <Action ID="StringPublisher" message="Makankosappoooo!" topic="special_beam_canon"/>
        </Sequence>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="ArmCartesian">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="pose"/>
            <input_port name="type"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ArmRoutines">
            <input_port name="gesture"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Charge">
            <input_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="CheckBattery">
            <output_port name="battery_state" type="int"/>
            <output_port name="percentage" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CheckBool">
            <input_port name="variable"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="CheckCharging">
            <output_port name="charging_state" type="int"/>
            <input_port name="service_name" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Condition ID="CompareDouble">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <Condition ID="CompareInt">
            <input_port name="A"/>
            <input_port name="B"/>
            <input_port name="Condition"/>
        </Condition>
        <Action ID="DebugAction">
            <input_port name="string" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Destroy"/>
        <Action ID="DetectFaces">
            <output_port name="faceListOut"/>
            <input_port name="face_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="FaceCounter">
            <input_port name="faceListIn"/>
            <input_port name="number_faces"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GazeAtTarget">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="fixation_pose"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GeneralActionlib">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="constants">A coma separated list of constants.</input_port>
            <output_port name="result">This is a string</output_port>
            <input_port name="variables">A coma separated list of variables.</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetFloat64">
            <output_port name="number" type="double"/>
            <input_port name="topic" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetInt16">
            <output_port name="number"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GetPoseArray">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="GiveFeedback">
            <input_port default="850" name="almost_thr"/>
            <input_port name="correct_blocks"/>
            <input_port name="incorrect_blocks"/>
            <input_port default="0" name="personality"/>
            <input_port name="score"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveBase">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="frame_id"/>
            <input_port name="goal_pose"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveTorso">
            <input_port name="angle"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ResetVars"/>
        <Action ID="SelectBlock">
            <input_port name="block_list" type="social_cues::BlockList_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <output_port name="block_pose" type="geometry_msgs::PoseStamped_<std::allocator<void> >"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list" type="std::string"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectFieldFromPoseStamped">
            <input_port name="field"/>
            <output_port name="output_val"/>
            <input_port name="pose_stamped"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SelectPose">
            <input_port name="pose_array"/>
            <input_port name="pose_stamped"/>
            <input_port name="position_in_list"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="SenseScore">
            <output_port name="score"/>
            <input_port name="score_topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="Speak">
            <input_port name="action_name"/>
            <input_port name="language"/>
            <input_port name="utterance"/>
            <input_port name="voice"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="StringPublisher">
            <input_port name="message"/>
            <input_port name="topic"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="TimerAction">
            <input_port name="s_between_success">Time (s) before this node returns SUCCESS. It will return FAILURE in the meanwhile</input_port>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="WaitForXSeconds">
            <input_port default="SUCCESS" name="result">Result after specified time: SUCCESS or FAILURE</input_port>
            <input_port default="5" name="seconds">Time in seconds</input_port>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
input:
The behavior tree is designed for a system that involves repeated sequences of actions, with the ability to handle failures and initiate replanning. The system follows a structured approach where it checks the current state against the desired sequence, performs locomotion status checks, and initiates recovery if needed. It also includes actions related to moving towards specific goals and updating the desired sequence based on the performed action.

The tree structure consists of a main loop (Repeat) that encapsulates a Sequence containing multiple actions. These actions include LTL pre-checks, force failure handling, locomotion status checks, movement actions, and updating the desired sequence. The system is designed to handle potential failures by using fallback mechanisms and retrying certain actions for a specified number of attempts.

Overall, the behavior tree represents a robust decision-making process for a system that involves complex sequences of actions, error handling, and adaptive planning based on the environment's response.
output:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<root main_tree_to_execute="BehaviorTree">
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <BehaviorTree ID="BehaviorTree">
        <Repeat num_cycles="{num_cycles}">
            <Sequence>
                <Fallback>
                    <Action ID="LTLPreCheck" ltl_state_current="{ltl_state_current}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}"/>
                    <ForceFailure>
                        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                    </ForceFailure>
                </Fallback>
                <ReactiveSequence>
                    <Fallback>
                        <RetryUntilSuccesful num_attempts="3">
                            <Fallback>
                                <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck" locomotion_status="{locomotion_status}"/>
                                <Sequence>
                                    <Action ID="RecoveryStand" locomotion_status="{locomotion_status}"/>
                                    <Delay delay_msec="5000">
                                        <Action ID="LocomotionStart" locomotion_status="{locomotion_status}"/>
                                    </Delay>
                                </Sequence>
                            </Fallback>
                        </RetryUntilSuccesful>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                    <Fallback>
                        <Action ID="MoveAction" action="{action}" move_base_finished="{move_base_finished}" move_base_idle="{move_base_idle}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
                        <ForceFailure>
                            <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3" replanning_request="{replanning_request}"/>
                        </ForceFailure>
                    </Fallback>
                </ReactiveSequence>
                <Action ID="UpdateLTL" action_sequence="{action_sequence}" ltl_state_desired_sequence="{ltl_state_desired_sequence}" nav_goal="{nav_goal}"/>
            </Sequence>
        </Repeat>
    </BehaviorTree>
    <!-- ////////// -->
    <TreeNodesModel>
        <Action ID="LTLPreCheck">
            <input_port name="ltl_state_current"/>
            <input_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStart">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="LocomotionStatusCheck">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="MoveAction">
            <output_port name="action"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_finished"/>
            <input_port name="move_base_idle"/>
            <input_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="RecoveryStand">
            <input_port name="locomotion_status"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel2">
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="ReplanningRequestLevel3">
            <inout_port name="replanning_request"/>
        </Action>
        <Action ID="UpdateLTL">
            <inout_port name="action_sequence"/>
            <inout_port name="ltl_state_desired_sequence"/>
            <output_port name="nav_goal"/>
        </Action>
    </TreeNodesModel>
    <!-- ////////// -->
</root>

instruction: You will be provided a summary of a task performed by a behavior tree, and your objective is to express this behavior tree in XML format.
